title: Service Management Analyst
description:
• Service Management Analyst
  • Customer Services & Technology Division
  • Adelaide Based, Full Time position

How will I help?

The Technology Service Desk is the voice of our internal customers and within the Service Enablement team you will be undertaking analysis, to producing insights and recommendations, that will insure there is continuous improvement of our service and increase our performance, having a real impact on our customers’ experience.

In this role you will work across two key areas: Shift Left and Automation Identification. Our Shift left strategy is to identify volume that is currently resolved by upper technical support teams that could be onboarded to be resolved within the Technology Service Desk. While Automation Identification would seek to identify instances of troubleshooting that could be transferred into a One-Click Automated Solution. The identification is the key piece here, you are not expected to also create the automation.

What will I do?

  • Liaise with stakeholders within the department and across Customer Services & Technology to understand situations and enable problems to be defined with clarity and precision, solicit requirements, and deliver actionable insights and recommendations
  • Contribute to the capability to determine insights, utilising a range of data sources, and recommendations for shift left and automation opportunities
  • Contribute to initiatives for Continuous Service Improvement
  • Perform trend analysis against agreed performance baselines
  • Contribute to the definition, review and enhancement of methods, tools, policies, and standards to meet the requirements for assigned area of responsibility

What’s in it for me?

Joining Westpac has many benefits besides building a long and stable career. You’ll be able to purchase leave to facilitate your dreams or obligations and you’ll be encouraged to participate in the community through paid volunteer leave and secondments. You’ll also be entitled to a suite of online learning, training modules and career planning tools to grow with us.

What do I need?

Essential:

  • Experience using predictive modelling to highlight insight and automation opportunities, highly desirable if this experience involves the use of Splunk
  • Experience applying machine learning techniques, statistical and data mining techniques (regression, statistical tests and proper usage, random forest, clustering, decision tree learning, deep learning text mining etc.) in solving real-life problems, preferably in ITSM domain
  • Ability to apply your skills and experience to a team early in their data journey.
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively, as part of a team
  • Ability to communicate with confidence, care and genuine interest. Taking personal responsibility for delighting your customers and building their trust.
  • Ability to present information, analysis and technical constructs to both technical and non-technical audiences

Desired:

  • Ability to establish productive working relationships with the business and strategic partner colleagues
  • Completed or in-progress tertiary qualification in Business Intelligence / Data Analytics or similar discipline
  • Knowledge and experience working with data from ServiceNow

What is it like to work in Westpac?

We aim to provide one big, supportive team to help us reach our vision to become one of the world’s great service companies. Working with us you'll discover new ways of working, and an exciting range of roles to showcase your skills. As an equal opportunity employer, we’re proud to have created a culture where people can be their best, in an environment that values diversity and flexibility. And one where everyone belongs.

How do I Apply?

Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.

As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply. The health and wellbeing of our employees is our top priority. We’ve developed clear standards to ensure our people are confident, safe and healthy whether they’re working from a Westpac Group site or working from home. These are based on expert medical advice and Safe Work Australia guidelines.

The Westpac Group has implemented an Entry to Workplace Policy that requires employees and others entering our workplaces to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by relevant dates set out in the policy (subject to applicable medical exemptions). Our employees are required to comply with the policy regardless of whether they are in customer-facing or non-customer-facing roles (as employees in non-customer-facing roles are required to attend the workplace under our Hybrid Working Strategy). Further, the Westpac Group is required to comply with State/Territory issued public health orders/directions which require relevant workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter workplaces.

By applying for this role, you acknowledge that you are aware of our Entry to Workplace Policy, and if you secure employment with us, you will be required to comply with the policy.

title: Data & Analytics Technical Consultant (Work from anywhere)
description:
Exposé is one of Australia’s leading Data & Analytics Consultancies. We have offices in Adelaide and Melbourne and team members all over Australia! We are super proud to provide a fantastic work culture, flexible working arrangements, access to leading-edge technology and projects, professional development and much more!

At exposé, culture comes first (happy employee = happy client = happy employer), and we believe that is why our amazing team are motivated to get up out of bed to come to work every day.

We are currently looking to fill multiple positions in our team at the mid to senior levels. As a consultant, you will be supported and trained to become a leading Data Specialist, involved in challenging projects from start to end. Putting your professional mark on work.

About the role:

In this role, you will work collaboratively with our team and clients to create insightful solutions to help clients make informed decisions. Use your Data Engineering skills and experience to analyse, integrate, model, and move data to create data and analytics solutions for our clients. Let’s help our clients “do better with data”!

Technical Requirements for the role:

  • Strong experience in on-premise and cloud-based technologies and creation of hybrid solutions
  • Strong Microsoft Azure Data Services experience is preferable
  • AWS or Google Cloud platform is advantageous

Conventional Business Intelligence - >4 years’ experience

  • Data integration, ETL, Data architecture, and modelling
  • Reporting
  • Database management systems (RDBMS) and its architecture
  • Semantic models (multi-dimensional)

Advanced Analytics - >2 years’ experience in one or more areas

  • IoT
  • Machine learning
  • Interactive visualisations
  • Semantic models (Tabular/Columnar)
  • Big data solutions
  • Real-time data streams
  • Mobile integration
  • Data lakes & Databricks

Other Requirements:

  • A relevant tertiary qualification is highly advantageous
  • Microsoft/AWS certifications are highly advantageous
  • Ability to solve client business problems using Data and Analytical solutions
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills are a must
  • Prior experience in client-facing roles, exceptional interpersonal & relationship building skills
  • Current police clearance or be willing to obtain one at short notice

Please note that this is not a Data Scientist role - data science experience and qualifications are a bonus. Still, we require a Technical Consultant who has the depth and breadth of skills across the entire Data Analytics landscape.

Why join Exposé?

  • Second to none culture –join our Purple Peeps Team!
  • Flexible working arrangements (you can work from anywhere in Australia)
  • Excellent employee benefits, including technology & professional development allowances and paid development days off!
  • We're a collaborative bunch that loves getting together and making a positive difference across our team and clients.
  • We are actively involved in the community, regularly hosting networking events and supporting our staff to speak at relevant forums and events.

Suppose you want to work with some of the most talented Data & Analytics technologists in the market who are genuinely passionate about what they do. In that case, this could be your opportunity to join a secure and growing consultancy.

Please apply via Seek or reach out to Oli or Caila at oliver.blaquiere@exposedata.com.au or caila.hancl@exposedata.com.au for more information and a confidential chat.

*Exposé will not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Data Analyst

  • Lead and work on a national program in healthcare
  • Flexible hours & location throughout Australia (work from home up to 60 hours per month)
  • $75-85 per hour

Public Pathology Australia advances government owned and operated pathology services across Australia.  We seek a data expert to further develop and run a national benchmarking program, which compares activity, workforce and cost across public hospital laboratories.

We are seeking a Data Analyst who will be responsible for:

  • Improving a national benchmarking program for pathology laboratories.
  • Providing data analysis for the benchmarking program and Public Pathology Australia.
  • Providing advice and improvement, supporting KPI development and reporting.
  • Providing insightful reports by use of data analytic skills.
  • Providing high level communication and engagement skills for reporting performance information internally and externally, including facilitating or presenting at workshops and forums.

Selection criteria

To be considered for this role, you will need the following skills, experience and qualifications:

  1. Tertiary qualifications relevant to the role and extensive professional experience in data analytical services in a complex organisation.
  2. Superior analytical, data extraction, processing and database modeling skills, including advanced proficiency and experience in the use of Microsoft Power BI, Excel, Access and other products, to undertake complex analysis.
  3. High level understanding of pathology tests and services and high level understanding of pathology related and/or health data systems including workforce and financial data systems.
  4. Demonstrated prominent level problem solving and reporting skills including benchmarking services, activity and cost modelling, dashboard and data visualisation reporting. Ability to process big data and provide insights for management and members.
  5. Demonstrated ability to effectively document processes and procedures including writing reports and technical manuals.
  6. Demonstrated high level  interpersonal, negotiation, written and verbal communication skills and a proven ability to build and maintain collaborative working relationships with a diverse range of stakeholders and positively interact and influence to achieve best outcomes.
  7. Proven ability in delivering results within projected and short timeframes and meeting project expectations with quality outcomes.
  • We offer an initial 1 year contract.
  • Work from home part time up to 60 hours per month.
  • $75-85 per hour.

About us: www.publicpathology.org.au

For a position description, please email contact@publicpathology.org.au .

Interested applicants are urged to apply before COB 23 May 2022 by emailing CV and response to selection criteria to contact@publicpathology.org.au .

For further information, contact Public Pathology Australia’s CEO Jenny Sikorski on 0466 576 221 , ceo@publicpathology.org.au.

title: ICT Manager - Adelaide
description:
We’re looking for an ICT Manager to provide strategic and operational leadership that enhances teaching and learning within one of RTG's customers, being a dynamic K-12 private school. This is a core leadership role within the school leading a team of RTG onsite staff as well as other remote resources. You will be responsible for planning and strategy, operational and project management, customer satisfaction, and people coaching and development.

With a strong customer mindset, you will be able to partner with the leadership at the College and across RTG to deliver a well-thought-out roadmap that considers all stakeholder requirements. You will assume ownership of the school's tech assets including vendor relationships, infrastructure, and systems. You will have an innovative approach to technology and understand how an organisation can leverage technology to more effectively continue its journey.



Why join us?

Our people are driven by the fact that we can make a difference/ an impact on something meaningful - it's more than just technology for us.

We pride ourselves on implementing physical and cultural technology change at a rate many businesses could not achieve on their own. RTG continues to provide the best customer experience, we regularly measure customer satisfaction that highlights our key strengths, as well as our improvement and development opportunities. So as we grow and develop you do too!


Key Responsibilities:
  • Lead in all aspects of digital development including the formulation and implementation of the digital strategy
  • Work alongside the senior management and chair the Technology Committee, ensuring that the technology environment is capable of supporting the objectives and goals of the business.
  • Lead the technology team and work with others within RTG to develop the strategy into an actionable plan.
  • Ensure that the technology strategy (including system selection and risk planning) is operationalised and delivered and any issues are addressed.
  • Develop an annual technology roadmap and operating budget and monitor the implementation of these to ensure that financial targets are met.
  • Drive and manage projects and service delivery activities to ensure successful delivery including ongoing support and training.
  • Lead your team to deliver consistently superior customer services that are continually improved.
  • Implement and manage operational procedures for the management of all digital systems, equipment, subscriptions, and other technologies.
  • Establish SLAs and XLAs that reflect the needs and outcomes of the client and lead the team in achieving these and building on these to outperform user expectations
About You

We would like to hear from high performers with exceptional stakeholder management skills and the desire to exceed client expectations. You will bring with you:
  • Strong leadership abilities demonstrated by experience in leading a team and developing and implementing technology strategies
  • A strategic and purpose-oriented mindset
  • Change management and project management experience
  • Demonstrated experience analysing problems and providing clarity of direction and leadership to provide solutions
  • Knowledge and experience with information systems ideally in education, in particular, school management and learning management systems but doesn't have to be
  • Demonstrated experience in successful collaboration
  • A strong interest in emerging technologies
  • Tertiary qualifications in Information and Communication Technology or Education

On Offer
  • We believe in our people, so we encourage and support their ongoing personal growth and development.
  • You’ll join a bunch of incredibly smart people, who are passionate about exceeding customer expectations.
  • We recognise employee performance and appreciate our staff efforts through awards and career growth opportunities.
About RTG
We are a long-established Australian ICT company, having built a good reputation through the delivery of quality solutions and service to our clients. We are a team that measures and deliver results to our customers. Our values include integrity, making a difference, and collaboration and we are passionate about all that we do.


Successful candidates will need to undergo a National Criminal History Check, Working with Children Check, and based on the current Rules for Authorised Workers, be fully vaccinated for Covid-19 where there is medical eligibility.

title: RQmedia - SEM expert - Google
description:
Make your mark at RQmedia - hiring experienced SEM professionals.

We are a full funnel - omni channel media agency who specialise in e-commerce.

No matter where you live, we are interested in talking to you.

This is an outstanding opportunity for an experienced SEM exec. Join RQmedia and kick our customers' performance goals.  You need to be results driven, accountable for your strategy and optimisation decisions, be a great communicator and thrive in the fast paced industry.

SEM Advertising executive will have:

  • Proven Google ads implementation for ecommerce over a number of years
  • Customer Results Oriented - the only thing that matters is meeting and exceeding our customers' business goals
  • Able to work across a large number of customers
  • Know all Google ad formats and how to optimise them

    Required as a minimum:
  • 5+ years SEM experience
  • Know Google Ads inside out - this is essential
  • Knowledge of Facebook/Instagram advertising an advantage
  • Confident presenter and communicator
  • Ability to deliver customer promises and KPIs
  • Excellent English writing ability
  • Excellent communication skills and a team player
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet scheduled due dates
  • Ability to analyse, report and act on data

If this sounds like you, and you would like to secure a position in a market-leading media agency , send your resume , a short cover letter via Seek addressing the criteria above.

This job is only open to Australian permanent residents and citizens. No Agencies please.

title: Data & Analytics Associate / Senior Associate
description:
As an Associate/ Senior Associate in our Digital Operations and Automation team, you’ll work with teams across Consulting to help clients create value at the intersection of human and digital. You’ll help some of the largest organisations across Australia and the Asia Pacific region to create value and improve the way they work; from digitising operations, shifting to contemporary operating models and ways of working, improving the way they operate, and reducing costs.

About you:

As a Data & Analytics Associate/ Senior Associate in our Digital Operations and Automation team within Digital Transformation your impact will be seen by:

  • Development of data models to help clients with tracking results of key indicators to drive greater performance outcomes;
  • Working with clients to obtain critical performance data in order to measure performance
  • Delivering crucial business insights to clients through data analytics and data visualisation, to improve performance or reduce costs;
  • Helping clients to understand operations by using a range of performance optimisation methodologies, data analysis and work with these organisations on how to respond to their rapidly changing environments;
  • Supporting colleagues with data insights and data visualisation through clear, responsive and effective communication;
  • Working in, as well as driving complex change programs

You have experience in working in a fast moving, client focused and project based environment - this may include experience working within a consulting firm or corporate environment. You also have an operational background and experience in driving performance improvement.  You will have a quantitative background with a qualification in mathematics, statistics, business intelligence, engineering or similar. You will need to have excellent analytical and problem solving skills, as well as being able to communicate effectively and impactfully with clients and stakeholders. Proficiency in some of the following toolsets is required – Microsoft Excel, PowerBI, SQL, Tableau.

You are agile, people-focused, motivated to succeed, analytically minded and commercially astute. You have strong attention to detail and exceptional standards in quality. Passionate about being at the forefront of change, you’re ready to help our Consulting teams deliver practical advice that speaks straight to the heart of client business  issues and deliver innovative results. You’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders.

You’re also keen to learn, to take up opportunities to improve your craft and continuously work towards the success of our clients. You are fascinated by the future and how the forces of change are influencing how we work, play and live. Most importantly, you’re keen and willing to learn to succeed in your role, and you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with.

For significant parts of our client base we will require Australian citizenship and eligibility to hold an AGSVA issued security clearance.

PwC is committed to the health, safety and wellbeing of our people, as well as visitors to our offices and events.

PwC has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination policy that requires all staff, contractors, clients and visitors to be fully vaccinated before they can access our offices, attend client sites, undertake work-related travel, or attend work-related events, subject to limited exemptions. For more information: https://www.pwc.com.au/about-us/notices/coronavirus.html

title: Business Analyst
description:
• Fantastic opportunity to join a rapidly growing IT department
  • Initial 12-month full-time contract based at Mile End
  • Join a tight-knit team with a fun, inclusive and supportive culture

Your new opportunity

Due to internal movement we now have an exciting opportunity available that will have you lead the bridge between the RAA Travel business and IS to understand requests for change and projects and to facilitate their scoping, investigation, design and delivery. In addition, you will:

  • Facilitate and deliver analysis outputs, including As-Is/To-Be process maps, business requirements, solution outlines, functional specifications and report specifications
  • Liaise with relevant stakeholders to facilitate high level effort estimates and solution designs
  • Undertake preliminary analysis of requests for change to understand and document their scope sufficient for high level estimation and planning
  • Assist with configuration of travel systems and provide support with analysing root cause of reported issues
  • Develop and maintain relevant process maps, forms, templates associated with business analysis

What will set you apart from the rest

At RAA we hire on cultural add first and technical fit second, however, to be successful in this role you will need:

  • Business analysis experience
  • Demonstrated knowledge of business analysis principles and practices, including technical analysis
  • Proven ability to communicate effectively with people of all levels both verbally, in writing and presentations, including the ability to produce documentation and reports of high quality
  • Demonstrated knowledge of technical analysis including data mapping, system integration and configuration of business rules in systems
  • Travel systems experience within a project is highly desirable (ie. Online booking technology, GDS, Mid-office systems)

What sets us apart from the rest

  • To ensure our employees feel valued, empowered and celebrated we provide a range of employee benefits including:
  • Free RAA premium road service & discounts on all RAA Products
  • Flexible Work Arrangements
  • Ongoing Training & Development Opportunities & Study Support Program
  • Wellbeing Facilities and Corporate Health Insurance Plan
  • On-site Cafe with Barista - plus much more!

How to apply

Simply hit "Apply for this job" to access further information found in the position description or follow the prompts to apply.

Applications Close: 9:00am Friday 27 May 2022

Please note applications may be short-listed and progressed prior to the closing date.

We're committed to building a workplace that's diverse and inclusive, where employees are embraced for their unique qualities and valued for their contributions. We believe a diverse and inclusive workplace brings out the best in everyone, and helps us to give our members better service.

Who we are -

As one of the state's largest and most iconic organisations, we're proud to make things better for members and better for our community. More than 780,000 members choose us to deliver peace of mind through our trusted range of motor, home and travel products and services. We're also one of the state's largest employers (and growing!), with more than 1200 employees working collectively with the common goal to keep our members moving.

title: Digital Platform Analyst
salary: Increase your take home pay with salary sacrifice
description:
ECH are dedicated to ensuring a seamless digital experience for staff and clients. This is a great opportunity to step into a newly formed role and help support our digital strategy.

The role

The Digital Platform Analyst will be responsible for providing technical expertise and support to promote and maximise the use of our digital platforms. Utilising your knowledge of Dynamics 365, Power Platform and SharePoint Online you will contribute to the ongoing improvement and utilisation of these platforms.

What it’s like at ECH

  • We’re proud of what we do, we’re proud of how we work together and we’re proud of the impact that ECH has on people’s lives.
  • We’re future focused. We don’t stay still. We are always in search of new ways to improve the lives of older South Australians.
  • Our people drive our success and how we work together is as important as what we deliver.
  • Diversity is in our DNA. We seek out and celebrate diversity in all its forms and tap into the richness of ideas, experiences and perspectives that it brings.
  • We grow our people. Everyone has the opportunity to grow, develop and build their career with ECH.
  • At ECH we are integrating work and life. We are embracing technology and new ways of working which support a new level of flexibility for our people.
  • Whether it be face-to-face, on-the-job or online, we love learning because we know it makes us better.

What you’ll be doing

Advising product owners and Digital team about new solution functionality, along with:

  • Provision of 2nd level support and escalation to relevant vendor
  • Delivering small platform change requests and upgrades
  • Regularly review usage of platform applications and provide advice on improvements

Who we’re looking for

An enthusiastic person who can take the initiative and has:

  • Strong communication skills, with proven experience interacting with both technical and business users
  • The ability to understand business and technical processes utilises this knowledge to problem solve
  • Demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
  • Commitment to provide exceptional customer service

But also someone who:

  • Is kind, even if they’re a bit stressed out
  • Likes what we do – caring for people in the community
  • Is dynamic and energetic
  • Is flexible and adaptable
  • Loves diversity
  • Will contribute their ideas and hard work to make ECH better every day.

Head over to our website to see the full position description

You will need

  • COVID-19 vaccination (including booster if eligible)

It’d also be helpful if you had:

  • A current Police Check

If you don’t, that’s ok, we can help with this.

More about ECH

ECH is a not-for-profit organisation in the Health Care Sector. This means that you can salary package up to $18,549 per annum to reduce your tax.  We also offer a range of perks through our Employee Benefits Program (eg. discounted gym memberships).

You will be provided with full training and support including all equipment that is required to succeed in this role.

Just in case you missed it, we love diversity at ECH. So if you’re a person living with a disability, you’re from a culturally or linguistically diverse background, part of the LGBTI community or an Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander person we definitely want you to apply for this role.

If you need more reasons to want to join ECH, have a look through our website to see the amazing ways in which we support ageing South Australians. While you are there, check out the videos on our Employment page from some of our amazing staff and hear about their jobs and why they love working for ECH.

So, if you think this might be the job for you and you feel aligned to who we are and what we do then we’d love you to APPLY NOW.

Applications close: 31 May, 2022 at 5pm, and should be addressed to Carly Sutherland, HR Officer

In submitting your application, you agree to our ECH Recruitment Process Terms and Conditions

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
About the role:

The Senior Data Analyst will contribute to the agencies strategic approach to data and insights, which includes delivering statistical advices, analyses and publications. The Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for working with disparate data sources, including financial, demographic and geospatial data sources, to extract, consolidate and analyse regulatory data for different audiences, internal and external to AFSA.

As the Senior Data Analyst, you will:

  • Actively contribute to the Data Analytics Section’s commitment to delivering high quality statistical advices, timely reports and the development of regulatory program insights.
  • Support the Assistant Director of Data Analytics to deliver statistical publications, data quality initiatives, data integrity and data analyses to internal and external stakeholders.
  • Interpret data requirements and extract regulatory program data to service ad-hoc data requests and support the development of data-driven insights.
  • Analyse datasets utilising tools like Excel, SQL and other analytical products to contribute to regulatory program insights and data integrity.
  • Develop dashboards, codify business requirements and deliver program insights using PowerBI and/or Tableau.
  • Apply data storytelling skills and communicate effectively with a diverse range of stakeholders from both technical and non-technical backgrounds.
  • Actively contribute to data sharing activities and promote data linkage initiatives by applying current privacy and data governance practices.

About you

To be successful in this role, you will have:

  • A tertiary qualification in applied finance, engineering, mathematics, statistics or other quantitative discipline.
  • Demonstrated experience (3 – 6 years) working as a Data Analyst in the financial services, regulation or other related industry delivering reports and publications.
  • Strong data storytelling and data visualisation skills, with the ability to communicate findings to a range of stakeholders.
  • Strong understanding of data management best practices and the Australian public data system.
  • Demonstrated competence in data analysis and statistical modelling using tools such as Stata, SAS, R, Python etc is desirable but not essential.

Why AFSA?

You will enjoy excellent conditions including generous superannuation (15.4%), a modern work environment, and flexibility to balance work and personal life.

We are a workplace committed to providing an environment that values diversity and supports staff to reach their full potential.

We encourage applications from Indigenous Australians, peoples from culturally diverse backgrounds and people with disabilities.

Applications Close: Sunday, 22 May 2022

title: Data Warehouse Consultant
description:
About the Company

Our client is a management consulting services company that has a great city fringe location and has clients both in the private and government sector. They are busy with lots of interesting projects and require an experienced Data Warehouse designer/developer to join the team ASAP.


About the role

As a Data Warehouse Consultant, you will bring end to end experience and skills in Data warehouse architecture, data modelling, data integration, BI and Data visualisation.

You will have experience working with various stakeholders and ability to understanding data needs for a business.

There is no specific Data Warehouse or BI technologies required as consultants often work with many technologies and able research and pick up new ones when required.


Skills and experience

  • Client Consulting experience in Data and Analytics
  • Experience delivering Data Warehouse projects, on prem or Cloud Environments
  • Knowledge in relational and big data architectures, data warehousing, data integration, data modelling, data optimisation and data analysis techniques
  • Interest and knowledgeable in Big Data, Data Ecosystem and data governance technologies
  • Knowledgeable in Cloud Data Warehouse services
  • Experienced with public cloud platforms and cloud infrastructure
  • Experienced building end to end data pipelines using on-premise or cloud based data platforms
  • Exposed to ETL/ELT and governance tools
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills



For more information or a confidential discussion, please contact Jessica Gadsby on (08) 8112 7417 quoting reference 246191.

To apply please click the 'Apply Now' button.

title: SSTP Reporting & Workforce Data Analyst
salary: Enjoy 6-weeks of leave and flexible work!
description:
Are you looking for an opportunity to utilise your data analytics and reporting expertise for a cause that will truly make a difference? ASC's recent AUKUS [link removed] partnership has resulted in the establishment of a Sovereign Shipbuilding Talent Pool (SSTP) that will build Australia's capability for the future, nuclear-powered submarine build. An industry leading and one-of-a-kind program of work that has not been seen in Australia since ASC originally built the Collins Class fleet of submarines over 3 decades ago.

This permanent opportunity is based out of Osborne, SA and will support various streams of work across the SSTP Program Management Office.

What will you need to succeed in this role?

  • Relevant qualification or;
  • Recent experience in a Data and Analytics/Workforce Reporting role,
  • Ability to effectively explore issues and develop successful solutions,
  • Ability to influence senior internal and external stakeholders,
  • Strong understanding and demonstrated ability to perform in Workforce Planning,
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel and database management,
  • Experience in the use of Power BI is desirable,
  • Operational experience in Defence, complex manufacturing, mining or construction will be highly regarded,
  • Excellent attention to detail, communication skills and problem solving skills.

As a Reporting Analyst at ASC, you will:

  • Work as part of the Program Management Office and be supported by the Workforce Planning Team.
  • Contribute to the SSTP (Sovereign Shipbuilding Talent Pool) program producing Workforce data and reporting.
  • Provide quantitative and qualitative analytics to enable the SSTP Program to make recommendations, influence key business decisions and monitor and assess the execution of the program.
  • Ensure the SSTP team have the right reporting and information to make data driven decisions and ensure ASC maintains accurate and prompt reporting to the customer – Commonwealth of Australia (CoA) to meet contractual KPIs.

Operating in a complex and diverse environment, this role requires a high degree of flexibility and responsiveness to support ad-hoc requests. Your primary focus will be within the SSTP program, however based on capability and workload you may be asked to support other programs of work within ASC.

This role requires the ability to work to deadlines that are often very tight whilst ensuring quality outcomes are provided with effective consultation in rapidly changing environments and priorities.

The incumbent will contribute to a positive people culture that values continuous improvement and develops new processes and procedures in line with the Company’s focus on ‘Lean’ thinking.

About our offer

We offer more than just a challenging and rewarding career.  We have put together a range of programs, initiatives and benefits that help empower our employees to reach their personal and professional goals to ensure their career with us is both challenging and rewarding.

  • Staff training and leadership development programs
  • Additional 2 weeks of leave
  • Paid parental leave
  • Salary sacrificing options
  • Paid defence reservist leave
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Onsite cafeteria & parking

Eligibility

The successful candidate must provide ASC with a current National Police Clearance prior as well as be eligible for an Australian Defence Security Clearance.  Access protected US Defence Technology will be taken into account in assessing an applicant's suitability for this role.

ASC also requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to ensure the safety and wellbeing of our people. If you are applying for a role at ASC please consider this new requirement when submitting your application. ASC will also adhere to any relevant health directives that may be made that affects our workforce.

If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply now. Applications close 20th May 2022. Early applications are encouraged.

title: Financial Analyst
salary: Competitive salary plus access to salary packaging
description:
Financial Analyst

Provide financial insights as part of a supportive and collaborative finance team in our new office space in the Tonsley Innovation District.
  • Full time, permanent | Hybrid working arrangements
  • Develop your skills within a supportive and collaborative environment
  • Contribute your financial knowledge in a hands-on role
About Bedford

Bedford changes the lives of people with disability by building capacity, independence, and wellbeing. We do this by providing a broad suite of NDIS support services including employment opportunities and social participation activities. We offer exceptional tailored services to meet individual goals, in the workplace and in the community. We build healthy relationships, foster skills to last a lifetime, and pride ourselves on providing hands-on support to plan all areas of our clients’ lives. Above all, we promote individual choice and control to empower people with disability to live fulfilled and happy lives.

About the Role

This full time, permanent position, reporting into the Financial Controller, is located at our Tonsley site situated within the new Innovation Precinct. With a focus on building stakeholder relationships and strong accounting knowledge this role will collaborate with finance business partners and other managers throughout Bedford.

Responsibilities include
  • Analyse and interpret past and current financial data
  • Review end of month data and provide insights to the finance business partners
  • Research and gather financial information to report on performance and trends
  • Help to develop and improve financial reporting
  • Analyse accounting standards
  • Journaling and reconciliations
  • Other duties as directed
About You

You will be a degree qualified and experienced financial analyst who holds yourself to a high standard. You will also enjoy working in a vibrant and collaborative environment with a diverse team of 20 finance professionals, who take a hands-on approach to their work and are willing to contribute to the success of others in the team.

You will also have
  • Degree qualification in Accounting or similar
  • CPA / CA (highly regarded)
  • Strong written and verbal communication
  • High level of accuracy and attention to detail
For this role the following documents must be provided prior to a formal offer of employment with Bedford Phoenix Incorporated.
  • An acceptable clearance to work in the disability sector (DHS / DCSI / NDIS)
  • A National Police Clearance (no older than six months)
  • Evidence of right to work in Australia
  • Evidence of full vaccination with a TGA-approved COVID-19 vaccine or an acceptable exemption*
What’s in it for you?
  • Generous salary packaging, up to $15,900 tax free p/a
  • Onsite parking
  • Onsite cafes and eateries
  • Contribute to an organisation that helps change the lives of people with disability
  • A new office in the Tonsley Innovation Precinct

If you would like to enquire further about this opportunity, please contact David Derrick, General Manager, Finance and Commercial on 0422 453 133 . All enquires will be treated in confidence.

Applications close 31st May 2022.

For a copy of the Position Description, please go to the careers page of our website at bedfordgroup.com.au/careers

*This position is within the disability sector and is subject to the relevant Emergency Management Directions. This currently requires proof of full COVID vaccination (two doses plus a booster) with a TGA-approved vaccine or evidence of an acceptable exemption from SA Health prior to being appointed to this role. Please visit legislation.sa.gov.au/legislation/CV19 for further information.

Bedford values diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace and encourage applications from First Nations, people with disability and people of all gender identities.

title: Corporate Finance Analyst, Analysis and Reporting
description:
• Department for Health and Wellbeing, Corporate and System Support Services – Finance, Performance Monitoring and Reporting
  • Salary: $94,176 to $99,615 – ASO6 – Full Time / Ongoing Appointment

The Corporate Finance Analyst will be:

  • Contributing to the development, implementation and maintenance of a reporting and performance framework across SA Health including the reporting and monitoring of monthly financial, activity and workforce information.
  • Contributing to the development, implementation and maintenance of a range of complex financial analyses.
  • Providing a range of timely and accurate financial and management reports including:
    • preparing monthly management reports;
    • providing specific financial information for the preparation of the monthly Portfolio Management reports; and
    • preparing a broad range of other documents, reports or submissions as required.

The South Australian public sector promotes diversity and flexible ways of working part-time. Applicants are encouraged to discuss the flexible working arrangements for this role. Appointment will be subject to a satisfactory Criminal History Check and appropriate immunisation requirements. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants are encouraged to apply. title: Systems Analyst
description:
Your Role

Be part of an organization that takes pride in making a difference within the education sector and thrives on promoting a positive work culture. Their dynamic and collaborative IT function is seeking to hire a Systems Analyst / Configuration Analyst who will partner with various stakeholders to ensure that a number of applications within their eco-system is performing at optimal levels.

You will apply your in-depth disciplinary knowledge in platforms / applications / systems configuration, in contributing to the development of new techniques, improvement of processes and work-flow within a number of applications and ensuring system configuration accurately reflects business requirements for a number of modules within multiple platforms. You will be integrating subject matter expertise to analyze complex business problems to be solved within automated systems, configure system settings and options, identify gaps and provide technical expertise to scale current systems, processes and procedures.

What critical skills are needed for you to consider someone for this position?

  • Sound experience in configuration and release management
  • Experience in supporting and maintaining Commercial-Off-The-Shelf applications and/or Software as a Service / enterprise applications and systems (ideally workforce management and/or CRM applications)
  • Knowledge and experience in the design and execution of application upgrades (including planning, test plan, execution)
  • Demonstrated ability to identify technical solutions for business problems
  • Knowledge and understanding of database technologies such as SQL or Postgres
  • Experience with the following tech (desirable):

  • SQL Server 2014, 2016, 2019
  • Azure - Service Fabric, Azure AD & DevOPS
  • Windows 7/10 & Server 2008R2 environment

Whilst the role will be based in Adelaide, our client places emphasis on flexible work philosophy.

.

.

.

To be considered for the role click the 'apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Sonia Robertson on 08 74220613 or email: srobertson@paxus.com.au and quote the above job reference number.

Paxus values diversity and welcomes applications from Indigenous Australians, people from diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds and people living with a disability. If you require an adjustment to the recruitment process please contact me on the above contact details.

title: Data Consultant (SA/WA/NT)
description:
The Australian Research Data Commons (ARDC) is a transformational initiative that is enabling access to nationally significant, leading edge data intensive eInfrastructure, platforms, skills and collections of high-quality data for the Australian research community and industry.

The purpose of the ARDC is to provide Australian researchers with a competitive advantage through data.

We are looking to welcome to the team an experienced and highly effective individual to the position of Data Consultant . You will understand the research sector in Western Australia, South Australia and the Northern Territory.  You will have experience working in a commonwealth funded research environment and be able to bring your skills and knowledge to the role to help advance the ARDC’s mission in WA, SA and the NT.

The purpose of this key role is to work at international, national, and local levels with current and prospective partners to communicate ARDC’s capabilities, identify upcoming research challenges and potential solutions, and build communities that promote best practice in activities relating to ARDC’s data, platform, infrastructure, and skills programs.

In this role you will experience a diverse range of exciting challenges in a unique and fast paced environment.  We can guarantee that no day will be the same!

The ideal candidate will have a PhD or comparable experience working in academic research and/or a thorough understanding of the research process. They will have worked in or closely with (local/national/international) research organisations and facilities and will have successfully engaged with diverse groups of stakeholders within institutions, research facilities and/or research groups.

On offer is a competitive remuneration package depending on the successful candidates skills and experience. This role is employed through the University of Adelaide and is based in Adelaide. While this role is primarily based in South Australia it is also responsible for WA and NT engagements and some national programs and domestic and international travel may be required.

You can access the Position Description here:

https://bit.ly/ARDCdataconsultant

If you would like to find out more about the role please contact:

Keith Russell, Manager Engagements on 0427 452 342 or via email keith.russell@ardc.edu.au

Applications close on Friday 10 June 2022.

To submit an application please click 'Apply for this job' and include your current CV, response to the Key Selection Criteria from the Position Description and two referees. Please address applications to Keith Russell.

No agencies please

title: Senior Business Support Analyst
description:
Senior Business Support Analyst – 23668

  • Permanent
  • Lockleys, SA but open to Sydney, NSW

How will I Help?
As a Senior Business Support Analyst, you will be working with a variety of stakeholders across the Westpac Group, you will be responsible for driving and improving Mortgage Operations customer's experience through your reports, insights, and models. Within our team, you will work closely with other business owners, technical owners, data scientists, insights analysts, data analysts and business subject matter experts to deliver analytic products and projects. Your strong technical skills and ability to automate, wrangle, transform and present data into actionable insights and advice will ensure your success in this position.

What’s in it for me?
You’ll play a significant part of the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our purpose is helping Australians succeed. So we’ll back you in the development of your career, internal career prospects, and flexible working. You’ll also keep learning to grown, backed by a fantastic team of people with a can-do, supportive structure.

What do I need?
The ideal candidates should be passionate and curious about using analytics and data in different novel ways to help our business grow, have a curious, growth mindset, and be able to work in a high-impact fast environment.

Knowledge

  • Bachelor or post graduate qualification in Computer Science, Mathematics or Statistics preferred
  • A strong understanding of technology and business systems strategically and operationally
  • Knowledge of financial services and operation disciplines

Experience

  • 4+ years of experience in creating and maintaining dashboards, datasets and reports for business stakeholders.
  • Ability to extract actionable insights and create presentations for non-technical business stakeholders
  • technical solution design: ability to convert and explain business problems into technical specifications
  • Experience in collaborating with cross functional teams to deliver outcomes for business stakeholders. Ability to present and communicate to both technical and business stakeholders
  • Technical proficiency in the below domains:
    • analytics, data wrangling, ETL and understanding of analytical databases (not limited to)
      • Coding: SQL, SAS, Python, R, or other
      • Microsoft: Excel, VBA, Powerpoint, Power Platform
      • Database experience: Teradata, IBM DB2, Sybase
    • Visualisation and/or front end application development: Tableau, Qliksense/Qlikview, Power BI

Optional

  • Statistical and mathematical understanding in model building,
  • Cloud & Big Data: Azure/AWS, Spark, HBase, HDFS

What is it like to work there?
We aim to provide one big, supportive team of people who love helping others succeed. Working with us you'll discover new ways of working, and an exciting range of roles to showcase your skills. As an equal opportunity employer, we’re proud to have created a culture where people can be their best, in an environment that values diversity and flexibility. And one where everyone belongs.

How do I Apply?
Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.

As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.

The health and wellbeing of our employees is our top priority. We’ve developed clear standards to ensure our people are confident, safe and healthy whether they’re working from a Westpac Group site or working from home. These are based on expert medical advice and Safe Work Australia guidelines.

The Westpac Group has implemented an Entry to Workplace Policy that requires employees and others entering our workplaces to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by relevant dates set out in the policy (subject to applicable medical exemptions). Our employees are required to comply with the policy regardless of whether they are in customer-facing or non-customer-facing roles (as employees in non-customer-facing roles are required to attend the workplace under our Hybrid Working Strategy). Further, the Westpac Group is required to comply with State/Territory issued public health orders/directions which require relevant workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter workplaces.

By applying for this role, you acknowledge that you are aware of our Entry to Workplace Policy, and if you secure employment with us, you will be required to comply with the policy.

title: GIS Analyst
description:
• Career opportunity at Beach Energy
  • Provide support across the business
  • Adelaide based

We now have an opportunity for a GIS Analyst to join Beach Energy in our Adelaide office. This role will provide cartographic content for internal/external stakeholders, building maps using Geographic Information Systems (GIS) to support business functions for incorporating location intelligence across the business.

About the Role

You will be required to manage spatial data, location intelligence services and provide technical support to the users by ensuring data integrity, efficient workflows, and integration of spatial data across the company. In addition, this role is required to support the Web GIS functions at Beach Energy (ArcGIS Enterprise) including the Web Portal management.

Key responsibilities will include:

  • Developing high quality maps with advanced cartographic and mapping functions, according to the energy industry standards for supporting the diverse stakeholder business groups at Beach Energy.
  • Proficiency in the use of GIS to develop multi-purpose maps using ArcGIS PRO with advance spatial analysis, geoprocessing tools and automated spatial data transformations for supporting the regular operations and decision support systems.
  • Establishing positive and productive working relationships with key stakeholders to understand the spatial information requirements for creating custom maps, spatial datasets for maintaining an efficient spatial information services.
  • Prioritising mapping functions and spatial information services in busy office environment for achieving the highest business performance.
  • Supporting the spatial system for Portal data management and maintaining a series of Apps and dashboards for 24/7 operations.

About You

We are looking for a technically proficient individual with extensive experience in GIS and mapping functions. To be successful, you will need a practical knowledge of the ESRI - ArcGIS product suite and the ability to effectively use geoscience software including Petrosys/DBmap.

  • Extensive experience in a similar role with exposure to advance mapping functions and spatial information service delivery is essential.
  • Expertise on advance spatial data management and effective information visualizations in spatial context.
  • An ability to work unsupervised and to prioritise workloads, meet deadlines and work under pressure.

Previous experience in the oil and gas industry is desirable or a demonstrated ability to quickly pick up technical language and a strong interest in the industry is essential.

Finally, you must be a team player, well presented and above all an exemplary communicator.

If you are a highly motivated, enthusiastic person and have a desire to contribute to a professional and inclusive team then apply now.

About Us

Beach Energy is a proud South Australian, Energy exploration and production company headquartered in Adelaide.

For more than 60 years, Beach has operated onshore and offshore, oil and natural gas production across South Australia, Western Australia, Victoria, and New Zealand.

We seek to deliver long-term value to our shareholders, and focus on the safety of our people, their work environment, and the sustainability of our practices and environment we work in.

Working with Beach, you will make a difference in the delivery of key oil and gas projects within a growth organisation.

At Beach our values govern our decisions and interactions. Our values are Safety, Creativity, Respect, Integrity, Performance and Teamwork .

How to Apply

Beach is committed to improving gender diversity and Indigenous participation; we encourage all applications.

Please submit your cover letter and updated CV by 1 June 2022.

For this opportunity you must be an Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident.

To keep our community safe, candidates are required to comply with COVID related state specific public health orders.

title: Logistics Analyst
description:
We’re on a quest to improve everyday life for millions of people and the world around us. To reinvent the way we cook, clean, and care. It is embodied in everything we do. Every idea, product and human interaction. The trend hunters who want to revolutionise the fashion industry. The foodies who strive to make taste an experience. The health enthusiasts who search for ways to make our environment even cleaner and brighter for today and the future.

Join us to create solutions and experiences that enrich daily lives and the health of our planet.

Your Role

Carefully planning and running the logistics schedules as part of a close-knit team, you will also balance the needs of stakeholders and colleagues across all functions to ensure the efficient transportation of products. It’s a dynamic, responsible role that requires a flexible approach to changing priorities, delivering solutions and looking ahead to see how we can deliver even better for our customers. You will have an up-to-date view of production and material in transit as well as business strategic priorities to ensure financial goals are met.

A Typical Day

As a Logistics Analyst you will be responsible for logistics planning to ensure the smooth flow of internal and external material for Dudley Park manufacturing operations. Your objective will be to ensure high levels of customer service ensuring Electrolux meets its financial goals through scheduling and delivery of materials on time to production.  You will be part of various functions within the logistics team that may involve Kanban scheduling, electronic ordering, scheduling, shortage reporting and follow up. Your day may include:

  • Prepare and review low stock reports
  • Create, review and analyse component requirements
  • Monitor goods receiving
  • Manage Direct to Site suppliers
  • Follow through urgent order from point of dispatch to line side delivery
  • Monitor stock and correct stock discrepancies
  • Maintain record of supplier decks and maintain supplier deck details
  • Maintain accurate Logistics Lead times within the corporate database
  • Manage cost KPI’s as per Business Plan Development
  • Periodically review freight methods and rates for most practical and cost- effective methods
  • Prepare stock reports
  • Report on shortages to the factory through the daily components meeting
  • Liaise and work closely with other departments including Production, Manufacturing Engineering and Purchasing

Core Competencies

Agile – You work with urgency, analysing and adapting to different situations, quickly understanding changes and reacting confidently and decisively.

Analytical – With an eye for detail and the ability to interpret complex data, you can also translate this into meaningful, useful information that informs decision-making.

A Self-Starter – You can join the dots to take us from where we are to where we want to be, mapping the clear routes and strategies essential to achieving our goals.

Organised – You set the pace and the priorities, and then you bring a methodical approach to meeting your goals.

Collaborative – You build trust, good working relationships and communicate effectively with your colleagues and across functions.

Who You Are

  • Good working knowledge of global shipping practices
  • Experience in a global project involving multiple stakeholders including suppliers, freight forwarders via web-based applications
  • Ability to work under pressure
  • Good planning and organisational skills
  • Tertiary qualification in logistics, material planning or similar discipline
  • Computer skills with high competence level in Microsoft Office Suite including Excel, Word, Access etc

Keeping you Healthy and Safe

We want you to return home in even better shape than when you started, so we need you to help us do this by making sure you follow a few simple steps. We need you to:

  • Make sure you take reasonable care for your own health and safety, and
  • Take reasonable care that what you do (or what you don’t do when you should have) doesn’t affect the health and safety of others, and
  • Follow reasonable instructions that we might give from time-to-time, such as reporting incidents and hazards, and
  • Follow policies or procedures, so long as it’s reasonable and we’ve told you about it, and
  • Attend training that helps you to work safely

Company Description

Electrolux is a leading global appliance company that has shaped living for the better for more than 100 years. We reinvent taste, care and wellbeing experiences for millions of people, always striving to be at the forefront of sustainability in society through our solutions and operations. Under our brands, including Electrolux, AEG and Frigidaire, we sell approximately 60 million household products in approximately 120 markets every year. In 2020 Electrolux had sales of SEK 116 billion and employed 48,000 people around the world. For more information go to www.electroluxgroup.com.

title: Business Analyst -Digital Analytics
description:
• Phenomenal Career progression opportunities available
  • Permanent Opportunity

How will I help?

As the Business Analyst, you will be joining our vibrant Digital Team within Customer Assist where your role is paramount to helping contribute the delivery of Westpac’s vision and strategic priorities. You will plan and lead digital communication channels through various campaigns and in BAU. Your role will be critical to the Collections team as you navigate across the bank to drive towards achieving premium consumer experience at every level, both to internal and external stakeholders.

You will be collaborating with Product Owners to conduct stakeholder analysis, eliciting requirements from key stakeholder groups through a variety of facilitation methods including interviews and workshops. You will analyse, identify, and recommend approaches to deliver the goals and objectives of project and business initiatives, build solutions, develop, and document detailed business process specifications, business requirements and system functional/non-functional specifications and review and revise documentation in light of any new information. Your focus to role will be on delivering Email as a channel, own and build out a roadmap for Westpac Live, collaborate across team, and be the point of contact with ISG and Group Digital to identify current and new digital channels that Digital Collections can built towards.

What’s in it for me?
You will play an important and significant part in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our vision is to become one of the world’s great service companies. So, we will back you in the development of your career, with internal career prospects and flexible working. You will also be backed by a fantastic team of people in a can-do, supportive structure.

What do I need?

  • Experience as a Business Analyst
  • Demonstrated understanding of Business Analysis Frameworks and/or methodologies.
  • Exemplify a high level of self-motivation, organisation, and communication.
  • A well founded understanding of technology and business systems strategically and operationally.

What is it like to work there?
We aim to provide one big, supportive team of people who love helping others succeed. Working with us you'll discover new ways of working, and an exciting range of roles to showcase your skills. As an equal opportunity employer, we’re proud to have created a culture where people can be their best, in an environment that values diversity and flexibility. And one where everyone belongs.

How do I Apply?

Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.

As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.

The health and wellbeing of our employees is our top priority. We’ve developed clear standards to ensure our people are confident, safe and healthy whether they’re working from a Westpac Group site or working from home. These are based on expert medical advice and Safe Work Australia guidelines.

The Westpac Group has implemented an Entry to Workplace Policy that requires employees and others entering our workplaces to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by relevant dates set out in the policy (subject to applicable medical exemptions). Our employees are required to comply with the policy regardless of whether they are in customer-facing or non-customer-facing roles (as employees in non-customer-facing roles are required to attend the workplace under our Hybrid Working Strategy). Further, the Westpac Group is required to comply with State/Territory issued public health orders/directions which require relevant workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter workplaces.

By applying for this role, you acknowledge that you are aware of our Entry to Workplace Policy, and if you secure employment with us, you will be required to comply with the policy.

title: Data Engineer
description:
• All Systems GO! Be part of the next generation of defence technology
  • Design, build and preparation of data platforms using Tableau and other visualisation tools
  • Enjoy flexibility , engaging work and a culture that embraces diversity and open-mindedness
  • This role could be  based in Adelaide or Melbourne.

At BAE Systemswe are all systems go as we continue to drive innovation and seek passionate and talented people to join our business. We currently have a unique opportunity as a Data Engineer within our Central Business function, the role could be based in Adelaide, SA or Melbourne, Victoria.

What this opportunity will mean for you:

  • Purposeful work where your efforts are recognized in an environment where you can thrive
  • Joining an organisation that is passionate about developing some of the most impressive careers in the world
  • Industry-leading flexibility options to unlock the talent and diversity of every individual
  • Unique opportunities to contribute to programs of national significance whilst growing your skills
  • A strong safety culture, inclusive teams and work to be proud of, underpinned by a compelling set of values

Your new role:

As the Data Engineer , you will be responsible for the design, build and preparation of data platforms and the associated integration from systems of record to facilitate analysis, visualisation and communication of data and analytics.

You will interact with business and IT teams and Senior Stakeholders on a regular basis to support them and the broader business by providing guidance on reporting and analytics dashboard design and build to facilitate accurate and timely reporting, insights, and analysis to better inform their decision-making.

You will provide advice and coaching on taking evidenced based approaches and undertake detailed analysis of prioritised analytics programs.

In terms of specific responsibilities, you will:

  • Ensure integrity of any integration between source systems/systems of record and relevant data platforms
  • Ensure efficient, sustainable and best practice design and build of data platforms to facilitate efficient analysis
  • Ensure security requirements are adhered to and appropriate data sets are available to relevant teams and users within our company so as to ensure our Commonwealth obligations are met and adhered to
  • Liaise with key stakeholders to assist them to communicate and interpret reporting to support decision-making.
  • Work with relevant stakeholders and provide guidance on data structures to deliver impactful reporting and analytics.
  • Provide coaching, training and guidance to the data and information community on data and analysis.
  • Provide thought leadership towards key enterprise wide dashboards and analytic solutions
  • Stay up to date with the latest analytics methods and data model design practices
  • Development and continuous improvement of enterprise data management for effective use of analytics and reporting solution
  • Design and change management of enterprise database structures and data extraction and loading.
  • Work with user community to ensure agreed frameworks and governance is adhered to
  • Address Ad hoc data queries from senior stakeholders as required (ELT).
  • Engage with internal and external stakeholders to develop suitable solutions.

About you

As an ideal applicant for this opportunity, you'll have:

  • Demonstrated experience working as Data Engineer
  • Broad experience with Tableau tools including server administration of Tableau with Server and Data Administration and Management
  • Significant experience in designing solutions to capture, transform and analyse large and complex data sets. ODI and Informatica are an advantage
  • Significant experience in designing and maintaining data repositories to allow data to be analysed quickly and efficiently within the agreed governance frameworks
  • Proven track record of success working on analytics projects
  • Broad experience with any of the Analytics tools (ideally with Tableau, but other tools like Qlik or Power BI will be considered)
  • Experience in designing, implementing and extending data mart & warehouse solutions
  • Experience in the implementation of Analytics Solutions that incorporate Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence
  • Experience in managing internal customers and devising fit for purpose governance models around reporting and data
  • Experience in managing and leading Analytics Communities of Practice
  • Experience in Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) will be an advantage
  • Experience in Oracle E-Business Suite will be an advantage

A Degree level qualification in IT disciplines related to data management and database management and design is desirable in the role.

Clearances

As Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and eligible to obtain and maintain appropriate clearance.

International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) are applicable and as such, your nationality may be a factor in determining your suitability for this role.

Further information regarding clearances is available at: https://careers.au.baesystems.com/opportunity.html

Applications should be addressed to: Calvin Ebenezer - Talent Acquisition Specialist - IM&T and made online here. Confidential enquiries are welcome via email: calvin.ebenezer@baesystems.com

Please be aware that pursuant to different State government health directions, vaccination mandates regarding your ability to attend our Company sites may be applicable.  Please be prepared to discuss your vaccination status with our recruiters as part of the recruitment process.

We are a 2021 Circle Back Initiative Employer - we commit to respond to every applicant.

Our culture

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive environment where our people can thrive. For us that means ensuring that the voices and talents of our employees are valued and that everyone has a sense of belonging. We do not tolerate discrimination because of differences, such as age, ability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, religion, or sexual orientation.

If you would like to know more information about how we are supporting our employees, you can view our policies and initiatives via this link .

To learn about other employment opportunities at BAE Systems, please visit: www.baesystemscareers.com.au

title: Energy Services Analyst
description:
Who we are:

SA Power Networks delivers energy solutions to empower South Australia today and in the future.  We are always seeking to build a more sustainable, efficient and innovative business that creates real value for our customers.

As one of the State’s largest employers, we have a commitment to integrity and take pride in doing the right thing for our people, customers and community.

Progress your career and help us in empowering South Australia.

The Role

The Energy Service Analyst will be responsible for monitoring, reporting and identifying opportunities for compliance issues that are directly actionable by the customer, supporting existing and upcoming State Government Regulatory requirements.

Other key objectives of the role include.

  • Provide specialised analyst support to all new Distributed Energy Resource projects that require integration with embedded generation systems and processes, to ensure consistent customer experience
  • Generate actionable insights from Distributed Energy Resource compliance monitoring, and effectively communicate to key stakeholders
  • Provide specific Distributed Energy Resource training, change support and uplift capabilities of New Energy Service team, Customer Services and other business units as required

What you will need:

  • Bachelor of Business and/or the equivalent level of skills and knowledge gained through experience.
  • Minimum 4 years specific industry experience.
  • Some out of hours work may be required
  • Some intrastate travel may be required

What we offer

Many of our salaries are positioned well above industry standard, with this role offering a starting annual base salary of $ 110,048.

Other benefits of working at SA Power Networks:

  • Flexible work culture, including flexi time and work-from-home arrangements
  • 11% superannuation (above current legislated employer contributions)
  • Up to $700 in electricity reimbursements each year
  • 17.5% leave loading payable on annual leave
  • Automatic coverage from SAPN’s income protection scheme
  • Paid parental leave (4 weeks) and maternity leave (12 weeks)
  • Additional personal leave p/a

We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Our Employee Foundation offers opportunities for our people to support official charity partners, as well as to lead fundraising initiatives for additional causes important to them.

Candidates will need to be prepared to undertake a pre-employment medical.

SA Power Networks does not currently have a mandatory vaccination policy, however this is subject to ongoing review as necessary from time to time.

Full vaccination and the ongoing maintenance of this status is strongly recommended in-line with government advice.

To obtain further details please contact Rebecca Reed on 0407 809 406

Applications required by 20 May 2022 5:00pm

How to Apply

To apply click ‘Apply for this job’.

SA Power Networks is an Equal Opportunity employer.

title: Analyst Programmer
description:
• Department for Health and Wellbeing, Digital Health SA – Technology and Infrastructure, Application Services
  • Salary: $82,042 to $91,245 – ASO5 – Full Time / Ongoing Appointment

Your new company
The mission at SA Health is to lead and deliver a comprehensive and sustainable health system that aims to ensure healthier, longer, and better lives for all South Australians. They aim to achieve their objectives by strengthening primary health care, enhancing hospital care, reforming mental health care, and improving the health of Aboriginal people.

SA Health is committed to a health system that produces positive health outcomes by focusing on health promotion, illness prevention and early intervention. SA Health work with other government agencies and the community to address the environmental, socioeconomic, biological and behavioural determinants of health, and to achieve equitable health outcomes for all South Australians.

Your new role
The Analyst Programmer is responsible to the Manager, Application Development for coordinating and undertaking application and interface development, application maintenance, analysis, design, and programming functions services.

The role delivers a range of technical planning, design, implementation, coding and testing activities, ensuring methodical development, using agreed workflow processes under a defined Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).

What you'll need to succeed

  • Experience with C# .NET with .NET core.
  • Experience with JavaScript frameworks such as jQuery, AngularJS, and React.
  • Experience with Microsoft SQL Server 2012-2016 .
  • Knowledge of working in an Agile environment.
  • Great interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Some experience writing accurate technical documentation.
  • Some experience working with Azure DevOPS/GIT
  • The ability to provide support to team members and stakeholders
  • Experience in delivering application development and administration services and functions to support complex computer systems within a large organisation including providing technical advice and producing and maintaining a broad range of technical and user documentation.
  • Experience in coordinating and providing maintenance services for business-critical computer software systems in a multiuser environment including utilising a variety of tools, operating systems, and programs to conduct system testing, maintenance and reporting.
  • Experience in the use of systems analysis and design, structured programming, and data analysis methodologies, analysing business requirements for system enhancements and providing accurate estimates for the delivery of all activities in the Software Development Life Cycle.
  • Proven knowledge of ITIL the Software Development Life Cycle and project management processes and methodologies and knowledge of relevant government ICT policies and agency program activities.

The South Australian public sector promotes diversity and flexible ways of working part-time. Applicants are encouraged to discuss the flexible working arrangements for this role.
