  • International Applicant Guidelines

title: Text Analytics Team Lead Executive Level 2 (S&T Level 6)
description:
Text Analytics Team Lead

  • Inspire and mentor a small team of text analytics researchers and engineers
  • Contribute to innovation of scientific research in a Defence environment
  • Enjoy flexible working arrangements

This exciting role involves inspiring a small high-performing team of scientists and researchers that contribute to the development of science and technology in the domains of multilingual text and content analytics to high international standards. The ideal applicant will have experience and a passion for computational linguistics. You will represent DSTG on Australian and international groups within the text and content analytics domains. This role will contribute to a culture of innovation that drives our More Together: Defence Science and Technology Strategy.

As the Text Analytics Team Lead, you will:
Lead a research program to develop multilingual text analytics for processing, enriching and translating unstructured text content; as well as build linguistic resources, language models and advanced content analytics solutions.

  • Develop initiatives on priority science areas relating to multilingual text and content analytics for Defence and national security agencies.
  • Provide high-level technical and administrative advice in the field of multilingual text and content analytics.
  • Supervise and mentor staff to promote a healthy culture that values staff, innovation and excellence in science.
  • Manage allocated resources, set work area priorities, manage workflows, develop strategies and evaluate business outcomes.
  • Manage stakeholder relationships and play a key role in building relationships with Defence and national security agencies, and their international equivalents, as well as academia and industry.
  • Report research findings to Defence partners and the scientific community through high quality scientific reports, briefs, publications and presentations.

About our Team
Intelligence, Surveillance and Space Division (ISSD) undertakes internationally-recognised research and development into technologies aimed at enhancing national capability for Defence and national agency decision makers.

The role is within Identity Intelligence group, within Intelligence Analysis branch in ISSD.

Identity Intelligence works closely with Defence and other elements of Australia’s national power to deliver tools and technologies that better prepare Defence to respond to grey-zone activities. The group enhances Defence’s video, imagery, and multilingual text and speech capabilities to identify and characterise persons of interest and detect misinformation and disinformation within contested information environments. The group also aims to understand and defend the vulnerabilities inherent in deploying new identification technologies and the information they are applied to.


Our Ideal Candidate
We are looking for a motivated team player who is able to understand the broad strategic context and has sound stakeholder engagement skills.


To succeed in in this role, you must be able to demonstrate the following:

  • Specialised knowledge and research experience in multilingual text and content analytics to generate new knowledge and produce enhanced capabilities for clients and sponsors.
  • Ability to lead the development of Science & Technology (S&T) initiatives.
  • Ability to think strategically, problem solve and operate with considerable autonomy to achieve corporate impact.
  • Sound communication skills, both written and verbal, with an ability to foster effective stakeholder relationships.
  • Adaptability and resilience in a dynamically changing environment.
  • Working collaboratively across different teams, harnessing diverse views and encouraging an inclusive team culture.
  • Supervise, mentor and develop staff.
  • Commitment towards ongoing self-improvement and professional development.

Application closing date: Sunday the 29th of May 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, Reference DSTG/02005/22 on

https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=9C7896E7-2B42-0DDB-D044-C88BE12833E2

title: Systems Analyst
description:
The opportunity

Silver Chain is currently looking for a Systems Analyst to administer, support and provide technical excellence to the users of SharePoint, internal Silver Chain Intranet and Nintex forms and flow within the operational framework used in Digital Services, while always delivering exceptional customer experience and satisfaction. This opportunity is available in either Adelaide or Perth.

Key Responsibilities

  • Administer and support the day-to-day operations of the systems/systems supported including managing upgrades, administration, security and regular maintenance to ensure the systems are operating optimally.
  • Develop and improve the system/systems support to meet operational efficiencies and organisational goals.
  • Provide technical support and advice on system/systems, to ensure optimal use of the system/systems and the system/systems are utilised as expected/as per standard operating procedures.
  • Review and co-ordinate business process re-design to meet the changing requirements of the business and to ensure contract deliverables can be met effectively and within budgetary guidelines.
  • Develop systems/interfaces and processes to support business growth and change. Document requirements or contribute to the development and maintenance of user manuals.
  • Prepare testing schedules and support user acceptance testing environments prior to a system upgrade or migration.
  • Undertake upgrades, patching and hotfixes to the system/systems supported.
  • Maintain a development and configuration audit trail for all production releases and changes to ensure strict compliance and traceability.
  • Monitor and actively ensure the incidents, service requests and demands assigned to the team that relate to the system/systems supported are resolved within the timelines defined by the relevant service and /or operational level agreements so that customer expectations are achieved and where possible exceeded.

About you

To be successful in this role, you will possess the following:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Information Technology or related field are essential.
  • Well-developed communication skills (written, verbal and listening) and interpersonal skills to communicate at all levels and achieve project outcomes.
  • Demonstrated extensive experience working with SharePoint, SharePoint Online and Nintex environments to support existing solutions, as well as the ability to review current state operations and make recommendations for improvement.
  • Demonstrated problem solving and analytical skills to review, analyse and recommend solutions on complex issues and to troubleshoot and respond to daily problems.
  • Demonstrated project management experience, with planning, organisational and time management skills to ensure project deadlines are met within tight budgetary and strict timelines.

Benefits

  • Extensive Health & Wellness initiatives
  • Flexible working, which includes working from home & office!
  • Salary packaging of up to $18,550
  • Health Care benefits
  • Social Club – discounted tickets for movies, the zoo and more (dependant on location)

How to apply

To submit your application, and to view a copy of the Position Description, click ‘Apply’.

Based on Silver Chain Group Policy and State Government Directions, you will be required to provide evidence of your COVID-19 vaccinations, including booster requirements, or evidence of a medical exemption, to be considered for employment with Silver Chain.

At Silver Chain Group, we recognise the positive contribution that a diverse workforce makes to our organisation where individuals can be authentic, are respected and celebrated. We strongly encourage applications from Indigenous Australians, people of all ages, gender, abilities, culturally diverse and linguistic backgrounds.

About Silver Chain Group

At Silver Chain Group, we are proud members of the Diversity Council of Australia and our greatest strength is our people. Driven by our values of integrity, respect, trust and compassion, we aspire to create a better home care system for all Australians. With a proud history of more than 125 years, Silver Chain Group is an employer of choice and the leading provider of high-quality health and aged care in the homes and communities.

Join our team of more than 4,450 staff, caring for more than 105,000 clients across Australia. We’ll provide you with opportunities to help you develop and grow in your career, with training and education programs to help you achieve your goals.

We reserve the right to commence the recruitment process and extend or withdraw this advertisement prior to the closing date. Please note that unsolicited applications from agencies will not be accepted.



Applications Close: 23/05/2022 12:00:00 AM

title: Business Analyst
description:
Business Analyst

• Pharmaceutical Wholesaler
• Exciting opportunity with working in Keysborough VIC or Underdale SA
• Full Time Position

EBOS Group is the largest and most diversified Australasian marketer, wholesaler and distributor of healthcare, medical and pharmaceutical products. It is also a leading Australasian animal care products marketer and distributor.

With more than 3,500 employees in 61 locations across Australia and New Zealand, EBOS Group is a major contributor to the healthcare of millions of people throughout the region and a leader in animal care.

Founded on a philosophy of growth and fresh thinking, EBOS Group strives for leadership in its business segments. By valuing its people and its partnerships, the Group is well positioned to expand further through a combination of acquisitions and organic development.

Symbion delivers a full range of products and services to branded and independent pharmacies around Australia. As a leader in its field, Symbion embraces the latest in technology and operates one of the country's most comprehensive national warehousing and distribution networks.

An exciting opportunity exists in this growing Company for a Business Analyst to join the National Supply Chain team with flexibility working in Keysborough VIC or Underdale SA.

As a member of this dynamic business-critical team, your tasks will include

  • Analytical support to the business unit
  • Develop intuitive reporting & information solutions to support business decisions
  • Ensuring success of Supply Chain processes & initiatives
  • Completion of routine daily, weekly & monthly tasks
  • Ensuring the timely and appropriate flow of critical information to stakeholders

To be successful in this role you will need:

  • Advanced skills in SQL server. Able to write complex SQL queries.
  • Significant experience in MSBI stack (SSRS, SSIS and SSAS).
  • Experience working with large datasets, able to analyse data, prepare and interpret reports and communicate actionable results, findings and recommendations.
  • Power BI/Tableau would be advantageous
  • Experience in Analytics with a Supply Chain, inventory, demand planning, pharmaceutical or FMCG background would be beneficial, but not necessary.

You must also have tertiary qualifications in either IT or a business related discipline, possess strong interpersonal skills and have a proactive approach to working as part of a high performance and highly interactive team.

This represents an excellent opportunity for an aspiring individual who seeks to work with Australia’s largest pharmaceutical wholesaler.

This is a unique opportunity to work in a company where you are valued, given the recognition you deserve and suitably rewarded for your hard work.

EBOS Group is committed to developing and creating an inclusive workplace that embraces and celebrates diversity and inclusion.  We recognise that a diverse workplace improves our ability to attract, retain, motivate and develop talent, create an engaged workforce, deliver quality services to our customers and to support the growth of EBOS Group.

EBOS is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from people of all ages, nationalities and cultures including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.

Pre-employment checks may be required and will be discussed with the successful candidate.

If you believe that you have the necessary attributes to succeed in this challenging and rewarding role please click the 'Apply Now' button.

title: Change Analyst
description:
Greater Bank is transforming, adapting and rethinking banking. We are progressing through an exciting growth phase, having endorsed a Merger Implementation Agreement with Newcastle Permanent Building Society to explore merging both organisations; creating one of the largest customer-owned banking organisations in Australia and a regional powerhouse for Newcastle.

The merged organisation will have a customer base of approximately 600,000 and combined assets of $19.7 billion. Pooling our resources and combining our investments will enable us to better innovate; to develop and deliver new banking technologies our customers want today and will need in the future.

About the role | 12 Month Fixed Term Contract

This position is key to support staff during a time of change as we embark on becoming one legal entity, while continuing to operate as two iconic brands.

As the Change Analyst, you will support the Organisation Change function by identifying the impacts resulting from change to people, process, systems and culture. The role supports the delivery of project benefits through the management of behavioural change and process adoption and is flexible in supporting organisational change.

Additionally you will:-

  • Conduct change impact assessments to identify the cumulative impact of change.
  • Support the creation and execution of change management tools for the various workstreams.
  • Build strong relationships with key stakeholders to implement change activities resulting from analysis and feedback of change solutions, proposed changes and impact to teams and individuals.


What we're looking for

  • Demonstrated knowledge of the tools, techniques and methodologies (ideally PROSCI) used for change management
  • Demonstrated involvement in change management activities such as participating in focus groups, change champion networks and/or as a representative of negotiations covering all aspects of change including people, process and technology change
  • High level analytical skills with the capacity to apply critical thinking, link concepts and develop thematic results
  • Strong written and oral communication skills to facilitate workshops and clearly articulate needs and outcomes
  • Strong stakeholder management, engagement and relationship skills including the ability to work in partnerships
  • Tertiary qualifications in a business-related field


What's in it for you

Greater Bank isn't like the big banks. We are a mid-tier customer-owned bank with a commitment to delivering solutions that genuinely help our customers and their communities. Our people are key to our success and we provide a workplace that values flexibility, autonomy and transparency.

We offer you the platform to demonstrate your capability and further develop your career within an established challenger brand who are very much focused on our customers.

Combining our resources and financial strengths through the planned merger provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and innovate. You'll play an integral role in creating a sustainable regional powerhouse and employer of choice of the Hunter Region.

To Apply

If this sounds like the perfect job for you, don't wait, it's easy to apply online. You'll be guided through a simple application process.

For a confidential discussion please contact our Talent Acquisition Team on 02 4921 9721 .

This could be the start of your rewarding career with Greater Bank.

title: Agile Business Analyst
description:
Rapidly growing Adelaide based software company seeking a number of Agile BA's to join their team. If you love a fast paced environment and working on multipe features per sprint this one is for you.


About the role

  • Work in the product team and participate in estimating and planning sessions to scope features in line with the product roadmap and feedback channels from clients.
  • Assist with the prioritisation of development work including new features, critical functionality, minor enhancements, bug fixes and technical design changes.
  • Collaborate with designers, architects, engineers, test teams and clients in the preparation and review of user stories, test plans in an agile environment, utilising the Atlassian product suite of tools. Facilitation of the product / feature acceptance process where needed.
  • Provide essential support and clarifications to developers and testers throughout the software development lifecycle, including management of change requests, and corresponding adjustments to feature scope.
  • Plan, orchestrate, and deliver activities to predefined timelines.
  • Identifying and resolving process inefficiencies and contributing to continuous improvement initiatives.


Skills and experience

  • Proven experience and results working with designers and developers in an agile environment.
  • Worked in multiple (5+) software development projects, which includes recent experience as an agile BA for at least 1 year.
  • Demonstrated experience in translating designs and requirements into user stories and acceptance criteria, with fastidious attention to detail.
  • Strong communicator in both written and verbal mediums - proven ability to comfortably communicate technical and business concepts to a range of audiences including designers, engineers, sales teams, customers, and subject matter experts.
  • Demonstrated skills in critical thinking and a reputation for 'getting things done' in a dynamic, ever-changing environment.
  • Thrives in a fast-paced environment with demonstrated ability to quickly learn and adapt to new processes, tools, and software engineering concepts.



For more information or a confidential discussion, please contact Jessica Gadsby on (08) 8112 7417 quoting reference 244131


To apply please click the 'Apply Now' button.

title: Advance Technology Foresight Analyst EL 1 (S&T Level 5)
description:
The Role

The Defence Science and Technology Group (DSTG) is offering two permanent positions as an Advanced Technology Foresight Analyst.

You will develop a sound understanding of a broad range of technologies, including current technologies and those that may be developed in the future. You will work with planners and operations analysts to foresee how these technologies might strengthen or weaken Australia’s national interests.

One position, located in Canberra, will focus on national security and the way it may operate in the future, including foreseeing disruptions or entirely new concepts of operations. The other position, located in Melbourne will focus on Defence capabilities, including foreseeing disruptions or entirely new capabilities. Although the positions are based in Canberra and Melbourne, we are open to the idea of having our candidate work from our in Edinburgh, SA.

The role involves desk-based technical research and analysis as part of a large team responsible for providing emerging technology and foresight advice to Defence and other government departments. You will be responsible for a technical area that corresponds to your current S&T skills, and will broaden your expertise into a range of fields relevant to Defence (for example AI, cyber, biotechnology, quantum and many others).

You will be trained in role-specific analytic skills, including data analytics and foresight techniques. You will develop a deep understanding of the structure and decision-making processes of the Defence Department, to ensure your advice is tailored to have an impact. You will develop into a communications expert, able to concisely explain technical issues to busy, non-technical stakeholders. Outputs will include written reports, verbal briefings, multi-media and infographics. The role requires building networks across our own team of experts, as well as broader DSTG, Defence and intelligence.

About our Team

The technology analyst team is a part of the Defence Impacts of Emerging Technology (DIET) Group, within Strategy and Joint Force (SJF) Major Science and Technology Capability (MSTC), which is itself within the Joint and Operations Analysis Division of the Defence Science and Technology Group (DSTG).

This team is organised under DSTG’s Strategic Futures Project, and works closely with the Critical Technology Foresight (CTF) Group. You will be joining a project team of approximately 25 staff, including technology analysts (like this position), experts in tools and methods (such as AI experts who write programs to assist the analysts) and social scientists (who evaluate the impact of technology on society).

The Strategic Futures Project is a centre of gravity within government for emerging technology and foresight advice. Our advice feeds into decision-making, such as for senior Defence committees, the Department’s S&T portfolio planning and capability planning for the ADF. We play a key role in whole-of-government decision-making via our strong linkages to the Critical Technology Policy Coordination Office in PM&C. We partner with DSTG’s 2000 experts, across Defence, policy and intelligence agencies, and with international experts.

Our team is passionate, professional, welcoming and inclusive.

Our Ideal Candidate

We are seeking an Australian citizen who is naturally curious and motivated to develop broad expertise across diverse emerging technologies. Candidates from all S&T disciplines will be considered, but we especially seek experts in the physical sciences, engineering or systems analysis. We seek science-communicators who are passionate about making an impact for the nation. Ideally you will have experience in the APS, or have been responsible for leading and delivering projects in academia or industry. A pre-existing interest in Defence is not required, but you must be open to developing this.

S&T 5 level jobs are typically suitable for mid-career professionals rather than entry level jobs for graduates. You will have no formal responsibilities for supervising staff, but you will be expected to show leadership and take responsibility for driving outcomes and enhancing the capabilities of our team.

A PhD or equivalent qualifications/experience is required.

Application Closing date: Sunday the 29th of May 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, Reference DSTG/01524/22 on Link: https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=C698CB16-AE93-03B7-5F70-C88BA749F8D0

title: Applied Intelligence Support (Data Hub, AiOps, Visualisation)
description:
DXC Technology (DXC: NYSE) is the world’s leading independent, end-to-end IT services company, helping clients harness the power of innovation to thrive on change. Created by the merger of CSC and the Enterprise Services business of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, DXC Technology serves nearly 6,000 private and public sector clients across 70 countries.  The company’s technology independence, global talent and extensive partner network combine to deliver powerful next-generation IT services and solutions. DXC Technology is recognized among the best corporate citizens globally. For more information, visit www.dxc.com

Our Applied Intelligence Team (Datahub, AiOps and Visualization products) provides a foundation of information management and analytic capabilities to harness all value from data that matters, to deliver insights at the speed of business and improve business outcomes. Platform X Applied Intelligence products harness the power of data mining, machine learning, Journey Analytics and predictive intelligence to create actionable insight from an operation’s digital footprint.

You will provide support function for our regional toolset covering Applied Intelligence (Datahub, AiOps and Visualisation) activities, that are underpinned by Amazon Web Services (AWS) S3, Athena, AWS IAM and Github. Where an issue is unable to be resolved work with the Intelligence development teams to work through the root cause and issue resolution.

Essential Job Functions

  • Understanding of how to navigate and trouble shoot issues with AWS data toolsets.

Basic Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, or related field preferred
  • Three or more years of experience with computer systems or networking
  • Experience working with file and system maintenance procedures

Other Qualifications

  • Good organization skills to balance and prioritize work, and multitask
  • Good analytical and problem solving skills to troubleshoot systems problems
  • Good communication skills to communicate with support personnel, customers, and managers
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Ability to work from home
  • May require on-call and evening work to work with our partners in the US and India
  • Australian Citizenship

Essential Skills/Qualifications:

  • Knowledge and experience in Intelligence / Visualization applications. Support would include, but are not limited to, providing deep level technical support for incidents/break-fix, Participating in DevOps Concepts & Agile methodology. Below are role description/responsibilities (not all inclusive):
  • Data science exposure / experience
  • Hands-On support experience in Intelligence / Visualization applications.
  • Knowledge of key tools used (AWS) S3, AWS Athena, Python, SQL, Ability to do API calls from the desktop , Linux, Windows and Github.
  • Fulfill requests, Investigate and resolve application and infrastructure related incidents
  • Contribute and adhere to defined Request, Incident, Problem and Change Management processes and required SLAs.
  • Perform application run and maintain functions as defined
  • Deploy application releases and patches, update sets using Pipeline release mechanism
  • Participate in the On Call rotation for Severity 1 and 2 incident resolutions
  • Work with product engineering teams to build, design and implement automation, tooling, and coding to continuously improve applications and systems reliability, scalability, and performance
  • Work with product engineering teams throughout the software life cycle ensuring sustainable software releases
  • Act as escalation point for complex or critical issues that have not yet been documented as Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
  • Utilize a deep understanding of service topology and their dependencies required to troubleshoot issues, define mitigations, and facilitate blameless post evaluations
  • Maintain and adhere to operational documentation of standard processes and best practices
  • Maintain application specific support documentation
  • ITIL Process knowledge

Desirable Skills/Qualifications:

  • Knowledge of AWS, DevOps tools: Jenkins, GitHub including Automated Release Pipelines
  • Knowledge of SQL, REST and Integration

Our culture and benefits

DXC is committed to building better futures for our customers, colleagues, environment, and communities. We take care of each other and foster a culture of inclusion, belonging and corporate citizenship. We put this to action developing and implementing societal initiatives within our Social Impact Practice . #WeAreDXC

As an employer of choice, our “people first” philosophy means we offer competitive remuneration, benefits, training and career opportunities that reflect our commitment to improving the lives of our employees, and the communities in which we live and work. Some of these include;

  • Extensive resources to support your onboarding and continual development including DXC University
  • DXC Recognition, our global virtual platform that fosters a culture of appreciation and celebration with real-time reward and recognition
  • We know that great people refer great people. We will reward you when you bring your friends and family to work at DXC
  • More time to do the things you love with flexible leave options, including purchased leave
  • Take time to give back with charitable and emergency services volunteer days
  • Well-being matters to us and our Employee Assistance Program is there to support you and your family
  • And of course, all the basics; novated leasing, discounted health insurance, paid parental leave and many other discounts


Australian Citizenship is essential for this role.

If you're interested in the role and your skills and experience match what we're looking for, please apply!

title: Data Scientist
description:
CPB Contractors is the CIMIC Group’s construction company and a leading international construction contractor, with operations across Australia, New Zealand and Papua New Guinea.

Combining the expertise and track record formerly delivered by Leighton Contractors and Thiess, we deliver projects spanning all key sectors of the construction industry, including roads, rail, tunnelling, defence and building.

Our Mission is to generate sustainable returns for our shareholders by delivering projects for our clients, while providing safe, rewarding and fulfilling careers for our people.

We need people who are talented, motivated and disciplined, and who have a strong work ethic that drives them to succeed.

Your Opportunity

As the Data Scientist you will be responsible for performing quantitative and qualitive analysis on project reporting data supplied by our numerous sub-contracting construction partners and other internal and external project stakeholders. The primary purpose of the position is to provide first reporting, interpretation and insight on project compliance and associated activities while seeking to continuously improve the quality of information provided to the wider business. You will build and maintain productive working relationship with internal and external project stakeholders to provide insight and manage the quality of incoming data.

Our minimum requirements for this role are:

  • Tertiary qualification in Business/Computer Science/Data Science
  • Demonstrated data analysis experience in fast moving and complex project or work streams with the ability to provide meaningful insights and recommendations
  • Exposure to Power BI reporting tools and ability develop dashboards
  • You will have strong written and verbal communication skills for providing clear and concise analysis and insight to stakeholders and are able to work autonomously with minimal direction

If you are interested in this role and meet the above requirements, please apply below.

We are committed to workplace diversity and to providing flexible work opportunities on our project. We support women in construction and Indigenous advancement and participation. Women and people who identify as Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander are encouraged to apply.

Please note: This role is being sourced through CPB Contractors directly and we will not accept applications via external recruitment agencies.

Given the nature of the position being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 may be an inherent requirement of this role.

title: Data Migration Specialist
company: Talent – SEEK Recruitment Agency of the Year | 7 Time Winner
description:
• Adelaide based role
  • December 2022 initial contract
  • Experience in a relevant role

Our client is currently looking to fill a contract role with an experienced Data Migration Specialist. The preferred candidate will be able to have;

  • Proven experience in creating and supporting data transfer mechanisms and protocols between complex computer systems within a large organisation including providing specialist technical knowledge and skills
  • Proven experience in working on data migration and/or integration projects involving the exchange of data between internal business and third party applications
  • Prove experience working with SQL databases
  • Experience in a data messaging environment
  • Proven experience in consulting with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Proven capacity for independent thinking, creativity and the exercise of significant levels of independent judgement in an Information Technology environment.
  • Demonstrated ability to develop databases, query and define tables and scripts to extract and load data.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of data integration messaging in a large, complex and dynamic enterprise environment
  • Demonstrated knowledge of Server Operating Systems - including Unix and Windows, scripting languages, and application servers
  • Demonstrated understanding of a range of data integration and event messaging standards and solutions

If this sounds like you, please click Apply Now! For your chance to be considered.

title: Business Analyst
description:
• Join a high performing and collaborative team environment
  • Conduct a business architecture evaluation
  • Hybrid working combining office-based and work from home

About Alinta Energy:

At Alinta Energy, we’re constantly striving to do better. Whether it’s lowering customers costs, providing world class local service or sustainable energy, our aim is to be better. And to keep getting better day after day. Better for our customers. Better for Australia. And better for our environment.

We’re a leading Australian utility with an owned and contracted generation portfolio of 3,000MW, over 1 million combined electricity and gas retail customers, and around 1,000 employees across Australia and New Zealand. Supplying energy in Australia for over 20 years, today we’re a vertically integrated energy company providing generation, retail and wholesale supply of gas and electricity across Australia. We support the development of renewable energy generation and offer local customer service through support hubs in Perth, Western Australia and Morwell in Victoria

Our Culture:

It’s an exciting time to become a part of our growing team at Alinta Energy. Our people are our greatest asset and we’re committed to a culture that’s focussed on being better at providing great service externally and internally. An organisation where people truly matter. That’s better.

About the role:

We are looking for an experienced Business Analyst to join our Enterprise Solution Delivery team a 12-month maternity cover.  Reporting to the Manager, Business Architecture, the successful applicant will play a critical role in Alinta’s implementation of procedural and technical changes arising from AEMO’s market reform projects and build and enhance Alinta’s vendor and proprietary products focusing on business, data, and technical aspects of the products.

Duties:

  • Identify, create, and facilitate process design changes by conducting business and systems process analysis and design at a complex level
  • Provide and support the implementation of business solutions by building relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders
  • Work with stakeholders to ensure that each program adequately captures procedural and technical requirements and that delivery timeframes are consistent with industry milestone
  • Demonstrate up-to-date expertise in Information Systems and apply this to the development, execution, and improvement of action plans
  • Manage business relationships and expectations by developing a communication process to keep others up to date on project results.

Skills and experience:

  • Tertiary level qualification in business, IT or similar
  • Experience in the National Energy Market and the systems and procedures that underpin it
  • Technical knowledge of requirements gathering, process documentation, project planning, testing methodologies, change management methodologies
  • The ability to interpret large volumes of procedural documentation and translate them into business requirements
  • Excellent analytical skills with ability to understand complex systems and data flows with little or no documentation

This is a great opportunity for an experienced Business Analyst  who is looking to lead a small team in a supportive, welcoming and professional environment.  This role will be instrumental in conducting a business architecture evaluation and collaborating with project management and IT development teams to deliver the product and improve the architecture.

Benefits:

  • Hybrid working arrangements for most roles, combining office-based and work from home
  • Staff energy discount Offer (where products are available)
  • Generous employee referral bonus
  • Salary Packaging options
  • Wellness programs including our Employee Assistance Program and free full access to the Headspace application
  • Paid community volunteer leave
  • Access to LinkedIn learning
  • Discount program for a range of products and services
  • 14 weeks of fully paid parental leave
  • Company paid salary continuance insurance
  • Ability to purchase additional leave
  • Modern offices with free snacks, drinks and coffee

Let’s spread the positive energy together…

Alinta Energy is a Circle Back Initiative employer - we commit to respond to every applicant.

Please note that if your application progresses you will be required to complete background/pre-employment checks. These checks may include but are not limited to - right to work/immigration checks, reference checks, criminal background checks, checks, qualification checks and additional finance checks for finance related positions. Alinta Energy takes the safety and wellbeing of our people seriously. We require employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to be able to attend our workplaces.

How to apply:

Click “APPLY” to submit your application.

Australian Citizenship is essential for this role.

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
We have an abundance of work for skilled Senior IT BAs, who are creative and enthusiastic individuals, and love solving the diverse client problems and variety of work that professional IT Consulting offers.

title: Advance Technology Foresight Analyst EL 1 (S&T Level 5)
description:
The Role

The Defence Science and Technology Group (DSTG) is offering two permanent positions as an Advanced Technology Foresight Analyst.

You will develop a sound understanding of a broad range of technologies, including current technologies and those that may be developed in the future. You will work with planners and operations analysts to foresee how these technologies might strengthen or weaken Australia’s national interests.

One position, located in Canberra, will focus on national security and the way it may operate in the future, including foreseeing disruptions or entirely new concepts of operations. The other position, located in Melbourne will focus on Defence capabilities, including foreseeing disruptions or entirely new capabilities. Although the positions are based in Canberra and Melbourne, we are open to the idea of having our candidate work from our in Edinburgh, SA.

The role involves desk-based technical research and analysis as part of a large team responsible for providing emerging technology and foresight advice to Defence and other government departments. You will be responsible for a technical area that corresponds to your current S&T skills, and will broaden your expertise into a range of fields relevant to Defence (for example AI, cyber, biotechnology, quantum and many others).

You will be trained in role-specific analytic skills, including data analytics and foresight techniques. You will develop a deep understanding of the structure and decision-making processes of the Defence Department, to ensure your advice is tailored to have an impact. You will develop into a communications expert, able to concisely explain technical issues to busy, non-technical stakeholders. Outputs will include written reports, verbal briefings, multi-media and infographics. The role requires building networks across our own team of experts, as well as broader DSTG, Defence and intelligence.

About our Team

The technology analyst team is a part of the Defence Impacts of Emerging Technology (DIET) Group, within Strategy and Joint Force (SJF) Major Science and Technology Capability (MSTC), which is itself within the Joint and Operations Analysis Division of the Defence Science and Technology Group (DSTG).

This team is organised under DSTG’s Strategic Futures Project, and works closely with the Critical Technology Foresight (CTF) Group. You will be joining a project team of approximately 25 staff, including technology analysts (like this position), experts in tools and methods (such as AI experts who write programs to assist the analysts) and social scientists (who evaluate the impact of technology on society).

The Strategic Futures Project is a centre of gravity within government for emerging technology and foresight advice. Our advice feeds into decision-making, such as for senior Defence committees, the Department’s S&T portfolio planning and capability planning for the ADF. We play a key role in whole-of-government decision-making via our strong linkages to the Critical Technology Policy Coordination Office in PM&C. We partner with DSTG’s 2000 experts, across Defence, policy and intelligence agencies, and with international experts.

Our team is passionate, professional, welcoming and inclusive.

Our Ideal Candidate

We are seeking an Australian citizen who is naturally curious and motivated to develop broad expertise across diverse emerging technologies. Candidates from all S&T disciplines will be considered, but we especially seek experts in the physical sciences, engineering or systems analysis. We seek science-communicators who are passionate about making an impact for the nation. Ideally you will have experience in the APS, or have been responsible for leading and delivering projects in academia or industry. A pre-existing interest in Defence is not required, but you must be open to developing this.

S&T 5 level jobs are typically suitable for mid-career professionals rather than entry level jobs for graduates. You will have no formal responsibilities for supervising staff, but you will be expected to show leadership and take responsibility for driving outcomes and enhancing the capabilities of our team.

A PhD or equivalent qualifications/experience is required.

Application Closing date: Sunday the 29th of May 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, Reference DSTG/01524/22 on Link: https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=C698CB16-AE93-03B7-5F70-C88BA749F8D0

title: Team Leader, Information, Analysis and Reporting
description:
The South Australian Certificate of Education Board (SACE Board) of South Australia’s primary role is the provision of the South Australian Certificate of Education (SACE) to government, non-government and international schools.

Our purpose is to “shape education so that students thrive” which is achieved through working closely with our stakeholders to inspire, innovate and create the best outcomes for students and their communities so that SACE Graduates are capable to construct their own futures to contribute to a sustainable and socially just world.

The IMPACT you will drive at the SACE Board

The Team Leader, Information Analysis and Reporting has been created to lead and manage a team to deliver on the proactive reporting, implementation and evaluation of activities and projects for the SACE Board of South Australia (SACE Board). The role also seeks continuous improvement opportunities and keeps abreast of current trends to build upon the information, analysis and reporting capabilities.

What you will BRING

  • Proven ability to understand complex business problems and processes, and consequent data required to analyse and provide solutions.
  • Demonstrated ability to interpret and represent and communicate data analysis and trends to stakeholders.
  • Demonstrated analytical and critical thinking skills, including an ability to engage in research related educational discussion and debate.
  • Knowledge of tools and techniques in educational research including recent developments and validity, reliability and equity issues.
  • Demonstrated understanding of the functionality associated with the SACE Board’s IT systems.

Qualifications

Tertiary qualifications in Data Science or related discipline is desirable.

Special Conditions

  • Intrastate travel to regional and remote locations; international and interstate travel may be required.
  • Some out-of-hours work.
  • The incumbent works under the SACE Board of South Australia Act 1983 .
  • Appointment is subject to a satisfactory Working with Children Check from the Department of Human Services and in accordance with the SACE Board policy.

What we can OFFER you!

  • A supportive and dynamic team environment that values the work that you do.
  • Professional development in education, project management and engagement.
  • Salary Sacrifice Benefits.
  • Flexible work and wellbeing provisions.

Remuneration

ASO7 classification level. Salary range $103,387 to $111,759 per annum plus super.

APPLYING with Us

If you are passionate about young people and their education, we want to hear from you!

For further information including the role description and to apply, please https://iworkfor.sa.gov.au/page.php?pageID=160&windowUID=0&AdvertID=638869#brs_jbcontent

ENQUIRIES to,

Ines Sodano, Head of Business Operations, Ines.sodano@sa.gov.au or telephone 8115 4899

Applications close: 11:45pm on Sunday 22 May 2022

title: Science Team Leader – Data Science (Hamilton, New Zealand)
description:
The role and opportunity

Please note this role is based in Hamilton, New Zealand.

We are looking for a strong people leader to join the Digital Agriculture leadership team and lead the Data Science - Ruakura Team at AgResearch.

As a Science Team leader, your role will be split between, 50% team leadership and 50% as a senior statistician. As a Science Team Leader you will lead a team of scientists that advocate data science principles, working collaboratively in multi-disciplinary project teams to apply new technologies and to develop data-driven solutions for New Zealand’s agricultural sector. The second part of your role will be as a consulting senior statistician.

This role will ensure current and future capability is aligned to the Science Plan, while ensuring an innovation pipeline and culture of innovation excellence continues to be achieved.  We are looking for someone with proven leadership experience and someone that relishes getting the best out of their people.

This leadership role will lead the Data Science - Ruakura Team, ensuring it has the current and future capability requirements (both personnel and science-based infrastructure/equipment) which are aligned to the Science Plan as well as ensuring a vital science driven innovation pipeline and Culture of Innovation Excellence.  You will provide direction and oversight for career progression opportunities, science expertise, staff allocation/deployment and champion science creativity and quality for the team.

What you will be doing

  • Lead a high performing team in unlocking business value by coaching, developing, and managing employees to deliver innovative solutions.
  • Ensure the members of their science team are directed towards and valued as critical contributors to projects that produce high quality science and innovation aligned to the strategic and operational needs of our Science Plan.
  • Maximise allocation of science and innovation employee capabilities by integrating them into AgResearch project design and research investment activities.
  • Implement decision-making frameworks that can inform our critical investments in staff development, recruitment and external capability partnering.

Your ideal background

  • PhD (or equivalent experience) in statistics, data science or mathematics is preferred. Ideally at a senior level.
  • Experience in the leadership/supervision of individuals/groups in science, innovation or technology, including setting and reviewing their progress against objectives and individual development.
  • Proven experience in developing individuals and mentorship.
  • Ability to work with senior leaders.

Our benefits

When your work environment fits your values and your lifestyle, it is a better place to be. Our campuses are green, open, and developing, allowing you to enjoy your work and be productive at the same time – we offer flexibility (work from home, flexible hours) and generous benefits to make sure our people feel supported and enjoy being part of the AgResearch team.

You can view the complete list here: http://www.agresearchcareers.co.nz/working-here/our-benefits/

How to apply

This role will suit a passionate, talented and collaborative person who is motivated to drive their career forward within this vital New Zealand organisation. If this sounds like you, apply today using the link below, including a cover letter detailing why you feel you would be suitable for this position.

For further information, please contact Penny Hall, HR Advisor, on penny.hall@agresearch.co.nz .

To apply, or to view the full Position Description for this role, please go to our Careers Page http://www.agresearchcareers.co.nz/

Applications close: Wednesday 1 June 2022.

title: Text Analytics Team Lead Executive Level 2 (S&T Level 6)
description:
Text Analytics Team Lead

  • Inspire and mentor a small team of text analytics researchers and engineers
  • Contribute to innovation of scientific research in a Defence environment
  • Enjoy flexible working arrangements

This exciting role involves inspiring a small high-performing team of scientists and researchers that contribute to the development of science and technology in the domains of multilingual text and content analytics to high international standards. The ideal applicant will have experience and a passion for computational linguistics. You will represent DSTG on Australian and international groups within the text and content analytics domains. This role will contribute to a culture of innovation that drives our More Together: Defence Science and Technology Strategy.

As the Text Analytics Team Lead, you will:
Lead a research program to develop multilingual text analytics for processing, enriching and translating unstructured text content; as well as build linguistic resources, language models and advanced content analytics solutions.

  • Develop initiatives on priority science areas relating to multilingual text and content analytics for Defence and national security agencies.
  • Provide high-level technical and administrative advice in the field of multilingual text and content analytics.
  • Supervise and mentor staff to promote a healthy culture that values staff, innovation and excellence in science.
  • Manage allocated resources, set work area priorities, manage workflows, develop strategies and evaluate business outcomes.
  • Manage stakeholder relationships and play a key role in building relationships with Defence and national security agencies, and their international equivalents, as well as academia and industry.
  • Report research findings to Defence partners and the scientific community through high quality scientific reports, briefs, publications and presentations.

About our Team
Intelligence, Surveillance and Space Division (ISSD) undertakes internationally-recognised research and development into technologies aimed at enhancing national capability for Defence and national agency decision makers.

The role is within Identity Intelligence group, within Intelligence Analysis branch in ISSD.

Identity Intelligence works closely with Defence and other elements of Australia’s national power to deliver tools and technologies that better prepare Defence to respond to grey-zone activities. The group enhances Defence’s video, imagery, and multilingual text and speech capabilities to identify and characterise persons of interest and detect misinformation and disinformation within contested information environments. The group also aims to understand and defend the vulnerabilities inherent in deploying new identification technologies and the information they are applied to.


Our Ideal Candidate
We are looking for a motivated team player who is able to understand the broad strategic context and has sound stakeholder engagement skills.


To succeed in in this role, you must be able to demonstrate the following:

  • Specialised knowledge and research experience in multilingual text and content analytics to generate new knowledge and produce enhanced capabilities for clients and sponsors.
  • Ability to lead the development of Science & Technology (S&T) initiatives.
  • Ability to think strategically, problem solve and operate with considerable autonomy to achieve corporate impact.
  • Sound communication skills, both written and verbal, with an ability to foster effective stakeholder relationships.
  • Adaptability and resilience in a dynamically changing environment.
  • Working collaboratively across different teams, harnessing diverse views and encouraging an inclusive team culture.
  • Supervise, mentor and develop staff.
  • Commitment towards ongoing self-improvement and professional development.

Application closing date: Sunday the 29th of May 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, Reference DSTG/02005/22 on

https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=9C7896E7-2B42-0DDB-D044-C88BE12833E2

title: Property Analyst & Project Assistant
description:
Would you like to make a difference?

Do you love tackling complex real-world problems?

Does the opportunity to shape how our cities and regions grow sound exciting?

Do you enjoy thinking outside of the box and working on diverse projects?

Are you searching for a role which will let your creative side flourish?

If you resonate with the above, we’d love to hear from you!

About Us

Our mission is to inspire and transform communities through unlocking large scale transformative real estate projects. We specialise in partnering transactions and advice. We are driven to make the impossible possible. And bring to life the unimagined.

Life with us is anything but boring.  From masterplanned communities to tourism marinas, to world-class entertainment precincts, sports and leisure destinations, new agri-tourism icons, carbon neutral apartment living, to shaping the retail and cultural identity of an entire CBD.  Our projects have impact. And that’s just the start…

If you share our core values of Creativity, Curiosity, Authenticity, Accountability and Community - we’d love you to join us on this journey.

So what’s the role?

We are seeking a driven and passionate individual to join our growing team as a Property Analyst & Project Assistant on a part-time or permanent basis.

Daily activities of the role

  • Undertake benchmarking of comparable projects - compile information on financial and non-financial performance, pricing, key success factors, size of market, customer profile, etc.
  • Collate market information including transaction evidence, market performance and demographic profiles.
  • Summarise findings from research and identify relevant takeaways with supporting visual aids and images. Ensuring report / presentations have a clear structure with key information of value to the client clearly outlined.
  • Provide input to the creation of compelling marketing collateral.
  • Review of and assistance with preparation of custom financial and development feasibility models
  • Help coordinate and attend meetings and workshops.
  • Assist in the preparation of submissions / fee proposals.
  • Input into client communication including providing project and transaction progress updates.
  • Provide project administration support including monitoring project progress and profitability using project management software.
  • Create content for company social media accounts.

The boutique size of our company provides exposure to a wide range of projects and the opportunity to develop a diverse skill set through the development delivery process.  This provides accelerated growth opportunities for those with demonstrated capacity, drive and initiative.

The successful candidate will have a strong desire to upskill, the ability to work independently to undertake requested research, develop options for discussion with managers, and have a high standard of oral and written / visual communication.

The Technical Stuff

Candidates with background qualifications (or currently studying) in any of the following disciplines will be highly regarded:

  • Project Management
  • Development Management
  • Architecture / Town Planning / Urban Design
  • Property

You can apply via Seek or by sending your CV and a cover letter to: jess.heimburger@alineagroup.com.au .

title: Business Analyst
description:
Working as a member of the PMO, The Business Analyst is responsible for partnering with key stakeholders to analyse, capture business requirements and identify areas for continuous improvement.

As the Business Analyst you will be capable of working with stakeholders to communicate and elicit requirements for changes to business processes, policies and procedures to improve and enhance operational procedures. The Business Analyst will provide guidance to drive and increase growth of the businesses operational capacity and improve customer experience.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Stakeholder management and communication, achieve outcomes by identifying and building effective stakeholder relationships
  • Confidently run work shops and drive internal conversations
  • Collaborate effectively with teams to elicit and analyse business requirements
  • Define, and validate requirements for business processes, drive 'As Is and To Be' processes
  • Support testing, training, and implementation activities to support business technology solutions
  • Risk management of project operations and governance
  • Lead regular reporting of progress and risks to the business
  • support transactions and work-flow alongside existing core administration systems

Key Requirements:

  • Minimum of 3 years of related experience
  • Experience working across multiple complex systems
  • Agile experience
  • Experience with loans, lending, and credit cards
  • Banking and Financial services experience desirable

Robert Walters also reward successful referrals, so if you know anyone who may be interested in the role please feel free to share these details.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

To apply please click apply or call Dione Chrisakis on +61 8 82163512 for a confidential discussion.

title: Business Intelligence Lead
description:
About the opportunity:
We have an exciting opportunity for a Business Intelligence Lead to join our internal Security & Technology Services team.

Reporting to the Technology Services Delivery Manager, you will be responsible for the design and development of reporting solutions to provide strategic guidance and improve the business performance by drawing insights from data analytics.

What you will be involved in:

  • Working with key stakeholders to understand and translate business requirements into BI context
  • Contribute to the development of analytics policies, standards and guidelines
  • Design and develop BI reports
  • Connect data sources, import data, and transform data for BI
  • Focus on data quality to provide confidence for making decisions on a single version of the truth
  • Develop visual reports and dashboards
  • Analyse and provide insights to improve decision making
  • Contribute to the recommendation of improvements
  • Administration of BI tools


What we would like from you:

  • Demonstrated knowledge of business intelligence, data integration, data warehousing, data modelling, data visualisation and the technical aspects of BI tools
  • Understanding of data protection and data governance
  • Experience in a similar role, proficient with SQL, Oracle, PowerBI and Excel
  • Analytical thinking for translating data into informative reports and visuals
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Australian citizen or Permanent Resident


Nova's Value Proposition; Beyond the pay cheque:
In addition to salary, you are supported with:

  • Flexible working conditions to suit individual needs and dress for your day
  • Commitment to Professional and Personal Development (up to $5000 per year)
  • Reward & Recognition Program offering exclusive discounts from hundreds of major retailers, helping you to save on groceries, petrol, holidays and more!
  • Additional Leave entitlements include Reserve Leave, Loyalty Leave, Parental Leave and Purchased Leave
  • Wellbeing Hub with access to health and fitness content
  • Employee Assistance Program for employees and family members
  • Access to Defence Health and Travel Insurance
  • Novated Leasing and Salary Sacrifice
  • Nova Employee Share Offer
  • An inclusive and supportive culture
  • A range of other great benefits, just ask us


About Us
Nova Systems is a global engineering services and technology solutions company with strategically located offices in Australia, New Zealand, the United Kingdom, Norway, and Singapore. From national defence and essential services to border control and cyber security, these are the challenges we partner with our clients to anticipate, understand, and solve.

At Nova Systems, we provide highly specialised advice and solutions at scale, we are agile and ready to predict, react and respond. We refer to it as being "Optimised for Performance". Small enough to care, big enough to matter, we leverage the benefits of scale for our clients.

But what makes Nova Systems truly unique, is our people. Nova Systems is where the best and brightest minds come together to challenge, collaborate, and innovate.

At Nova Systems we see things differently. We bring (and take) a different perspective. We are the smarts behind the solution.

To Apply:
Please click on the "apply now" button and submit your resume using the "upload resume" function in PDF Format (only).

Nova Systems does not accept any recruitment agency solicitation.
