title: Digital Advertising Graduate Positions at RQmedia
description:
New Graduate roles

  • Looking for the best and brightest who want to work in Digital Media
  • This is a challenging role that requires analytical, data, technical and communciation skills

We are not a creative agency.  We are an advertising performance agency. RQmedia creates and manages ads and takes accountability for our customers sales results.

You must have Year 12 result above 90 and a GPA of at least over 5.5 (please specify your results).

You will work in a team that creates and manages ads in  Google, Facebook and Microsoft - as these are all part of our full service, omni channel offering.

Positions available.

This is an outstanding opportunity for law, business, management, science, maths or commerce students.  No one degree provides you with the skills for what we do (we have successfully employed law, commerce, event management and science grads).  We give you the underlying skills required in the growth economy of digital advertising.  You just need to be top of your class, learn fast, results driven and able to take the rapid pace of our industry.


Required as a minimum:

  • Intelligent and inquiry driven
  • Fast learner
  • Ability to deliver KPIs
  • Excellent English writing ability
  • Persistence
  • Proficient with word processing and spreadsheets
  • Excellent communication skills and a team player
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet scheduled due dates
  • Ability to analyse, report and act on data
  • High attention to detail
  • Ability to take on board customer feedback

If this sounds like you, and you would like to secure an internship with an opportunity to start your career in a market-leading digital organisation, send your resume , a short cover letter and a copy of your university transcript via Seek (combine your docs and upload them together).

You must submit a cover letter addressing our criteria and include your TER and GPA (bullet points are fine!).

This job is only open to Australian permanent residents and citizens. No Agencies please.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Do you love a good lamb roast? We’re developing the world’s best technology to measure meat quality. We need a Senior Software Engineer to help us bring it to market.

Miniprobes is a high-tech spin-out from the University of Adelaide. We use precision fibre-optics and near-infrared lasers to build imaging devices less than a millimetre in diameter. Based on 10 years of R&D, our team has developed a new type of imaging technology which we are using to measure meat quality for the livestock industry.

It’s an exciting time to join Miniprobes . We are developing our first product for commercial release. You can be pivotal in creating this new product. We have the expertise, funding and industry partnerships to deliver it to the livestock industry within the next 2 years. You will be part of the team that develops this product. You will also be a foundational employee in this young company as we start on a trajectory of rapid growth.

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will help us to develop the software that is at the heart of this system. This includes acquisition, processing and analysis of data from our imaging hardware as well as creating tools to remotely manage installed systems. You will be involved in a range of areas including real-time systems, image processing and machine learning, targeted at a Windows platform.

To be considered for this role you will need:

  • Bachelor of Engineering, Computer Science or related area;
  • At least 5 years software development experience;
  • Experience with C++ and OO concepts.

To apply, submit your resume/CV and a cover letter highlighting any skills and experiences that would make you a vital part of our team.

For further information regarding this position, please contact the Director (Software) at rodney.kirk@miniprobes.com .

title: Applied Scientist (Planning and Scheduling)
description:
About the Role:

As a Consunet Applied Scientist you will perform a vital role using your understanding of wireless communications to support the design and implementation of our next-generation disruptive radio access management system. The role will consist of researching innovative ideas and algorithms, supporting the development, and demonstration of near real-time autonomous electromagnetic spectrum management solutions. You will be working within an agile environment with a team of professionals including scientists, mathematicians and software developers to support the research goals of our Cyber and Electronic Warfare technology company. The applied research part of the project is in the applications of advanced computational techniques (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning) as well as Distributed Systems to develop novel protocols or adapt existing academic research in Complex Systems towards wireless transmission scheduling and path planning.

To be considered for this role, you must be an Australian citizen.

Essential Knowledge and Skills:

  • Experience in algorithm development and modelling using Python or Java or similar languages with good exposure to principles of object-oriented programming.
  • Understanding of wireless systems design and optimisation for diverse applications.
  • Experience in Artificial Intelligence – Planning and Scheduling techniques.
  • Experience in mathematics, especially optimisation, and complex algorithm development and the ability to apply resulting concepts to solving problems in radio access networks.
  • Provide vital systems engineering support to our in-house software development team in the form of implementation guidance.
  • You are an adaptable individual who can communicate fluently, both orally and in writing, and are comfortable with presenting complex information to both technical and non-technical audiences such as internal and external stakeholders.
  • Post graduate qualifications within Computer Science/EEE are preferred, however established equivalent expertise will be considered

Desirable Knowledge and Skills:

  • Background Communications systems theory and wireless systems
  • Understanding of distributed and complex systems
  • Government/Defence Industry experience
  • Recommending and designing technical solutions
  • Writing and maintaining technical documentation
  • Good understanding of current cellular or wi-fi communications standards
  • Experience working in teams applying Agile software engineering best practices
  • Background in Artificial Intelligence, in particular intelligent agent-based modelling

To be considered, candidates will have:

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Successful candidates must be eligible to hold and maintain an Australian Defence Security Clearance. Eligibility requirements can be found at http://www.defence.gov.au/agsva.

Benefits working for Consunet:

  • A workplace that believes in innovation, quality, and a work-life balance.
  • Flexible, inclusive and friendly work environment.
  • Competitive remuneration.
  • Salary packaging options.
  • Career and skills progression through training and development to team members.
  • Access to cutting-edge technology, research, and agile project management practices.
  • Mentoring and support from our experienced team members.

About the Company:

Consunet is headquartered in the Adelaide CBD with operations in Adelaide, Edinburgh (SA) and Canberra. A level of flexibility is generally offered with respect to work location. If you have specific requirements, please discuss them during your interview.

Our people create world-leading trusted cyber and spectrum security technology solutions that safeguard our customers' interests. As a 100% Australian-owned and operated corporation, Consunet strives to be the country's leading sovereign cyber and spectrum security solution developer, and trusted industry partner to the Australian Defence and cyber security communities. The company has a strong research and development and collaboration emphasis, implements Agile development and management processes, and has a proven track record of delivering and sustaining in-service operational capabilities for Defence and commercial customers. Our vision “to build the Australian cyber and spectrum security future” is firmly rooted in everything we do.

To Apply:

Click “Apply Now”. Please attach a cover letter summarising your experience when applying.

title: Data and Performance Analyst
description:
About the Role

As an expert in data analytics and with a specialist knowledge of various business intelligence tools, you will analyse and interpret complex data sets to provide innovative solutions that support university-wide performance monitoring, decision-making and compliance reporting activities. You will design, develop, and manage projects to support strategic decision making, and continually review and improve a suite of core performance reports and data analysis tools that are aligned with the University’s strategy.

You will lead the development and implementation of a quality training program for professional and academic staff and be highly skilled in the presentation of multifaceted data sets to a range of audiences.

About UniSA

The University of South Australia is Australia’s University of Enterprise. Our culture of innovation is anchored around global and national links to academic, research and industry partners. Our graduates are the new urban professionals, global citizens at ease with the world and ready to create and respond to change. Our research is inventive and adventurous and we create new knowledge that is central to global economic and social prosperity.

Core Responsibilities

  • Analyse and interpret qualitative and quantitative data through the application of various business intelligence tools
  • Provide specialist advice on institutional and market information for strategic planning, institutional benchmarking, and university-wide performance measurement
  • Evaluate, prioritise, and respond to data requests from key internal and external stakeholders
  • Utilise a variety of methods and tools to interpret and present complex data and information to audiences at all levels
  • Develop and maintain effective business partnerships, using a consultancy approach


Essential Skills and Experience

  • Relevant tertiary qualification and experience in a relevant field, or an equivalent combination of relevant experience and/or education
  • Expertise in the use of Business Intelligence tools and statistical techniques
  • Ability to extract, manage and manipulate complex datasets
  • High level writing and presentation skills, and ability to present information in a clear and concise manner
  • Well-developed business partnership skills, with experience in negotiating and problem-solving with clients


Benefits

Getting a great job working with the best is just the start. UniSA rewards its staff with a wide variety of benefits such as:

  • Access to great personal development opportunities
  • Generous superannuation contributions of 17%
  • Flexible working conditions
  • Employee assistance and development programs
  • A range of salary packaging options, including vehicle leasing, laptops and car parking fees


Culture

As a University of Enterprise, we offer a dynamic and agile workplace culture, one that embraces challenges and thrives on breaking new ground. Our staff are creative and innovative thinkers, communicating with clarity, conviction and enthusiasm. We embrace diversity and inclusion in a vibrant, engaging environment. Our people are authentic, resilient, and influential, and we deliver results.

How to Apply

For a copy of the position description and to apply, please visit Working at UniSA. The online application form will list the specific selection criteria that you need to address.

Please address your cover letter to Jade Windsor, Senior Consultant: Recruitment Central . For further information about the position or the recruitment process, please contact UniSA Recruitment Central on +61 8 8302 1700 or via email at recruitment@unisa.edu.au using job reference number 4029 .

Applications close: 11.30pm Wednesday 1 June 2022

Applications welcomed from Australian or NZ citizens, Australian permanent residents and those who have the legal right to work in Australia for the term of appointment.

#LI-DNI

title: Modelling and Simulation Engineer
description:
MODELLING & SIMULATION ENGINEER

  • All Systems GO! Be part of the next generation of defence technology
  • Utilise your skills in modelling and simulation systems
  • Enjoy flexibility , engaging work and a culture that embraces diversity and open-mindedness

At BAE Systemswe are all systems go as we continue to drive innovation and seek passionate and talented people to join our business. We currently have an opportunity as a Modelling & Simulation Engineer within our Battlespace Integrated Solutions based in Edinburgh, South Australia .

What this opportunity will mean for you:

  • Purposeful work where your efforts are recognized in an environment where you can thrive
  • Joining an organisation that is passionate about developing some of the most impressive careers in the world
  • Industry-leading flexibility options to unlock the talent and diversity of every individual
  • Unique opportunities to contribute to programs of national significance whilst growing your skills
  • A strong safety culture, inclusive teams and work to be proud of, underpinned by a compelling set of values

Your new role:

As a result of the growth within our business, we are seeking an experienced and talented Modelling & Simulation Engineer to join our expanding M&S team.

The Joint Survivability Tactics Validation Program (JSTVP) has been initiated to provide defence against threats that use the Electro Magnetic Spectrum (EMS) to target Australian Defence Force (ADF) units. Examples of these threats are missiles which are guided by radar frequency or electro-optic seekers, and laser guided weapons.

The program aims through synthetic trials to simulate various engagements to support assessments of susceptibility of ADF platforms (both maritime and land) against these threats.

This opportunity will see you:

  • Contribute to the development of the JSTVP project modelling & simulation environment through:
    • Understanding of the M&S requirements
    • Development of system models
    • Verification and Validation of System Models
    • Execution of virtual trials
    • Contribute to the generation of technical documents
    • Develop knowledge and understanding in the M&S as pertains to EW evaluation
    • Provide mentoring of more junior members of the team

As an ideal applicant for this opportunity, you'll have:

  • Strong understanding in software engineering principles and software development
  • Understanding of and solving problems abilities in the complex mathematical domain
  • Ability to actively engage and contribute to tasks within the JSTVP programs team
  • Ability to work independently while maintaining focus and motivation
  • High level of communication, interpersonal and time management skills
  • Ability to document and generate technical reports
  • Significant experience in C and C++ programming (essential)
  • Experience working within an Agile framework, using tools such as Cmake, etc.
  • Experience in MATLAB programming
  • Experience in the use of GIT repository tools or similar
  • Currently holds a Negative Vetting 1 clearance or ability to obtain (essential)

Research shows that some candidates hesitate to apply for roles if they feel they don't meet 100% of the criteria. So, if this opportunity excites you and you have the right foundational experience and qualifications, we encourage you to apply. Whether it be for this role or another, your skills and competencies are of interest to us.

Clearances

As Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and eligible to obtain and maintain appropriate clearance.

International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) are applicable and as such, your nationality may be a factor in determining your suitability for this role.

Further information regarding clearances is available at: https://careers.au.baesystems.com/opportunity.html

Applications should be addressed to: Ben Woodrow - Talent Acquisition Specialist-Engineering and made online here. Confidential enquiries are welcome via email: Ben.Woodrow@baesystems.com

We are a 2021 Circle Back Initiative Employer - we commit to respond to every applicant.

Our culture

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive environment where our people can thrive. For us that means ensuring that the voices and talents of our employees are valued and that everyone has a sense of belonging. We do not tolerate discrimination because of differences, such as age, ability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, religion, or sexual orientation.

If you would like to know more information about how we are supporting our employees, you can view our policies and initiatives here: https://au.work180.co/employer/bae-systems/benefits

title: Intelligent Agents Scientist APS 4/5-6 (S&T Level 3-4) and EL 1 (S&T Level 5)
description:
The Role
Cyber and Electronic Warfare Division is seeking an early to mid-career researcher to advance the state of the art with respect to intelligent agents and autonomous systems for information warfare. The researcher will be working with a team of scientists and engineers developing self-aware and self-adaptive agents that will be deployed in multi-agent contested environments.

Duties shall include:

  • Researching and architecting algorithms for multi-agent teaming, goal based reasoning and trust management,
  • Identifying gaps in existing multi-agent technologies,
  • Developing prototypes of intelligent agents,
  • Conducting experiments with intelligent agents in both synthetic and real Defence environments and,
  • Working with collaborators internal to DSTG and within academia and industry.

This position will be filled at either S&T3-4 or S&T5 and will be determined by the level of relevant expertise of the successful candidate.


About our Team
Cyber and Electronic Warfare Division undertakes research and development focused on identifying, analysing and countering threats to Australia's defence and national security through electronic means.

The mission of Contested Communications is to develop survivable tactical communications and electronic warfare solutions for contested and degraded cyber electromagnetic environments.
Information Warfare Command and Control (IWC2) STC conducts research and development of command and control (C2) technologies for fighting in and through the contested information environment. Information warfare (IW) occurs within the machine, and necessitates an approach that relies heavily on autonomous operation of cyber, EW and influence operations capabilities, under the oversight of a human command element.

IWC2 research themes include:

  • Information warfare C2 paradigms,
  • Antifragile multi-agent architectures,
  • Autonomous control methodologies,
  • Machine-human integration,
  • Causal modelling and,
  • Scalable and elastic coordination technologies.

We seek to collaborate with others working in similar areas so as to increase critical mass and achieve maximal impact for Defence.

Our Ideal Candidate
Our ideal candidate shall demonstrate initiative and integrity, and have a passion for developing machine intelligence.

Desirable skills and experience include:

  • Ability to think conceptually, to structure, analyse and solve complex problems through sound research and engineering practices,
  • Knowledge of machine learning, computational intelligence, multi-agent coordination and cooperation, and/or system self-organisation paradigms,
  • Skills in software development,
  • The ability to work both as a member of a team and individually and,
  • The ability to inspire, collaborate, and communicate with influence.

Competency in cyber warfare, electronic warfare or command and control would be well regarded.

Application Closing Date: Wednesday 1 June 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, reference DSTG/02110/22

on https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=2DE92CAC-53DD-4F4A-AA95-C88D8314FEDE .

title: Team Lead Data Management | Adelaide
description:
Team Lead Data Management | Sydney

Novotech is the Asia-Pacific CRO designed for biotech, accelerating clinical development via cutting-edge technology to improve patient lives.

Working in a fast-paced and adaptable environment, we strive to set the benchmark for both business and clinical trial performance across all clinical trial phases and therapeutic areas.

Our people are critical in meeting organizational, and client objectives and we place a strong emphasis on creating a collaborative, transparent, and inclusive work environment where everyone is supported to achieve.

About the Position

The Team Lead Data Management will have responsibility for Data Management staff as assigned and ensures that line reports conduct clinical trials according to all applicable Good Clinical Practice (GCP), Regulatory Requirements, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and the Project Agreement

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage a team of professional Data Management staff.
  • Define and prioritize resource requirements and manage resource assignments across projects.
  • Actively contribute to recruitment of new staff.
  • Review and prioritise resource allocation on projects, liaising with CDM/PM as required.
  • Ensure on-boarding, training and integration of all new line reports and that process is completed as per company policy. Ensure that they understand the company policies and procedures appropriate to their position
  • Performance management of line reports; set and agree written goals and objectives, competency assessments, coordinate salary reviews and promotions and maintain succession plans.
  • Support the delivery of consistent training and development of line reports in order to develop growth and promotion from within the Data Management group
  • Ensure adhere to Company policies, procedures and guidelines and be quality minded in performance of duties

Skills, Knowledge and Experience

  • A degree in clinical, biological or mathematical sciences or related field, with a minimum of 4-6 years of relevant work experience.
  • Advanced knowledge of Data Management processes and systems.
  • Outstanding written and oral communication skills are required.
  • Solid understanding of clinical drug development process is preferred.
  • Proven leadership skills and the ability to lead by example and to encourage team members to seek solutions.
  • Previous people management experience is preferred.
  • Excellent organisational skills and demonstrated ability to manage projects

Novotech is proud to offer a great workplace. We are committed to being an employer of choice for gender equality and providing an inclusive work environment where everyone is treated fairly and with respect.

Our team members are passionate about what we do, but we understand work is only of the things that is important to them. We support our team members with flexible working options, paid parental leave for both parents, flexible leave entitlements, wellness programs and ongoing development programs.

We are looking for people who are passionate about working clinical research and biotech, including people who identify as LGBTIQ+, have a disability or have caring responsibilities.

We are a Circle Back Initiative Employer and commit to respond to every application. We look forward to contacting you regarding your application.

Our graduates are the new urban professionals, global citizens at ease with the world and ready to create and respond to change. Core Responsibilities

  • Analyse and interpret qualitative and quantitative data through the application of various business intelligence tools
  • Provide specialist advice on institutional and market information for strategic planning, institutional benchmarking, and university-wide performance measurement
  • Evaluate, prioritise, and respond to data requests from key internal and external stakeholders
  • Utilise a variety of methods and tools to interpret and present complex data and information to audiences at all levels
  • Develop and maintain effective business partnerships, using a consultancy approach


Essential Skills and Experience

  • Relevant tertiary qualification and experience in a relevant field, or an equivalent combination of relevant experience and/or education
  • Expertise in the use of Business Intelligence tools and statistical techniques
  • Ability to extract, manage and manipulate complex datasets
  • High level writing and presentation skills, and ability to present information in a clear and concise manner
  • Well-developed business partnership skills, with experience in negotiating and problem-solving with clients


Benefits

Getting a great job working with the best is just the start. UniSA rewards its staff with a wide variety of benefits such as:

  • Access to great personal development opportunities
  • Generous superannuation contributions of 17%
  • Flexible working conditions
  • Employee assistance and development programs
  • A range of salary packaging options, including vehicle leasing, laptops and car parking fees


Culture

As a University of Enterprise, we offer a dynamic and agile workplace culture, one that embraces challenges and thrives on breaking new ground. Our staff are creative and innovative thinkers, communicating with clarity, conviction and enthusiasm. We embrace diversity and inclusion in a vibrant, engaging environment. Our people are authentic, resilient, and influential, and we deliver results.

How to Apply

For a copy of the position description and to apply, please visit Working at UniSA. The online application form will list the specific selection criteria that you need to address.

Please address your cover letter to Jade Windsor, Senior Consultant: Recruitment Central . For further information about the position or the recruitment process, please contact UniSA Recruitment Central on +61 8 8302 1700 or via email at recruitment@unisa.edu.au using job reference number 4029 .

Applications close: 11.30pm Wednesday 1 June 2022

Applications welcomed from Australian or NZ citizens, Australian permanent residents and those who have the legal right to work in Australia for the term of appointment.

#LI-DNI

title: Intelligent Agents Scientist APS 4/5-6 (S&T Level 3-4) and EL 1 (S&T Level 5)
description:
The Role
Cyber and Electronic Warfare Division is seeking an early to mid-career researcher to advance the state of the art with respect to intelligent agents and autonomous systems for information warfare. The researcher will be working with a team of scientists and engineers developing self-aware and self-adaptive agents that will be deployed in multi-agent contested environments.

Duties shall include:

  • Researching and architecting algorithms for multi-agent teaming, goal based reasoning and trust management,
  • Identifying gaps in existing multi-agent technologies,
  • Developing prototypes of intelligent agents,
  • Conducting experiments with intelligent agents in both synthetic and real Defence environments and,
  • Working with collaborators internal to DSTG and within academia and industry.

This position will be filled at either S&T3-4 or S&T5 and will be determined by the level of relevant expertise of the successful candidate.


About our Team
Cyber and Electronic Warfare Division undertakes research and development focused on identifying, analysing and countering threats to Australia's defence and national security through electronic means.

The mission of Contested Communications is to develop survivable tactical communications and electronic warfare solutions for contested and degraded cyber electromagnetic environments.
Information Warfare Command and Control (IWC2) STC conducts research and development of command and control (C2) technologies for fighting in and through the contested information environment. Information warfare (IW) occurs within the machine, and necessitates an approach that relies heavily on autonomous operation of cyber, EW and influence operations capabilities, under the oversight of a human command element.

IWC2 research themes include:

  • Information warfare C2 paradigms,
  • Antifragile multi-agent architectures,
  • Autonomous control methodologies,
  • Machine-human integration,
  • Causal modelling and,
  • Scalable and elastic coordination technologies.

We seek to collaborate with others working in similar areas so as to increase critical mass and achieve maximal impact for Defence.

Our Ideal Candidate
Our ideal candidate shall demonstrate initiative and integrity, and have a passion for developing machine intelligence.

Desirable skills and experience include:

  • Ability to think conceptually, to structure, analyse and solve complex problems through sound research and engineering practices,
  • Knowledge of machine learning, computational intelligence, multi-agent coordination and cooperation, and/or system self-organisation paradigms,
  • Skills in software development,
  • The ability to work both as a member of a team and individually and,
  • The ability to inspire, collaborate, and communicate with influence.

Competency in cyber warfare, electronic warfare or command and control would be well regarded.

Application Closing Date: Wednesday 1 June 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, reference DSTG/02110/22

on https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=2DE92CAC-53DD-4F4A-AA95-C88D8314FEDE .

title: Scientist (Lincoln, New Zealand)
description:
The Role and Opportunity

Please note this role is based in Lincoln, New Zealand.

AgResearch is looking for an enthusiastic and dedicated Scientist to join the Computational Agricultural Systems Team in Lincoln, New Zealand, on a full-time, permanent basis.

Agricultural systems modelling capabilities are strategically important for AgResearch. This position is to further expand these capabilities, especially expertise in APSIM, a comprehensive model for simulating biophysical processes in agricultural systems.

What You will be Doing

The successful candidate will primarily contribute to the delivery of projects in the areas of agricultural systems modelling. Specific project allocation will be done based on the candidate’s expertise. They will be expected to provide scientific thought leadership and deliver research outcomes within these projects. The agreed research outcomes will contribute to the intellectual environment of the research group and science in general.

This role involves operating as part of multi-disciplinary project teams to deliver high-quality science outcomes relevant to agricultural industry priorities.

Your Ideal Background

  • PhD in a biophysical aspect of agricultural science or a related discipline
  • Experience of applying quantitative system models to understand, and diagnose problems, and/or develop potential solutions relevant to pastoral agricultural systems
  • Experience in writing or adapting code in a programming or scripting language
  • Experience in developing tools (e.g., scripts) for automating tasks relevant to model application and handling large amounts of data
  • A track record of high-quality peer-reviewed publications
  • The ability to prioritise competing demands and manage your time effectively
  • Excellent communication, organisational and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work autonomously while being part of a collaborative team
  • Demonstrates safe workplace behaviour by taking all practicable steps to ensure own and other’s safety in the workplace

Our Benefits

When your work environment fits your values and your lifestyle, it is a better place to be. Our campuses are green, open, and developing, allowing you to enjoy your work and be productive at the same time – we offer flexibility (work from home, flexible hours) and generous benefits to make sure our people feel supported and enjoy being part of the AgResearch team.

You can view the complete list here: http://www.agresearchcareers.co.nz/working-here/our-benefits/

How to Apply

This role will suit a passionate, talented and collaborative person who is motivated to drive their career forward within this vital New Zealand organisation. If this sounds like you, apply today using the link below, including a cover letter detailing why you feel you would be suitable for this position.

For further information, please contact Munir Shah, Computational Agri Systems Team on Munir.Shah@agresearch.co.nz .

Applications close: Wednesday 25 May 2022

title: GEOINT Senior Research Engineer
description:
About us:

STELaRLab is Lockheed Martin’s first dedicated multi-disciplinary research lab to be setup outside of the US and conducts research in artificial intelligence, signal and image processing, communication systems and multidomain operations (MDO) to deliver exciting outcomes that advance Australian capability.

About the role:

This newly created role of GEOINT Senior Research Engineer will perform research/and or product development encompassing multiple engineering or scientific disciplines, including Computer Science, Signal and Image Processing, Analytics, Machine Learning and or other associated disciplines.   Duties will include:

  • Execute and supervise R&D projects.
  • Design and implement technical solutions.
  • Develop and enhance expertise in adjacent strategic technology domains.
  • Partner with academia, government and industry where required to complete projects.

Essential skills and experience:

  • PhD or equivalent experience plus Tertiary qualifications in a mathematical/scientific discipline from a recognised institute.
  • Proven application of specialist technical expertise in R&D.
  • Expert professional scientific or engineering experience in GEOINT processing.
  • Software development skills in Python, MATLAB, C++, or similar.

Desirable knowledge and experience:

  • Skills and expertise in Machine Learning.

How we reward and support you:

At Lockheed Martin we value our team and the contribution they make every day. We offer rewarding career pathways working on interesting projects that make a difference, continuous professional development and the opportunity to learn from a diverse team of talented individuals.

In return we offer:

  • Innovation at its finest.
  • Options for genuine work/life flexibility – 9 day fortnight.
  • Membership to Destination Discounts – that saves you money on many every day purchases including supermarkets, petrol, department stores to name a few.
  • Salary packaging for car leasing.

Special Requirements:

This position requires the successful candidate to hold a current Commonwealth Defence Clearance at the TSPV level.

Equal Opportunity Statement:

Lockheed Martin supports Equal Employment Opportunity and Diversity in the workplace by creating a place of employment that is, harassment free, diverse, fair, ethical, inclusive, and values the contribution of all its employees. Diversity and inclusion are the foundation of our culture and reflect our values of doing what’s right, respecting others and performing with excellence. By leveraging our employees’ unique talents and experiences, we will deliver innovative, affordable solutions and unparalleled customer value.

title: Voice and Data Communications Capability Leader
description:
The Opportunity

This is a key senior leadership role for an Engineering Capability Leader within the Mission Systems & Ground Systems Capability. The successful applicant will possess the following attributes:

  • Dynamic, innovative and likes to think outside the square;
  • Team orientated, influential and likes a challenge;
  • An advocate for diversity and inclusion and will be actively involved in leading change;
  • An excellent communicator who can engage and motivate diverse and geographically dispersed teams;
  • Outcome focused and demonstrates strong values-based leadership.

This role is based in Brisbane.

Responsibilities

Responsibilities will include:

  • Lead, develop and engage employees and management team;
  • Strategic workforce planning including the provision of resources to meet multiple project demands and secure future opportunities;
  • Develop and lead the capability growth strategy, including Product, Technology and People, in the area of Voice and Data Communications to align with the BDA business plans and roadmaps;
  • Support executing projects and campaigns within BDA through provision of people, processes and tools to ensure they are successful in meeting our customer expectations;
  • Enable collaboration across the business to identify and leverage commonalities, innovation and efficiencies.

Experience/Qualifications

The successful applicant will have:

  • 10+ years leadership experience in a technical environment;
  • Tertiary qualifications and experience in a field of relevance to Voice and Data Communications;
  • Leadership experience within a matrix organisation (desirable);
  • Applicants must be Australian Citizens to meet defence security requirements.

About Us

Boeing Defence Australia is shaping the future of aerospace and delivering some of the nation's most important programs for the Australian Defence Force. As a BDA employee, you will join other innovative, ethical people who have the critical skills required to develop and deliver world class capabilities and systems to protect Australia and its national interests. Joining us is a chance to make your mark, working with a diverse team that is united in pushing the boundaries of imagination and excellence.

We encourage movement within the organisation; our aim is to nurture our existing employees and help them reach their full potential.

BDA is dedicated to providing a diverse and flexible work environment so that we can recruit and retain the best talent. As such, we would welcome applications for Full Time, Part Time and flexible work arrangements.

BDA is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages women and people of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Island descent and ex-defence personnel to be part of an organisation that promotes a diverse and safe workplace environment.

Benefits

  • Flexible working options
  • Study assistance
  • Salary packaging
  • Employee Incentive Program
  • Global opportunities

Boeing has implemented a new COVID-19 Vaccination Policy in Australia that requires all new Boeing Australia hires to show proof of being fully vaccinated from COVID-19, or have an approved medical exemption. This role is categorised as Group 1 under the Boeing Australia COVID-19 Vaccination and Safety Controls Policy.

If you would like to see your career take off click Apply now.

If would like more information please view the role description or speak to your Human Resources Consultant.

title: Data Management & digital Security officer
description:
Provide Data Management & digital Security to secure Dept of Defences research into prototyping guided weapons. 12 Months minimum contract

  • Requires past experience as a Data Manager and Australian Citizenship essential (For security Clearances)
  • $ Based on Experience
  • 12 month full time contract, with potential to go longer

Your Next Employer...

You'll be working with the R&D department for the Department of Defence (Defence Science Technology Group, DTSG) in Edinburgh.

DSTG is currently supporting research into guided weapons prototyping.

The Role...

1. Develop and implement efficient and secure procedures for data handling and compliant with all DSTG policies;

2. Ensure digital databases and archives are protected from security breaches and data losses;

3. Support staff with the use of data systems

You Will Need...

1. Proven experience as Data manager

2. Proficient in MS Office

3. To be an Australian Citizen

For more information, call Soyuz on 03 9573 1500

title: Geospatial Engineer - Adelaide
description:
Nova Systems Geospatial is a multidisciplinary team of Software Developers, Designers, DevOps Specialists and Geospatial Consultants with a proven track record of building and supplying innovative, high value enterprise spatially enabled software and data solutions. The Geospatial team leads the development of software and geospatial solutions and the provision of geospatial products at Nova Systems. Our services are a significant part of Nova's broad range of professional services across Defence, Essential Services, Land Management, Government, Utilities, Energy and Resources.

We are flexible in the way we work, and receptive to improving process and ways of bringing new ideas to life through innovation. We challenge convention when it is in the interest of our customers and actively seek employees that think the same way. Our success is built on collaboration, so you can expect to work closely with your colleagues and customers in our mission to build and deliver high value solutions.

We pride ourselves on transparency, compassion for our people and building a safe, fun and inclusive environment where everyone has the freedom to be their full self. Just to seal the deal, you'll get heaps of flexibility on how you work and be part of a culture where you can contribute and succeed.

About the Role:

We have opportunities for Geospatial Engineers with a strong background in IT working with our team of specialists. In this role, you will be able to engage closely with our clients to provide cutting edge geospatial technological solutions. Our projects span across enterprise geospatial applications, spatial data processing, visualisation, analytics, and platform maintenance. A consultative approach to working with clients is a key enabler for this role.

What you will be involved in:

  • A variety of technical work focused on geospatial platform configuration, customization, and deployment
  • Using geospatial (GIS) software and processes to perform spatial data analysis, visualization, and translation
  • Helping develop project requirements and solution design
  • Supporting the optimization, maintenance, and upgrade of geospatial platforms
  • Being part of a talented and motivated multidisciplinary team, with a focus on building high quality geospatial solutions and products
  • Working in a collaborative, lean and agile environment
  • Delivering successful customer outcomes

What we would expect from you:

  • Demonstrated experience with commercial or Open-Source geospatial platforms such as ESRI, FME, Mapbox, Geoserver, Leaflet, or Google
  • Skills and experience in the automation of geospatial software and data processes using modern scripting languages, such as Python
  • Working knowledge of the software development life cycle, software deployment processes and cloud infrastructure
  • The ability to thrive in a fast-paced work environment and customer facing role
  • A Bachelor's degree in associated business disciplines (Geomatics, Land Information, Geography, Computer Science, Information Technology, Remote Sensing)
  • Australian Citizenship and the ability to obtain and maintain a Defence security clearance

Nova's Value Proposition; Beyond the pay cheque:

In addition to salary, you are supported with:

  • Flexible working conditions to suit individual needs and dress for your day
  • Commitment to Professional and Personal Development (up to $5000 per year)
  • Reward & Recognition Program offering exclusive discounts from hundreds of major retailers, helping you to save on groceries, petrol, holidays and more!
  • Additional Leave entitlements include Reserve Leave, Loyalty Leave, Parental Leave and Purchased Leave
  • Wellbeing Hub with access to health and fitness content
  • Employee Assistance Program for employees and family members
  • Access to Defence Health and Travel Insurance
  • Novated Leasing and Salary Sacrifice
  • Nova Employee Share Offer
  • An inclusive and supportive culture
  • A range of other great benefits, just ask us!

To apply, please click on the "apply now" button and submit your resume using the "upload resume" function in PDF Format (only).

Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please call Serena in Nova Talent Acquisition Team on: (08) 8252 7100

Nova Systems does not accept any recruitment agency solicitations.

title: Applied Intelligence Support (Data Hub, AiOps, Visualisation)
description:
DXC Technology (DXC: NYSE) is the world’s leading independent, end-to-end IT services company, helping clients harness the power of innovation to thrive on change. Created by the merger of CSC and the Enterprise Services business of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, DXC Technology serves nearly 6,000 private and public sector clients across 70 countries.  The company’s technology independence, global talent and extensive partner network combine to deliver powerful next-generation IT services and solutions. DXC Technology is recognized among the best corporate citizens globally. For more information, visit www.dxc.com

Our Applied Intelligence Team (Datahub, AiOps and Visualization products) provides a foundation of information management and analytic capabilities to harness all value from data that matters, to deliver insights at the speed of business and improve business outcomes. Platform X Applied Intelligence products harness the power of data mining, machine learning, Journey Analytics and predictive intelligence to create actionable insight from an operation’s digital footprint.

You will provide support function for our regional toolset covering Applied Intelligence (Datahub, AiOps and Visualisation) activities, that are underpinned by Amazon Web Services (AWS) S3, Athena, AWS IAM and Github. Where an issue is unable to be resolved work with the Intelligence development teams to work through the root cause and issue resolution.

Essential Job Functions

  • Understanding of how to navigate and trouble shoot issues with AWS data toolsets.

Basic Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, or related field preferred
  • Three or more years of experience with computer systems or networking
  • Experience working with file and system maintenance procedures

Other Qualifications

  • Good organization skills to balance and prioritize work, and multitask
  • Good analytical and problem solving skills to troubleshoot systems problems
  • Good communication skills to communicate with support personnel, customers, and managers
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Ability to work from home
  • May require on-call and evening work to work with our partners in the US and India
  • Australian Citizenship

Essential Skills/Qualifications:

  • Knowledge and experience in Intelligence / Visualization applications. Support would include, but are not limited to, providing deep level technical support for incidents/break-fix, Participating in DevOps Concepts & Agile methodology. Below are role description/responsibilities (not all inclusive):
  • Data science exposure / experience
  • Hands-On support experience in Intelligence / Visualization applications.
  • Knowledge of key tools used (AWS) S3, AWS Athena, Python, SQL, Ability to do API calls from the desktop , Linux, Windows and Github.
  • Fulfill requests, Investigate and resolve application and infrastructure related incidents
  • Contribute and adhere to defined Request, Incident, Problem and Change Management processes and required SLAs.
  • Perform application run and maintain functions as defined
  • Deploy application releases and patches, update sets using Pipeline release mechanism
  • Participate in the On Call rotation for Severity 1 and 2 incident resolutions
  • Work with product engineering teams to build, design and implement automation, tooling, and coding to continuously improve applications and systems reliability, scalability, and performance
  • Work with product engineering teams throughout the software life cycle ensuring sustainable software releases
  • Act as escalation point for complex or critical issues that have not yet been documented as Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
  • Utilize a deep understanding of service topology and their dependencies required to troubleshoot issues, define mitigations, and facilitate blameless post evaluations
  • Maintain and adhere to operational documentation of standard processes and best practices
  • Maintain application specific support documentation
  • ITIL Process knowledge

Desirable Skills/Qualifications:

  • Knowledge of AWS, DevOps tools: Jenkins, GitHub including Automated Release Pipelines
  • Knowledge of SQL, REST and Integration

Our culture and benefits

DXC is committed to building better futures for our customers, colleagues, environment, and communities. We take care of each other and foster a culture of inclusion, belonging and corporate citizenship. We put this to action developing and implementing societal initiatives within our Social Impact Practice . #WeAreDXC

As an employer of choice, our “people first” philosophy means we offer competitive remuneration, benefits, training and career opportunities that reflect our commitment to improving the lives of our employees, and the communities in which we live and work. Some of these include;

  • Extensive resources to support your onboarding and continual development including DXC University
  • DXC Recognition, our global virtual platform that fosters a culture of appreciation and celebration with real-time reward and recognition
  • We know that great people refer great people. We will reward you when you bring your friends and family to work at DXC
  • More time to do the things you love with flexible leave options, including purchased leave
  • Take time to give back with charitable and emergency services volunteer days
  • Well-being matters to us and our Employee Assistance Program is there to support you and your family
  • And of course, all the basics; novated leasing, discounted health insurance, paid parental leave and many other discounts


Australian Citizenship is essential for this role.

If you're interested in the role and your skills and experience match what we're looking for, please apply!

title: ASO6 Data Analyst (Multiple Positions)
description:
The Data Analyst in the Performance Reporting and Analytics team is responsible for coordinating and undertaking a range of complex data analyses and writing high quality reports which can be used to identify policy and strategic implications. The work of the Data Analyst informs and complements the department’s business intelligence capability and capacity to analyse, manipulate and present data in ways that support the strategic directions of the agency and government.

Please note there are 2 x full-time (1.0 FTE) contracts up to 30 June 2023 and one full-time (1.0 FTE) ongoing role.

Please note to be employed by the department, applicants must be vaccinated against COVID-19 or have an approved medical exemption endorsed by a duly qualified medical practitioner. Unvaccinated people must comply with conditions for unvaccinated people as outlined in the Department’s website. Proof of vaccination status must be provided for sighting on request.

The successful applicant is required to gain a Department for Human Services (DHS) working with children check (WWCC) prior to being employed which is required to be renewed every five years before expiry. The incumbent will be required to undertake RRHAN –EC (Responding to Risks of Harm, Abuse and Neglect - Education Care) Facilitator Lead (Masterclass) extended course or the online (Fundamentals) course which will be required to be updated every three years.
For all other Special Conditions please refer to the Role Description.

Applicants are required to submit a CV, the Application Cover Sheet, Employment Declaration, and a written statement of no more than 1500 words. Written statements should address the criteria outlined in the Role Description. Applicants should include the name, address and contact number of three (3) referees, one being your current line manager.

Enquiries may be addressed to Sandra Pattison on Tel: 8226 1104 or Email: Sandra.pattison@sa.gov.au

For further information and details on how to apply for this vacancy, please go to iworkfor.sa.gov.au and search for vacancy number 484175.

The South Australian public sector promotes diversity and flexible ways of working including part-time. Applicants are encouraged to discuss the flexible working arrangements for this role.

Closing date is 22/05/2022  5.00PM

title: Research Scientist
description:
The Opportunity
The primary purpose of the role is to manage and deliver scientific outcomes relating to the South Australian Marine Scalefish Fishery, South Australian Lakes and Coorong Fishery (Finfish) and provide scientific support to other projects in the Community-Based Fisheries Sub-Program within the Fisheries Program at SARDI Aquatic Sciences. The Community-Based Fisheries Sub-Program undertakes stock assessments and carries out biological and ecological research to meet the information needs of managers charged with responsibility for managing sustainable exploitation and equitable allocation of finfish fisheries resources in South Australia.

The role contributes to delivering high-quality scientific information and advice to facilitate the sustainable management of community-based fishery resources in South Australian waters, through successful and timely delivery of research, publishing stock assessment reports and articles in peer-reviewed scientific journals. The role contributes to the research assessments and projects overseen by the Community-Based Fisheries Sub-Program. The primary focus of the group is on the population dynamics and fisheries biology of key finfish species and application of the daily egg production method to estimate spawning biomass. Fishery dependent and biological data are integrated in stock assessments that determine the status of harvested populations. The primary outputs are stock assessment reports that provide the scientific basis for sustainable fisheries management. Scientific findings are published in peer-reviewed reports, and national and international journals. Research findings are also communicated directly to PIRSA fisheries managers, fishery licence holders and national and international scientists through relevant steering committees, meetings and conferences. The role is also responsible for exploring opportunities for external funding to conduct new research projects.

The role contributes delivering the agency’s priorities including securing production through biosecurity and efficient and sustainable use of resources.

About Us
The Department of Primary Industries and Regions, as a key economic development agency of the South Australian Government, works across a diverse range of industry sectors including agriculture, livestock, forestry, fishing and aquaculture and regional development. We involve and engage with others to ensure we make good decisions, have clear policies, plan and implement effective programs, drive relevant projects, promote efficient resource use and broker shared responsibility. title: Python Developer
description:
Python Developer

$120k - $130k plus super - ESOP available
Remote distributed team throughout Australia - WFH - offices available in Sydney



If you're a Python Developer who's all about solving interesting problems with robust, well-tested back end logic, then this is the role you've been looking for.

You'd be joining a world-class team of engineers on a truly one-of-a-kind payment & financial management application. The platform has already been extremely well received by the Australian market. Following a $20 million funding round, the plan now is to (quite literally) take on the world.

You'll be joining the team to as they look to internationalise the platform. That means integrating with a new card issuing partner who can support global payments, as well as a rift of new feature/product builds to service and overseas userbase.


Key skills/experience

There's a strong, quality focused engineering culture here, that champions TDD and well designed, well tested solutions. As well as implementing code, you'll also be involved with solution design/architecture and advocating for best practices like TDD.

Key tools/tech you'll work with day-to-day include:

  • Python
  • AWS
  • Relational databases like Postgres/MySQL


Other things that make this role interesting:

  • You'll be joining a business with massive investment that's growing. Fast. That means real opportunity to climb into more senior, challenging positions as the company develops
  • A role that *actually* supports home working. You'll be working as part of a fully distributed team. There's an office in Sydney if you want to use it. It's not mandatory though.
  • Whilst you'll be working on a product that's market tested, there's still a ton of new things to build, and challenges to be worked through. If you enjoy the process of solving technical problems, there's heaps to keep you engaged.


Want to find out more? Just hit "apply" to register your interest.

Alternatively contact Jay at Aurec for more details on this and other Python Developer positions that are remote or remote-first.

title: Research Scientist
description:
The Opportunity
The primary purpose of the role is to manage and deliver scientific outcomes relating to the South Australian Marine Scalefish Fishery, South Australian Lakes and Coorong Fishery (Finfish) and provide scientific support to other projects in the Community-Based Fisheries Sub-Program within the Fisheries Program at SARDI Aquatic Sciences. The Community-Based Fisheries Sub-Program undertakes stock assessments and carries out biological and ecological research to meet the information needs of managers charged with responsibility for managing sustainable exploitation and equitable allocation of finfish fisheries resources in South Australia.

The role contributes to delivering high-quality scientific information and advice to facilitate the sustainable management of community-based fishery resources in South Australian waters, through successful and timely delivery of research, publishing stock assessment reports and articles in peer-reviewed scientific journals. The role contributes to the research assessments and projects overseen by the Community-Based Fisheries Sub-Program. The primary focus of the group is on the population dynamics and fisheries biology of key finfish species and application of the daily egg production method to estimate spawning biomass. Fishery dependent and biological data are integrated in stock assessments that determine the status of harvested populations. The primary outputs are stock assessment reports that provide the scientific basis for sustainable fisheries management. Scientific findings are published in peer-reviewed reports, and national and international journals. Research findings are also communicated directly to PIRSA fisheries managers, fishery licence holders and national and international scientists through relevant steering committees, meetings and conferences. The role is also responsible for exploring opportunities for external funding to conduct new research projects.

The role contributes delivering the agency’s priorities including securing production through biosecurity and efficient and sustainable use of resources.

About Us
The Department of Primary Industries and Regions, as a key economic development agency of the South Australian Government, works across a diverse range of industry sectors including agriculture, livestock, forestry, fishing and aquaculture and regional development. We involve and engage with others to ensure we make good decisions, have clear policies, plan and implement effective programs, drive relevant projects, promote efficient resource use and broker shared responsibility.
