title: Data Consultant (SA/WA/NT)
description:
The Australian Research Data Commons (ARDC) is a transformational initiative that is enabling access to nationally significant, leading edge data intensive eInfrastructure, platforms, skills and collections of high-quality data for the Australian research community and industry.

The purpose of the ARDC is to provide Australian researchers with a competitive advantage through data.

We are looking to welcome to the team an experienced and highly effective individual to the position of Data Consultant . You will understand the research sector in Western Australia, South Australia and the Northern Territory.  You will have experience working in a commonwealth funded research environment and be able to bring your skills and knowledge to the role to help advance the ARDC’s mission in WA, SA and the NT.

The purpose of this key role is to work at international, national, and local levels with current and prospective partners to communicate ARDC’s capabilities, identify upcoming research challenges and potential solutions, and build communities that promote best practice in activities relating to ARDC’s data, platform, infrastructure, and skills programs.

In this role you will experience a diverse range of exciting challenges in a unique and fast paced environment.  We can guarantee that no day will be the same!

The ideal candidate will have a PhD or comparable experience working in academic research and/or a thorough understanding of the research process. They will have worked in or closely with (local/national/international) research organisations and facilities and will have successfully engaged with diverse groups of stakeholders within institutions, research facilities and/or research groups.

On offer is a competitive remuneration package depending on the successful candidates skills and experience. This role is employed through the University of Adelaide and is based in Adelaide. While this role is primarily based in South Australia it is also responsible for WA and NT engagements and some national programs and domestic and international travel may be required.

You can access the Position Description here:

https://bit.ly/ARDCdataconsultant

If you would like to find out more about the role please contact:

Keith Russell, Manager Engagements on 0427 452 342 or via email keith.russell@ardc.edu.au

Applications close on Friday 10 June 2022.

To submit an application please click 'Apply for this job' and include your current CV, response to the Key Selection Criteria from the Position Description and two referees. Please address applications to Keith Russell.

No agencies please

title: Applied Intelligence Support (Data Hub, AiOps, Visualisation)
description:
DXC Technology (DXC: NYSE) is the world’s leading independent, end-to-end IT services company, helping clients harness the power of innovation to thrive on change. Created by the merger of CSC and the Enterprise Services business of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, DXC Technology serves nearly 6,000 private and public sector clients across 70 countries.  The company’s technology independence, global talent and extensive partner network combine to deliver powerful next-generation IT services and solutions. DXC Technology is recognized among the best corporate citizens globally. For more information, visit www.dxc.com

Our Applied Intelligence Team (Datahub, AiOps and Visualization products) provides a foundation of information management and analytic capabilities to harness all value from data that matters, to deliver insights at the speed of business and improve business outcomes. Platform X Applied Intelligence products harness the power of data mining, machine learning, Journey Analytics and predictive intelligence to create actionable insight from an operation’s digital footprint.

You will provide support function for our regional toolset covering Applied Intelligence (Datahub, AiOps and Visualisation) activities, that are underpinned by Amazon Web Services (AWS) S3, Athena, AWS IAM and Github. Where an issue is unable to be resolved work with the Intelligence development teams to work through the root cause and issue resolution.

Essential Job Functions

  • Understanding of how to navigate and trouble shoot issues with AWS data toolsets.

Basic Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, or related field preferred
  • Three or more years of experience with computer systems or networking
  • Experience working with file and system maintenance procedures

Other Qualifications

  • Good organization skills to balance and prioritize work, and multitask
  • Good analytical and problem solving skills to troubleshoot systems problems
  • Good communication skills to communicate with support personnel, customers, and managers
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Ability to work from home
  • May require on-call and evening work to work with our partners in the US and India
  • Australian Citizenship

Essential Skills/Qualifications:

  • Knowledge and experience in Intelligence / Visualization applications. Support would include, but are not limited to, providing deep level technical support for incidents/break-fix, Participating in DevOps Concepts & Agile methodology. Below are role description/responsibilities (not all inclusive):
  • Data science exposure / experience
  • Hands-On support experience in Intelligence / Visualization applications.
  • Knowledge of key tools used (AWS) S3, AWS Athena, Python, SQL, Ability to do API calls from the desktop , Linux, Windows and Github.
  • Fulfill requests, Investigate and resolve application and infrastructure related incidents
  • Contribute and adhere to defined Request, Incident, Problem and Change Management processes and required SLAs.
  • Perform application run and maintain functions as defined
  • Deploy application releases and patches, update sets using Pipeline release mechanism
  • Participate in the On Call rotation for Severity 1 and 2 incident resolutions
  • Work with product engineering teams to build, design and implement automation, tooling, and coding to continuously improve applications and systems reliability, scalability, and performance
  • Work with product engineering teams throughout the software life cycle ensuring sustainable software releases
  • Act as escalation point for complex or critical issues that have not yet been documented as Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
  • Utilize a deep understanding of service topology and their dependencies required to troubleshoot issues, define mitigations, and facilitate blameless post evaluations
  • Maintain and adhere to operational documentation of standard processes and best practices
  • Maintain application specific support documentation
  • ITIL Process knowledge

Desirable Skills/Qualifications:

  • Knowledge of AWS, DevOps tools: Jenkins, GitHub including Automated Release Pipelines
  • Knowledge of SQL, REST and Integration

Our culture and benefits

DXC is committed to building better futures for our customers, colleagues, environment, and communities. We take care of each other and foster a culture of inclusion, belonging and corporate citizenship. We put this to action developing and implementing societal initiatives within our Social Impact Practice . #WeAreDXC

As an employer of choice, our “people first” philosophy means we offer competitive remuneration, benefits, training and career opportunities that reflect our commitment to improving the lives of our employees, and the communities in which we live and work. Some of these include;

  • Extensive resources to support your onboarding and continual development including DXC University
  • DXC Recognition, our global virtual platform that fosters a culture of appreciation and celebration with real-time reward and recognition
  • We know that great people refer great people. We will reward you when you bring your friends and family to work at DXC
  • More time to do the things you love with flexible leave options, including purchased leave
  • Take time to give back with charitable and emergency services volunteer days
  • Well-being matters to us and our Employee Assistance Program is there to support you and your family
  • And of course, all the basics; novated leasing, discounted health insurance, paid parental leave and many other discounts


Australian Citizenship is essential for this role.

If you're interested in the role and your skills and experience match what we're looking for, please apply!

title: Advance Technology Foresight Analyst EL 1 (S&T Level 5)
description:
The Role

The Defence Science and Technology Group (DSTG) is offering two permanent positions as an Advanced Technology Foresight Analyst.

You will develop a sound understanding of a broad range of technologies, including current technologies and those that may be developed in the future. You will work with planners and operations analysts to foresee how these technologies might strengthen or weaken Australia’s national interests.

One position, located in Canberra, will focus on national security and the way it may operate in the future, including foreseeing disruptions or entirely new concepts of operations. The other position, located in Melbourne will focus on Defence capabilities, including foreseeing disruptions or entirely new capabilities. Although the positions are based in Canberra and Melbourne, we are open to the idea of having our candidate work from our in Edinburgh, SA.

The role involves desk-based technical research and analysis as part of a large team responsible for providing emerging technology and foresight advice to Defence and other government departments. You will be responsible for a technical area that corresponds to your current S&T skills, and will broaden your expertise into a range of fields relevant to Defence (for example AI, cyber, biotechnology, quantum and many others).

You will be trained in role-specific analytic skills, including data analytics and foresight techniques. You will develop a deep understanding of the structure and decision-making processes of the Defence Department, to ensure your advice is tailored to have an impact. You will develop into a communications expert, able to concisely explain technical issues to busy, non-technical stakeholders. Outputs will include written reports, verbal briefings, multi-media and infographics. The role requires building networks across our own team of experts, as well as broader DSTG, Defence and intelligence.

About our Team

The technology analyst team is a part of the Defence Impacts of Emerging Technology (DIET) Group, within Strategy and Joint Force (SJF) Major Science and Technology Capability (MSTC), which is itself within the Joint and Operations Analysis Division of the Defence Science and Technology Group (DSTG).

This team is organised under DSTG’s Strategic Futures Project, and works closely with the Critical Technology Foresight (CTF) Group. You will be joining a project team of approximately 25 staff, including technology analysts (like this position), experts in tools and methods (such as AI experts who write programs to assist the analysts) and social scientists (who evaluate the impact of technology on society).

The Strategic Futures Project is a centre of gravity within government for emerging technology and foresight advice. Our advice feeds into decision-making, such as for senior Defence committees, the Department’s S&T portfolio planning and capability planning for the ADF. We play a key role in whole-of-government decision-making via our strong linkages to the Critical Technology Policy Coordination Office in PM&C. We partner with DSTG’s 2000 experts, across Defence, policy and intelligence agencies, and with international experts.

Our team is passionate, professional, welcoming and inclusive.

Our Ideal Candidate

We are seeking an Australian citizen who is naturally curious and motivated to develop broad expertise across diverse emerging technologies. Candidates from all S&T disciplines will be considered, but we especially seek experts in the physical sciences, engineering or systems analysis. We seek science-communicators who are passionate about making an impact for the nation. Ideally you will have experience in the APS, or have been responsible for leading and delivering projects in academia or industry. A pre-existing interest in Defence is not required, but you must be open to developing this.

S&T 5 level jobs are typically suitable for mid-career professionals rather than entry level jobs for graduates. You will have no formal responsibilities for supervising staff, but you will be expected to show leadership and take responsibility for driving outcomes and enhancing the capabilities of our team.

A PhD or equivalent qualifications/experience is required.

Application Closing date: Sunday the 29th of May 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, Reference DSTG/01524/22 on Link: https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=C698CB16-AE93-03B7-5F70-C88BA749F8D0

title: National Naval Shipbuilding – Multi-discipline Researchers, Scientists/Engineers
description:
In its 2017 Naval Shipbuilding Plan, the Australian Government made clear that a skilled workforce is critical to the success of the National Naval Shipbuilding Enterprise.  As the largest capital investment ever undertaken in Australia, the National Naval Shipbuilding Enterprise represents an entirely new direction in the way Australia underpins its national security interests. We are seeking applications from individuals interested in undertaking challenging, interesting and important work that is front and centre for the Australian Government within the Naval Shipbuilding Enterprise.

Maritime Division uses science and technology to deliver a capability edge to the Australian Defence Force in the maritime domain. We have expertise in a diverse range of technologies including sensors, statistics, materials, propulsion, automation, systems integration, signatures, and ship building. These are combined in a multidisciplinary research program to improve the operational capability, availability, reliability and safety of existing maritime and air platforms, and to reduce their vulnerabilities. We are at the forefront of future systems, including autonomous vehicles, and the Defence Force’s future submarine and surface ship programs. Maritime Division has an emphasis on delivering impact to the Australian Defence Force.

Our ideal candidates will have a passion for and demonstrated ability to solve highly complex problems and demonstrating solutions through prototyping using a high degree of rigor (using proven engineering and or scientific methods). You will be able to apply your knowledge to solve complex real world problems, and work with a diverse range of stakeholders to understand their needs and adjust and communicate their approach accordingly to meet any imposed timelines/milestones, working effectively in a team environment. You will demonstrate good communication skills and be willing to work as part of a team to achieve the required defence outcomes in the information sciences domain.

We have multiple positions available in the following disciplines:

  • Non-Acoustic Signature Management (NASM)

The Non-Acoustic Signature Management group provides research and engineering support to the Maritime Domain, in particular the group supports the following areas:

  • Electromagnetic Signature Control provides a sovereign capability to enhance the operational effectiveness and survivability of current and future platforms through the control of Radar, Infrared and Visible signatures using specialised treatments, computer modelling and measurement techniques.
  • Specialised Coatings and Corrosion Science area enhances the operational effectiveness, safety and availability, and reduces the cost of ownership, of ADF platforms through application of corrosion prevention technologies to minimise platform signatures and structural degradation.

  • Undersea Command and Control (UCC)

The Undersea Command and Control Branch is seeking multiple S&T 3-4 (Above) Researchers to undertake research in the undersea warfare domain. This includes research activities associated with torpedoes, torpedo defence, submarine combat control systems, submarine sonar systems, optronics, and human sciences for enhancing crewing systems and control room design/innovation.

  • Acoustic Signature Management (ASM)

The Acoustic Signature Management branch of Maritime Division provides Australia’s primary capability for the management and control of acoustic signatures, hydrodynamics, and manoeuvring performance of defence maritime platforms.  The branch consist of the Acoustic Signature Control, Hydroacoustics, and Acoustic Materials Systems groups. The work involves analytical and numerical prediction capability and has access to a number of world class experimental facilities.

  • Maritime Platform Performance (MPP)

The Maritime Platform Performance Group provides research and engineering support to the Maritime Domain, in particular the group supports the following areas:

  • The Power and Energy Systems Group provides research and engineering support to the Maritime Domain, in particular the group supports the following areas:
    • Mechanical Systems – research, modelling and engineering support for diesel performance and reliability, energy reduction and waste energy recovery technologies
    • Electrical Systems – development and exploitation of electrical power and energy system models (main propulsion motors, power electronics and hardware power in the loop) and Pb-acid battery performance, integration and optimisation
    • Electro-Chemical – materials development, performance modelling and prognosis and safety assessment of alternative battery chemistries
    • Naval Platform Survivability (NPS) leads the research and development of advanced modelling and technologies to support ADF surface ships and submarines in the areas of material analysis and design; fire-fighting and atmosphere; platform vulnerability and recoverability to underwater and air water weapon effects.
    • Naval Architecture and Platform System Analysis (NAPSA) guides research and development of advanced tools and methods to assess the whole-of-vessel performance for the Australian Defence Force. Whole-of-vessel performance includes: seakeeping; multi-vessel interactions; operational loads; whole-of-vessel performance; structural response; integrated model based systems exploration and design trade-off studies.
  • Littoral Autonomy Sensors and Systems

The Littoral Autonomy Sensors and Systems (LASS) Major Science Technology Capability (MSTC) has a major focus on the development of robotic and autonomous systems (RAS) to support future Navy capabilities, including in littoral and undersea warfare. The MSTC is comprised of three Science and Technology Capabilities (STC) centred around:

  • Robotics, vehicle architectures and autonomy, underwater communications, integration and performance;
  • Sensing and perception, including underwater object detection and classification; and
  • Mine countermeasure systems.

As a member of the MSTC you will collaborate with a team of motivated engineers, scientists and mathematicians whose mission is to increase capability through improved employment of robotic and autonomous systems, and / or the exploitation of sensor data for undersea perception and cueing of autonomous systems.

Application Closing Date: 30 May 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, reference the following links:

DSTG/02466/22 (NASM)

https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=8259F4E9-54F1-5733-D149-C88D853B5DE3

DSTG/2439/22 (UCC)

title: Digital Advertising Graduate Positions at RQmedia
description:
New Graduate roles

  • Looking for the best and brightest who want to work in Digital Media
  • This is a challenging role that requires analytical, data, technical and communciation skills

We are not a creative agency.  We are an advertising performance agency. RQmedia creates and manages ads and takes accountability for our customers sales results.

You must have Year 12 result above 90 and a GPA of at least over 5.5 (please specify your results).

You will work in a team that creates and manages ads in  Google, Facebook and Microsoft - as these are all part of our full service, omni channel offering.

Positions available.

This is an outstanding opportunity for law, business, management, science, maths or commerce students.  No one degree provides you with the skills for what we do (we have successfully employed law, commerce, event management and science grads).  We give you the underlying skills required in the growth economy of digital advertising.  You just need to be top of your class, learn fast, results driven and able to take the rapid pace of our industry.


Required as a minimum:

  • Intelligent and inquiry driven
  • Fast learner
  • Ability to deliver KPIs
  • Excellent English writing ability
  • Persistence
  • Proficient with word processing and spreadsheets
  • Excellent communication skills and a team player
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet scheduled due dates
  • Ability to analyse, report and act on data
  • High attention to detail
  • Ability to take on board customer feedback

If this sounds like you, and you would like to secure an internship with an opportunity to start your career in a market-leading digital organisation, send your resume , a short cover letter and a copy of your university transcript via Seek (combine your docs and upload them together).

You must submit a cover letter addressing our criteria and include your TER and GPA (bullet points are fine!).

This job is only open to Australian permanent residents and citizens. No Agencies please.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Do you love a good lamb roast? We’re developing the world’s best technology to measure meat quality. We need a Senior Software Engineer to help us bring it to market.

Miniprobes is a high-tech spin-out from the University of Adelaide. We use precision fibre-optics and near-infrared lasers to build imaging devices less than a millimetre in diameter. Based on 10 years of R&D, our team has developed a new type of imaging technology which we are using to measure meat quality for the livestock industry.

It’s an exciting time to join Miniprobes . We are developing our first product for commercial release. You can be pivotal in creating this new product. We have the expertise, funding and industry partnerships to deliver it to the livestock industry within the next 2 years. You will be part of the team that develops this product. You will also be a foundational employee in this young company as we start on a trajectory of rapid growth.

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will help us to develop the software that is at the heart of this system. This includes acquisition, processing and analysis of data from our imaging hardware as well as creating tools to remotely manage installed systems. You will be involved in a range of areas including real-time systems, image processing and machine learning, targeted at a Windows platform.

To be considered for this role you will need:

  • Bachelor of Engineering, Computer Science or related area;
  • At least 5 years software development experience;
  • Experience with C++ and OO concepts.

To apply, submit your resume/CV and a cover letter highlighting any skills and experiences that would make you a vital part of our team.

For further information regarding this position, please contact the Director (Software) at rodney.kirk@miniprobes.com .

title: Residential Drafter
description:
Enduro Builders is a technology driven construction company.  We are at the leading edge of Low Energy and Passive House construction in South Australia.

We leverage our IT assets to produce cost efficient homes and industry leading levels of collaboration, making sure details are sorted out BEFORE the building starts.

Having grown our design arm significantly in the last 12 months, we are looking for an experienced residential drafter, preferably with custom home experience.

Being part of a close knit team means that everyone pulls their weight and we all support each other in making sure we are delivering high quality homes, on time, on budget and defect free.

The scope of this drafting role includes;

  • Carrying out Site measures and drawing up existing conditions
  • Residential custom homes, with an occasional commercial project
  • 3D Modelling
  • Leveraging your IT and CAD skills to assist with data collection and cross checking for Estimating
  • Review of Architectural plans for errors and omissions
  • Carrying out material take offs

Do you think you might have these skills?

  • Some Design flair (you don’t have to have it all, but a little of an eye for it would be invaluable)
  • Comfortable working with clients to review and change drawings to reflect their project needs
  • Good knowledge of building terminology
  • Excellent communication and customer service skills
  • Interest in leveraging your IT and CAD skills into Estimating
  • High level of comfort and speed in Revit and Sketchup (weighted more heavily to Revit)

We would love for you to have an interest in Energy Efficient building , building science and have a passion for delivering the best possible result for clients, this role has the potential growth to learn about estimating and project management.

How to Apply

Do you reckon you’re made of the right stuff to be part of our team?

Applying is simple, just follow the instructions below….if you don’t hear back from us, it's because you missed a step!

Simply call Amy on 0448 616 304 to discuss the role and she will give you an email address to send in your application.

title: Enterprise Software Support Analyst
description:
At Esri Australia we share a passion: for solving problems with GIS (Geographical Information Systems) and Enterprise technologies; for contributing to an ongoing geospatial conversation; and collaborating with our clients for a better future.  As part of Esri Australia’s expanding Care Team, you will play a pivotal role in making this vision a reality.

About the team

Join our passionate ArcGIS application enthusiasts and technology specialists to contribute to our well-earned and highly respected team of troubleshooting and solution experts relied upon by a diverse client base. We are proud to support and contribute to ArcGIS solutions supporting both local, national, and even global projects.  Our team members are passionate about the intersection of technology and geographic information systems. We are highly self-driven to grow our skillsets and enthusiastic in our approach to sharing our knowledge with colleagues. Various overlapping backgrounds and skillsets in the team foster plenty of opportunities to share your own expertise and learn from your peers.

We strongly encourage you to apply if you have an enthusiasm for learning new technologies, GIS, problem solving, and knowledge sharing.

About the Role

As an Enterprise Software Support Consultant, you will deliver on our vision and service delivery principles of Ease, Expertise, Collaboration and Consistency, by providing technical software support and training to our clients, ensuring that our contact with clients delivers a user experience consistent with our client experience vision.

Key responsibilities of the role include:

  • Provide high-quality technical software support, training, and customer service to our Esri Australia end users through effective communication and efficient troubleshooting
  • Identify, understand, and articulate solutions for customer issues to resolve ArcGIS Enterprise and related technologies
  • Perform incident management, problem management and change management processes in line with the ITIL best practices
  • Work well in high energy, fast-paced, enthusiastic, positive, and collaborative culture
  • Assist in the development and maintenance of our knowledge base.

Being successful in this role involves being keen to learn more about geospatial technologies, the ArcGIS Enterprise suite, and developing core ArcGIS server-based product knowledge.

It is a fantastic role for an enthusiastic professional willing to apply and grow their Information Technology knowledge and skills across the full stack of ArcGIS Enterprise deployments.

About You

  • Relevant experience and/or qualification (BA preferred) in associated business disciplines (Computer Science, Information Technology)
  • Experience working in software support or technical customer service with the direct end-user contact.
  • Experience with administering Microsoft Windows Server and Linux operating systems highly regarded.
  • Excellent customer service and communication skills. You communicate well in both written and verbal medium. You can communicate effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • The ability to effectively perform fault diagnosis and problem-solving skills; communicate clearly and concisely relevant findings, workarounds, and steps to resolve.
  • Dedicated to continuous learning; a passion for embracing new and emerging technologies.
  • Keen interest and ability to work collaboratively as part of a team.
  • Great attention to detail and time management skills.
  • You must hold current permanent and full-time working rights in Australia.
  • Personality/ Behaviour aligns with Esri Australia’s core values.

The following skills and experience will make a difference:

  • ArcGIS Enterprise (ArcGIS Server, Portal for ArcGIS, and ArcGIS Data Store).
  • Networking Fundamentals (Web server administration, firewalls, load balancing, IIS, DNS, DHCP, TCP/UDP, networking ports).
  • Web Service Fundamentals (SOAP / REST API’s, browser development tools, JavaScript, Python).
  • Web Security and Identity Store integration (Firewalls, SSL Certificates, SSL/TLS, SAML, Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS)).
  • Database Technologies (SQL, MS SQL Server administration, Oracle, PostgreSQL, CouchDB, Elastic).
  • Exposure to environments hosted in Amazon Web Services (AWS) and/or Microsoft Azure Cloud.

For further details or if you have any questions, please contact Tibo Torche, National Talent Acquisition Lead on 07 3218 0448 or mail to ttorche@esriaustralia.com.au .

We are a 2022 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.

Please note that Esri Australia does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies.

title: IT Support Assistant
description:
Our Company

Weber is the Global market leading barbecue brand. It brings with it a rich history, a reputation for high quality products and service, and some of the most engaged and passionate fans and advocates. By bringing food, flavour, friends and family together around the barbecue for over 40 years in Australia, Weber has become an iconic, trusted and loved brand in Australia and New Zealand.

Our Aim is to build Weber’s brand equity through the creation of “positive word of mouth”.

We achieve this by providing exceptional experiences to everyone who comes into contact with the Weber brand, whether they are suppliers, partners, retail customers or Weber owners.

The Role

Working in the IT team, you will work alongside Project Managers, Business Analysts and System Administrators to create and maintain the systems that keep Weber products moving through our network of dealers nationwide and into people’s backyards.

As the business transitions from on premise to cloud solutions, we are looking to add a technical problem solver to assist with the support of multiple business systems across Finance, Logistics, Human Resources, Customer Service, Operations and Retail.

You will be involved in configuring, testing, maintaining and supporting a range of business systems. Collaborating with the IT team and business stakeholders to create efficient, accurate and user-friendly processes, powering the Weber brand.

You

To be the successful applicant you will need to highlight your problem-solving skills, working across a range of hardware and software platforms.

The role will suit a current contractor or self-employed IT professional looking to focus and hone their skills, or a recent graduate looking to commence their career.

Key attributes we are seeking include:

Being able to highlight previous experience with configuring, updating, and supporting business software applications and hardware.

Strong communication and troubleshooting skills.

Customer centric mindset.

Strong time management and prioritisation skills

Tertiary Qualifications in either Technology, Computer Science and Computer Systems or similar is highly desirable.

If this sound likes the job for you please apply with your cover letter and resume.

title: Graduate Digital Support Analyst
description:
Data Action (DA) has over 30 years' experience as a specialist software and services provider to the alternate banking and financial services industry. Operating nationally and servicing a broad client base including customer owned banks, credit unions, neobanks and financial services membership organisations, DA's focus of supporting the financial wellbeing of Australians is echoed through our values:

  • No goldfish - Go beyond your bowl, share knowledge, stay curious and keep learning.
  • Fail forward - Learn from mistakes and keep moving forward.
  • Cheer loudly - Be proud of the team's results and celebrate successes.
  • Own it - Throw yourself in and own your work, taking responsibility until the end.
  • Think Client - Put yourself in our Client's shoes - consider the impact for their customers and deliver.

DA has evolved to become a provider of core banking and digital platforms and services to some of Australia's leading customer-owned, challenger banks, aggregators, and the financial services industry, aligned with our purpose - powering innovation in banking.

DA operates nationally with close to 300 staff based in Adelaide, Sydney, and Melbourne - enhancing the banking experience of more than 1.43 million Australians via its core banking and digital platforms, powering customer transactions across 3.2 million accounts every day.

About the Role:

Our Digital Support Analysts operate and support products provided to our clients - to analyse and problem solve issues presented through testing and/or production environments. This includes, but not limited to, improving operational support including monitoring and alerting of application anomalies by introducing new technologies, deployment processes, test automation and operational excellence practices.

The application of creative solutions to problems and provide timely and accurate communications with clients is a critical component of the role.

You Will be Responsible for:

  • Product upgrade and maintenance deployments
  • Supporting progressive and transparent change management processes
  • Level 1 and Level 2 product support
  • Developing an understanding of the customer's business in specific areas and their use of the system
  • Providing guidance to customers on "how to" and "why" type queries
  • Fault investigation and resolution including the raising of defects, creation and execution of scripts
  • UAT co-ordination including environment preparation, switching on and configuration of new functionality
  • Contributing to the development of new functionality by ensuring solutions are technically sound and always make sure the Application Support team has appropriate knowledge, procedures and documentation in place to support the product suite
  • Assisting in software build upgrades.

What You'll Need to Succeed:

  • Tertiary qualifications in information technology or an aligning field
  • Experience supporting commercial applications using .net or equivalent
  • Understanding of the change management methodologies
  • Understanding of web-based technologies and internet fundamentals is desirable
  • Experience working in a DeVops environment will be highly regarded, as well as experience/certifications in AWS or Azure.

Our Graduate are offered on a 2-year fixed term engagement, with 6-monthly salary increases up to 10% of base salary, based on work performance. Our desire is for you to transition to a permanent role at the end of the two year period. However, you are eligible to move to a permanent position before the end of the Graduate Program if you are doing great work!

DA offers exciting opportunities for professional development and we have a strong focus on career progression for our employees. Flexible and supportive working arrangements are encouraged.

If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you! Please be sure to combine a covering letter addressing the key criteria set out above as the first page of your resume.

To be considered for this role you will need to be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident, or have a current visa that permits you to work in Australia.

We will never ask you to pay for any services or training as part of applying for a position at DA.

For further information please review the job information pack, Reference DSTG/01524/22 on Link: https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=C698CB16-AE93-03B7-5F70-C88BA749F8D0

title: Corporate Finance Analyst
description:
ElectraNet builds, owns, operates, and maintains the South Australian high voltage transmission network that delivers electricity from generators to distributors and major load connected customers, enabling power to be supplied to homes, businesses, and communities.

The Opportunity

As part of our Treasury and Corporate Finance team, you will undertake financial modelling and analysis to assess, research and investigate optimal capital financial plans, project investments and valuations that consider the commercial and regulated environments in which we operate. The role will also undertake portfolio reporting and provide market intelligence and commercial insight to a broad range of stakeholders, from the Board of Directors, Shareholders and Executives through to business leaders.

This position has become available due to an internal promotion and is an excellent opportunity for someone looking to expand their commercial experience in a complex technical environment, operating with the support and guidance of an established team.

Working in the Treasury & Corporate Finance function provides an opportunity to gain exposure to all aspects of the company’s operations.  The work undertaken and outcomes delivered by the function is highly visible across multiple divisions, the Board, Executive and Senior Leaders across the business along with external service providers and investors.  This environment provides the team and individuals with a high level of challenging and career development opportunities.

About You

You will have experience in a similar environment, with proven high-level financial modelling and analysis, forecasting, scenario analysis, capital optimisation and valuations experience.

Your commercial acumen will be underpinned by influential stakeholder engagement skills demonstrated by the ability to effectively communicate and translate complex financial concepts and frameworks in a meaningful way, providing rich market insights and commentary for material and business critical financial planning and decision making.

Your approach will be positive and flexible with an adaptable attitude, a willingness to take on a wide range of diverse tasks and adjust to competing and shifting priorities in a changing environment, to achieve a best for business outcome.

Formal qualifications in Accounting/Finance or a relevant discipline and an approved accountancy or post graduate qualification (e.g., CA / CPA / CFA) is essential.

About Us

Safety is at the heart of all that we do, and our most valuable assets are our people.

Our people are what make ElectraNet a great place to work. We also work flexibly to achieve our outcomes, collaborating in the office, onsite or virtually to ensure we provide energy and infrastructure solutions for a better world.

This is an excellent opportunity to grow your career within a diverse, complex and highly regulated environment.

Click 'Apply' to view the Position Description on our careers page. Applications close Sunday 15 May 2022. Please apply online.

​For further information on all our employee benefits visit our website.

Please follow us on LinkedIn.

title: IT Graduate Program 2023
description:
Are you ready to kickstart your innovation and technology career with one of Australia’s most innovative companies?

SA Power Networks delivers energy solutions to empower South Australia today and in the future. We are always seeking to build a more sustainable, efficient and innovative business that creates real value for our customers.

As one of the State’s largest employers, we have a commitment to integrity and take pride in doing the right thing for our people, customers and community.

Progress your career and help us in empowering South Australia.

We offer award-winning training, an outstanding culture of safety and a supportive environment that encourages you to contribute and recognise your achievements.

Empowering opportunities for Innovation and Technology graduates

We are seeking Innovation and Technology (IT) graduates to join our Graduate Development Program, commencing in February 2023.

Our Graduate Development Program is a two-year fixed term contract where you will have the opportunity to join one of the State’s largest, industry-leading IT teams, offering unmatched opportunities for professional and personal development across our business.

The program includes structured rotations within Innovation and Technology, technical training and experience, mentoring, ongoing support and real career opportunities.

About you:

  • You love to learn and apply new skills in innovative ways
  • You enjoy problem solving with data
  • You have a passion for emerging technologies
  • You are a great communicator and can translate complex solutions to stakeholders
  • You are excited to learn a variety of disciplines, including: project management, automation, Microsoft, SAP, IT operations, cyber security, user experience design and more

To be eligible, you will need to:

  • Have completed your degree or be graduating at the end 2022
  • Be an Australian citizen or permanent resident
  • Be prepared to undertake a pre-employment medical

We are particularly interested in receiving applications from graduates who have specialised in Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Analytics, Information Technology, Cyber Security or similar.

What we offer:

We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. The benefits we offer our employees will allow you to be your best every day. They include:

  • Mentoring opportunities to increase your knowledge and business networks
  • Technical training and experience, including your participation in our graduate rotation
  • Unlimited potential to grow your career
  • Exposure to world-leading projects in digital transformation and future energy
  • Very completive salary package with access to flexible working conditions

Candidates will need to be prepared to undertake a pre-employment medical. Applicants must be Australian citizens or Permanent Residents to apply.

For further information on our graduate program go to https://www.sapowernetworks.com.au/about-us/careers/our-programs/

Or email recruitment@sapowernetworks.com.au

title: Advance Technology Foresight Analyst EL 1 (S&T Level 5)
description:
The Role

The Defence Science and Technology Group (DSTG) is offering two permanent positions as an Advanced Technology Foresight Analyst.

You will develop a sound understanding of a broad range of technologies, including current technologies and those that may be developed in the future. You will work with planners and operations analysts to foresee how these technologies might strengthen or weaken Australia’s national interests.

One position, located in Canberra, will focus on national security and the way it may operate in the future, including foreseeing disruptions or entirely new concepts of operations. The other position, located in Melbourne will focus on Defence capabilities, including foreseeing disruptions or entirely new capabilities. Although the positions are based in Canberra and Melbourne, we are open to the idea of having our candidate work from our in Edinburgh, SA.

The role involves desk-based technical research and analysis as part of a large team responsible for providing emerging technology and foresight advice to Defence and other government departments. You will be responsible for a technical area that corresponds to your current S&T skills, and will broaden your expertise into a range of fields relevant to Defence (for example AI, cyber, biotechnology, quantum and many others).

You will be trained in role-specific analytic skills, including data analytics and foresight techniques. You will develop a deep understanding of the structure and decision-making processes of the Defence Department, to ensure your advice is tailored to have an impact. You will develop into a communications expert, able to concisely explain technical issues to busy, non-technical stakeholders. Outputs will include written reports, verbal briefings, multi-media and infographics. The role requires building networks across our own team of experts, as well as broader DSTG, Defence and intelligence.

About our Team

The technology analyst team is a part of the Defence Impacts of Emerging Technology (DIET) Group, within Strategy and Joint Force (SJF) Major Science and Technology Capability (MSTC), which is itself within the Joint and Operations Analysis Division of the Defence Science and Technology Group (DSTG).

This team is organised under DSTG’s Strategic Futures Project, and works closely with the Critical Technology Foresight (CTF) Group. You will be joining a project team of approximately 25 staff, including technology analysts (like this position), experts in tools and methods (such as AI experts who write programs to assist the analysts) and social scientists (who evaluate the impact of technology on society).

The Strategic Futures Project is a centre of gravity within government for emerging technology and foresight advice. Our advice feeds into decision-making, such as for senior Defence committees, the Department’s S&T portfolio planning and capability planning for the ADF. We play a key role in whole-of-government decision-making via our strong linkages to the Critical Technology Policy Coordination Office in PM&C. We partner with DSTG’s 2000 experts, across Defence, policy and intelligence agencies, and with international experts.

Our team is passionate, professional, welcoming and inclusive.

Our Ideal Candidate

We are seeking an Australian citizen who is naturally curious and motivated to develop broad expertise across diverse emerging technologies. Candidates from all S&T disciplines will be considered, but we especially seek experts in the physical sciences, engineering or systems analysis. We seek science-communicators who are passionate about making an impact for the nation. Ideally you will have experience in the APS, or have been responsible for leading and delivering projects in academia or industry. A pre-existing interest in Defence is not required, but you must be open to developing this.

S&T 5 level jobs are typically suitable for mid-career professionals rather than entry level jobs for graduates. You will have no formal responsibilities for supervising staff, but you will be expected to show leadership and take responsibility for driving outcomes and enhancing the capabilities of our team.

A PhD or equivalent qualifications/experience is required.

Application Closing date: Sunday the 29th of May 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, Reference DSTG/01524/22 on Link: https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=C698CB16-AE93-03B7-5F70-C88BA749F8D0

title: Finance Graduate Program
description:
Finance Graduates

We’re looking for our class of 2023 GRADUATES!

ACCIONA is a global organisation with a workforce of more than 38,500 top professionals, present in more than 40 countries across five continents. Leaders in Innovation, our goal is to make a positive contribution to society and to the planet, providing sustainable solutions to the most urgent issues such as global warming and water scarcity. Since establishing a presence in Australia in 2002, ACCIONA have invested more than AUD$1 billion through local investment opportunities and project development. As a national business ACCIONA Australia employs more than 3,000 people in its renewable energy, infrastructure, water and industrial projects across the country. We continually explore ways to exceed client expectations, while providing innovative solutions to complex problems.

We create a pipeline of future talent by building capacity and capability across our global business and it starts with our Graduates.

About our Graduate Program:

Working together with Graduates across the globe, our two-year Global Graduate Program provides structured and accredited training through ICADE Business School along with:

  • Hands-on work experience across at least two rotations;
  • Regular networking opportunities with subject matter experts and senior leaders.

We are looking for Finance Graduates in:

  • New South Wales
  • Queensland
  • South Australia; and
  • Victoria

Required Skills and Competencies / Eligibility Criteria

  • Relevant tertiary qualification (Commerce, Business, Finance, Accounting)
  • Good leadership, organisational and communication skills with the ability to develop, manage and maintain great relationships with a diverse range of internal and external stakeholders
  • High degree of passion and ambition
  • Mobility and flexibility to travel intrastate / interstate if required

We would love to hear from you, please click on the link below.

Applications close Friday 29 April 2022.

Please note, the next step in our recruitment process requires shortlisted candidates to complete a short video interview, and if successful at this stage, you will then be invited to attend an assessment centre. (please note this may be virtual)

ACCIONA has been given the Top Employer 2022 certification in Australia, which certifies the company's commitment to excellence in human resources management and those who focus on putting their people first through their exceptional HR policies.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and promote equality and diversity. Indigenous Australians and candidates from minority groups are encouraged to apply.

title: Rural Bank 2023 Graduate Program
description:
This is an opportunity to join Rural Bank, the agri specialist arm of the Bendigo and Adelaide Bank group. Setting the standard for banking and giving financial power back to our communities, Bendigo and Adelaide Bank was recently ranked in the top three most trusted brands in Australia. So come and work for a Bank you can be proud of.

Why choose Rural Bank for your Graduate Program experience?

We are committed to seeing our people thrive and development is in our DNA. During the Graduate Program you will have opportunities to interact with our Executive team, industry partners and our customers. Each experience is designed to allow you to learn and develop to become the best version of you.

We provide a personalised Graduate Program, tailored to suit you and your goals, whilst ensuring you enjoy a rounded experience across our Rural and Regional regions. That means you will be working with our dedicated team of Agribusiness Relationship Managers and Agribusiness Assistant Managers and more.

In addition, there are opportunities to travel across Australia working with teams from the Atherton Tablelands in Far North Queensland to Gippsland in Southern Victoria.

Our Graduate Program proposition

Successful graduates will join our rural business across Australia and participate in multiple rotations through the business. Rotations could involve travel throughout Australia. Whilst landing role availability may differ from state to state due to head office locations, we have a large agribusiness sales force throughout Australia which provides our graduates exciting landing role options for working directly with customers at the end of the 18 month program.

If you are looking for a program where you can be yourself and be exposed to exciting and challenging experiences, then this is the program for you. Your skills will be developed and refined through both on the job coaching and mentoring as well as in class room style learning environments.

The sky’s the limit: we will actively help you reach your potential through career pathways, skill development and providing you with unique project opportunities. You will form part of an established and constantly evolving program with a supportive graduate community.

Graduates can also look forward to:

  • An established and constantly evolving program with a supportive graduate community.
  • A permanent role post-program within Rural Bank.
  • Real work. To land a position within our business, you will undergo an exceptionally rigorous selection process. We do this to ensure you will succeed and will reach your potential. Since applying this methodology, we have maintained a 78 per cent retention rate.
  • Supportive rotation leaders who genuinely care about your development.
  • Community service leave

You will also receive:

  • A competitive starting salary plus superannuation, with advancement upon successful completion of the graduate program.
  • Relocation assistance if required to relocate throughout your program.
  • Access to our employee benefits program: discounts on product and services including home loans, credit cards, insurance, gym membership, travel and more.

What are we looking for?

We are looking for talented and motivated graduates who have completed their degree within the last three years and share our ambition to support and enable farmers to build vibrant businesses across Australia.

If you are energised by community engagement in all its forms and a self-starter who is motivated by challenges and new experiences, we might be the place for you. You will be committed to your own personal development and want to work in an environment where change is a constant. You won’t find two days the same. A genuine connection to the agricultural industry and its people is intrinsic to your success.

To read some of the experiences of our current graduates, check out our Graduate blogs here: https://www.ruralbank.com.au/about-us/graduate-program/meet-our-graduates/

Applications close: Sunday 15th May 2022

title: ACCC/AER 2023 Graduate Program (EA2022/1)
description:
• Join a Federal Government agency that has a great reputation
• Varied work
• Be part of projects that make a positive difference

Is the ACCC/AER Graduate Program on your wish list?

Congratulations! It’s time for you to start thinking about your career options for 2023 - you’re probably spending some time looking at all the major employers in the graduate market. Have you thought about working at the ACCC/AER?

The ACCC is an independent statutory authority that administers the Competition and Consumer Act 2010 and other Acts.

The ACCC works to promote effective competition and fair trading in the marketplace to benefit consumers, business and the community, and efficiency in the delivery of certain infrastructure services.

The ACCC shares staff, resources and facilities with the Australian Energy Regulator (AER). The AER is staffed by ACCC employees, but operates as a separate legal entity and has its own board. As well as other duties, the AER is responsible for the economic regulation of the wholesale electricity market and gas transmission networks.

Why the ACCC and AER?

The ACCC/AER is a great place to work because:

  • we have a great reputation and we are highly regarded for the work we do;
  • we have the opportunity to work on lots of different, exciting matters;
  • we can see the difference we are making in the Australian community, particularly through high-profile matters such as the NBN, electricity pricing, product safety financial services, digital platforms, the dairy industry, criminal cartels, consumer data and more;
  • we have a culture that encourages continuous development and diversity and employees who are highly engaged and passionate about what we do.

If you have tertiary qualifications, we believe you could be a good fit within the ACCC/AER and we’d encourage you to apply. This could be from any discipline, for example:

  • Arts and design
  • Business and government
  • Communications, public-relations and media
  • Data analysis and statistics
  • Economics
  • Education and social work
  • Finance and accounting
  • IT, computer science and technology
  • Law
  • Mathematics and engineering
  • Medicine, health and psychology
  • Science and humanities

Joining the ACCC/AER as a graduate, you can expect:

  • $64,616 per annum from 6 February 2023, advancing to $68,096 per annum from mid-May 2023, $73,978 in November 2023 and $82,511 upon successful completion of the program in June 2024.
  • challenging rotations across various Divisions
  • ongoing learning and development opportunities
  • flexible working conditions, including the ability to work part-time (minimum 30 hours per week) regular opportunities to network, socialise, share experiences and develop relationships;
  • an entry level program coordinator and assigned buddy;
  • a workplace that promotes diversity, inclusion and equal opportunity.

Want even more benefits?

In addition to the benefits of the graduate program, as an ongoing employee of the ACCC/AER you will also be eligible for:

  • an attractive remuneration package, including a base salary + 15.4% superannuation and annual salary reviews;
  • excellent leave benefits, including four weeks of annual leave and sick leave per year (pro-rated for part time employees), the opportunity to purchase additional annual leave and paid parental leave (after a qualifying period);
  • flexible working conditions, including options to work part-time and access to our flex scheme; and
  • ongoing career development, including chances to work in different ACCC/AER offices, opportunities for advancement and mobility within the organisation, formal and on-the job training programs and possibilities to participate in secondments with other APS agencies.

Need to know more?

Check out our Graduate Opportunities page for more information, including testimonies from some of our recent graduates.

How can you get involved?

We thought you’d never ask! Applications for our 2023 graduate program are now open. To find out more information about the ACCC/AER Graduate Program, our eligibility criteria and what we expect from our graduates, please download our candidate kit. The candidate kit will also provide you with information about the recruitment and selection process for the 2023 program.

Applications close 10 pm (AEST) Sunday 29 May 2022 . Assessment centres will take place in June, with offers made to successful applicants from August 2022.

Know someone who might be interested in a spot in our 2023 Graduate Program? Share this page with them – you never know, you might make their career!

title: Specialist, Pricing
description:
Company description:

READY FOR ANYTHING

At IAG, we live and work by our purpose to make your world a safer place. We are motivated by a unique culture that celebrates honesty, creativity, empathy, equity and collaboration. We call it the IAG way, and it means we all share a 'ready for anything' mindset that sets the tone for positive actions and positive outcomes. We put heart into everything we do which guides us to create amazing things for our customers, our people and our communities.

We're brimming with ideas, ambition and a readiness to apply bold thinking and risk awareness to make a difference where it matters most.

As the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand, we own some of the region's most trusted brands, including NRMA Insurance, CGU, SGIO, SGIC and WFI. We are ready for anything.



Job description:

  • Location - AU, National
  • Permanent Opportunity
  • Product, Pricing & Governance, Intermediated Insurance Australia

READY FOR ANYTHING

At IAG, we live and work by our purpose to make your world a safer place. We are motivated by a unique culture that celebrates honesty, creativity, empathy, equity and collaboration. We call it the IAG way, and it means we all share a ‘ready for anything' mindset that sets the tone for positive actions and positive outcomes. We put heart into everything we do which guides us to create amazing things for our customers, our people and our communities.


We're brimming with ideas, ambition and a readiness to apply bold thinking and risk awareness to make a difference where it matters most.


As the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand, we own some of the region's most trusted brands, including NRMA Insurance, CGU, SGIO, SGIC and WFI. We are ready for anything.

The Role

  • The purpose of the role and your unique contribution is to specialise in data driven analysis to enable IIA to charge the right premium for risk. You will be part of a team that designs, builds, implements, maintains and monitors technical pricing models and contributes to the derivation of go to market premium.
  • What you'll be doing
  • Guide and support the team in designing, constructing, deploying, monitoring and maintaining technical pricing models across IIA.
  • Guide the team to meet the agenda and strategy on the implementation and deployment of rigorous, fit-for-purpose technical pricing models and other technical analyses for IIA products.
  • Implement strategic and innovative commercial pricing initiatives to support the targets and aspirations set for IIA products.
  • Collaborate with Portfolio team to determine the book price position for IIA products and provide strategic and tactical commercial pricing advice.
  • Implement processes to active monitor of the performance of pricing strategies for the IIA products and contribute insights into broader Group and Divisional initiatives including budget setting.
  • Support and work collaboratively with the IIA Pricing - Technical, Strategy and Governance team, in building technical solutions, developing and executing strategies and initiatives, and maintaining strong governance and risk controls for all elem Implement appropriate and continuous monitoring and feedback loop in the pricing process.
  • Implement processes that adhere to and demonstrate compliance to Group governance policies.

Skills & Experience

  • Tertiary qualification in Actuarial Studies, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or other relevant technical disciplines.
  • Sound knowledge and experience in general insurance industry, ideally in pricing and/or commercial insurance, with 5+ years of experience.
  • Extensive experience in applying traditional actuarial/technical pricing methods for general insurance classes.
  • Proficient in programming with analytical software such as SAS, R, Python, VBA and SQL.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to effectively present and discuss complex information, analysis and findings to technical and non-technical audiences, using data visualisation as appropriate.

What's next?

Click ‘Apply' and start your career conversation with Talent Acquisition! Applications close on at 11:59pm on Sunday 1st May 2022.


IAG rewards and recognises its people with generous benefits, career development opportunities and real work-life balance. Employees also enjoy 13% superannuation, up to 50% insurance discounts, flexible work and leave options, generous parental leave and return to work programs, various corporate partner discounts and a people-focused culture that celebrates achievements big and small.


Creating a workforce that actively embraces diversity, inclusion and a sense of belonging is key to our success. We believe in treating everyone fairly which means that inclusion, removing barriers, striving for equity and embracing diversity are woven through our values and behaviours. We encourage applications from all backgrounds and communities and are committed to providing a work environment that enables you to thrive, whatever your circumstances. If we can provide support with access requirements, alternative work arrangements please advise us via your application.


IAG has committed to the reconciliation movement in Australia for First Nations people and focus on providing a safe and supportive work environment for all our employees. More information on our Reconciliation Action Plan can be found on our company website.

#MELB1 #BRIS1 #PERT1 #ADEL1

title: Senior Business Support Analyst
description:
Senior Business Support Analyst – 23668

  • Permanent
  • Lockleys, SA but open to Sydney, NSW

How will I Help?
As a Senior Business Support Analyst, you will be working with a variety of stakeholders across the Westpac Group, you will be responsible for driving and improving Mortgage Operations customer's experience through your reports, insights, and models. Within our team, you will work closely with other business owners, technical owners, data scientists, insights analysts, data analysts and business subject matter experts to deliver analytic products and projects. Your strong technical skills and ability to automate, wrangle, transform and present data into actionable insights and advice will ensure your success in this position.

What’s in it for me?
You’ll play a significant part of the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our purpose is helping Australians succeed. So we’ll back you in the development of your career, internal career prospects, and flexible working. You’ll also keep learning to grown, backed by a fantastic team of people with a can-do, supportive structure.

What do I need?
The ideal candidates should be passionate and curious about using analytics and data in different novel ways to help our business grow, have a curious, growth mindset, and be able to work in a high-impact fast environment.

Knowledge

  • Bachelor or post graduate qualification in Computer Science, Mathematics or Statistics preferred
  • A strong understanding of technology and business systems strategically and operationally
  • Knowledge of financial services and operation disciplines

Experience

  • 4+ years of experience in creating and maintaining dashboards, datasets and reports for business stakeholders.
  • Ability to extract actionable insights and create presentations for non-technical business stakeholders
  • technical solution design: ability to convert and explain business problems into technical specifications
  • Experience in collaborating with cross functional teams to deliver outcomes for business stakeholders. Ability to present and communicate to both technical and business stakeholders
  • Technical proficiency in the below domains:
    • analytics, data wrangling, ETL and understanding of analytical databases (not limited to)
      • Coding: SQL, SAS, Python, R, or other
      • Microsoft: Excel, VBA, Powerpoint, Power Platform
      • Database experience: Teradata, IBM DB2, Sybase
    • Visualisation and/or front end application development: Tableau, Qliksense/Qlikview, Power BI

Optional

  • Statistical and mathematical understanding in model building,
  • Cloud & Big Data: Azure/AWS, Spark, HBase, HDFS

What is it like to work there?
We aim to provide one big, supportive team of people who love helping others succeed. Working with us you'll discover new ways of working, and an exciting range of roles to showcase your skills. As an equal opportunity employer, we’re proud to have created a culture where people can be their best, in an environment that values diversity and flexibility. And one where everyone belongs.

How do I Apply?
Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.

As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.

The health and wellbeing of our employees is our top priority. We’ve developed clear standards to ensure our people are confident, safe and healthy whether they’re working from a Westpac Group site or working from home. These are based on expert medical advice and Safe Work Australia guidelines.

The Westpac Group has implemented an Entry to Workplace Policy that requires employees and others entering our workplaces to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by relevant dates set out in the policy (subject to applicable medical exemptions). Our employees are required to comply with the policy regardless of whether they are in customer-facing or non-customer-facing roles (as employees in non-customer-facing roles are required to attend the workplace under our Hybrid Working Strategy). Further, the Westpac Group is required to comply with State/Territory issued public health orders/directions which require relevant workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter workplaces.

By applying for this role, you acknowledge that you are aware of our Entry to Workplace Policy, and if you secure employment with us, you will be required to comply with the policy.

title: Analyst Programmer
description:
The South Australian Certificate of Education Board (SACE Board) of South Australia’s primary role is the provision of the South Australian Certificate of Education (SACE) to government, non-government and international schools.

Our purpose is to “shape education so that students thrive” which is achieved through working closely with our stakeholders to inspire, innovate and create the best outcomes for students and their communities so that SACE Graduates are capable to construct their own futures to contribute to a sustainable and socially just world.

The IMPACT you will drive at the SACE Board
The Analyst Programmer is accountable to the Applications Development Team Leader for contributing to the availability of relevant and effective information systems for the SACE Board of South Australia by developing, implementing and maintaining SACE applications. The Analyst Programmer will also provide leadership support to the Applications Development Team Leader.

What you will BRING

Essential Knowledge / Skills / Experience

  • Ability to communicate and negotiate effectively verbally and in writing with both technical and non-technical staff, including the presentation of comprehensive information and concepts to individuals and groups.
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively and collaboratively within and across teams in order to achieve agreed outcomes.
  • Proven ability to determine priorities, meet tight deadlines and produce high standard work under pressure.
  • Experience in development of web applications using Java/JEE and Java frameworks (such as Spring, Spring MVC and Hibernate) and experience with JavaScript, JSP, AJAX, CSS, XHTML and relational databases such as MS SQL.
  • Experience in all aspects of the software development lifecycle and proven ability to manage the initiation, development and implementation of application specific improvements and produce supporting technical documentation.
  • Proven ability to manage and control the release of software throughout the development lifecycle and into business operation.

Qualifications
An appropriate tertiary qualification in Information Technology or related discipline is desirable.

Special Conditions

  • Intrastate travel to regional and remote locations; international and interstate travel may be required.
  • A current driver’s licence is required.
  • Some out-of-hours work.
  • The incumbent works under the SACE Board of South Australia Act 1983 .
  • An intense time of activity within the SACE Board of South Australia occurs between October and December.  For some roles, the incumbent would not normally be able to take planned leave during this period.

Appointment is subject to a satisfactory working with children check obtained through the Department of Human Services to be renewed every 5 years before expiry.

What we can OFFER you!

  • A supportive and dynamic team environment that values the work that you do.
  • Professional development opportunities.
  • Salary Sacrifice Benefits.
  • Flexible work and wellbeing provisions.

Remuneration
ASO5 classification level.  Salary range $82,042 - $91,245 per annum.

APPLYING with Us

If you are passionate about young people and their education, we want to hear from you!

For further information including the role description and to apply, please go to www.iworkfor.sa.gov.au

ENQUIRIES to
Sam Godfrey, Applications Development Team Leader on 08 8115 4789 or sam.godfrey@sa.gov.au

Applications close: 25/05/2022 at 11:45pm

title: Analyst Programmer
description:
The South Australian Certificate of Education Board (SACE Board) of South Australia’s primary role is the provision of the South Australian Certificate of Education (SACE) to government, non-government and international schools.

Our purpose is to “shape education so that students thrive” which is achieved through working closely with our stakeholders to inspire, innovate and create the best outcomes for students and their communities so that SACE Graduates are capable to construct their own futures to contribute to a sustainable and socially just world.

The IMPACT you will drive at the SACE Board
The Analyst Programmer is accountable to the Applications Development Team Leader for contributing to the availability of relevant and effective information systems for the SACE Board of South Australia by developing, implementing and maintaining SACE applications. The Analyst Programmer will also provide leadership support to the Applications Development Team Leader.

What you will BRING

Essential Knowledge / Skills / Experience

  • Ability to communicate and negotiate effectively verbally and in writing with both technical and non-technical staff, including the presentation of comprehensive information and concepts to individuals and groups.
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively and collaboratively within and across teams in order to achieve agreed outcomes.
  • Proven ability to determine priorities, meet tight deadlines and produce high standard work under pressure.
  • Experience in development of web applications using Java/JEE and Java frameworks (such as Spring, Spring MVC and Hibernate) and experience with JavaScript, JSP, AJAX, CSS, XHTML and relational databases such as MS SQL.
  • Experience in all aspects of the software development lifecycle and proven ability to manage the initiation, development and implementation of application specific improvements and produce supporting technical documentation.
  • Proven ability to manage and control the release of software throughout the development lifecycle and into business operation.

Qualifications
An appropriate tertiary qualification in Information Technology or related discipline is desirable.

Special Conditions

  • Intrastate travel to regional and remote locations; international and interstate travel may be required.
  • A current driver’s licence is required.
  • Some out-of-hours work.
  • The incumbent works under the SACE Board of South Australia Act 1983 .
  • An intense time of activity within the SACE Board of South Australia occurs between October and December.  For some roles, the incumbent would not normally be able to take planned leave during this period.

Appointment is subject to a satisfactory working with children check obtained through the Department of Human Services to be renewed every 5 years before expiry.

What we can OFFER you!

  • A supportive and dynamic team environment that values the work that you do.
  • Professional development opportunities.
  • Salary Sacrifice Benefits.
  • Flexible work and wellbeing provisions.

Remuneration
ASO5 classification level.  Salary range $82,042 - $91,245 per annum.

APPLYING with Us

If you are passionate about young people and their education, we want to hear from you!

For further information including the role description and to apply, please go to www.iworkfor.sa.gov.au

ENQUIRIES to
Sam Godfrey, Applications Development Team Leader on 08 8115 4789 or sam.godfrey@sa.gov.au

Applications close: 25/05/2022 at 11:45pm
