title: Grad/PostGrad GIS Support Analyst - Adelaide/Canberra/Brisbane/Perth/Melbourne
description:
• Choose your location! Brisbane, Perth, Melbourne, Adelaide, or Canberra!
  • Get trained and upskilled to support our clients on the complete system for all their geospatial needs.
  • Multiple positions available - open to graduates & post-graduates, through to candidates with 2+ years of experience.

At Esri Australia we share a passion: for solving problems with Geographical Information Systems (GIS) and Enterprise technologies; for contributing to an ongoing geospatial conversation; and collaborating with our clients for a better future. As part of Esri Australia's expanding Client Care Team, you will play a pivotal role in making this vision a reality.

About the Team

Join our passionate application enthusiasts and technology specialists to contribute to our well-earned and highly respected team of troubleshooting and solution experts relied upon by a diverse client base. We are proud to support and contribute to ArcGIS solutions supporting both local, national, and even global projects. Our team members are passionate about the intersection of technology and geographic information systems. We are highly self-driven to grow our skillsets and enthusiastic in our approach to sharing our knowledge with colleagues. Various overlapping backgrounds and skillsets in the team foster plenty of opportunities to share your own expertise and learn from your peers. We strongly encourage you to apply if you have an enthusiasm for learning new technologies, GIS, problem solving, and knowledge sharing.

About the Role

As a GIS Support Consultant, you will deliver on our vision and service delivery principles of Ease, Expertise, Collaboration and Consistency, by providing technical software support and training to our clients, ensuring that our contact with clients delivers a user experience consistent with our client experience vision.

Key responsibilities of the role include:

  • Provide high-quality technical software support, training, and customer service to our Esri Australia end users.
  • Resolve technical issues by means of ArcGIS knowledge, specifically using ArcGIS Pro, ArcGIS Desktop and ArcGIS Online.
  • Work well in a high-energy, fast-paced, enthusiastic, positive, and collaborative culture.
  • Identify, understand, and articulate solutions for customer issues related to ArcGIS Pro, ArcGIS Desktop and ArcGIS Online using Esri tools and other related technologies.
  • Interfacing and providing high level assistance to key and strategic clients.
  • Assist in the development and maintenance of our service desk documentation ensuring that the documentation is accurate and of a high quality.
  • Being successful in this role involves being keen to learn more about geospatial technologies, desktop ArcGIS applications, and developing product knowledge across a suite of ArcGIS Products.

About You

  • You have recently graduated (BA preferred) in associated business disciplines (Geography, Geospatial Science, Remote Sensing and/or Surveying) or have relevant industry experience.
  • Experience working with ArcGIS Pro and/or ArcGIS Desktop and/or ArcGIS Online and other related technologies.
  • Excellent customer service and communication skills. You communicate well in both written and verbal medium. You can communicate effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • The ability to effectively demonstrate fault diagnosis and problem-solving skills; and communicate relevant issues and findings.
  • Dedicated to continuous learning; eager to learn and embrace new and emerging technologies.
  • Keen interest and ability to work collaboratively as part of a team.
  • Great attention to detail and time management skills.
  • Working rights - You must hold current permanent and full-time working rights in Australia.
  • Personality/ behaviour aligns with Esri Australia's core values.

About the Process

As part of the recruitment process we will require all applicants to provide a short video cover letter (approx. 3 minutes).

We ask you to post your video on an open source platform (e.g. Youtube, Upload through WeTransfer or else.)

You will need to update the URL through the application process through our Career Portal.

You should include the following information:

  • Your name and where you're from
  • Personal statement that describes your overall skills and abilites
  • What makes you qualified for the position
  • What you would bring to the team and the position

For further details or if you have any questions, please contact Chris Downie, Talent Acquisition Coordinator on 07 3218 0442 or mail to cdownie@esriaustralia.com.au .

We are a 2022 Circle Back Initiative Employer - we commit to respond to every applicant.

Please note that Esri Australia does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies.

title: Data and Performance Analyst
description:
About the Role

As an expert in data analytics and with a specialist knowledge of various business intelligence tools, you will analyse and interpret complex data sets to provide innovative solutions that support university-wide performance monitoring, decision-making and compliance reporting activities. You will design, develop, and manage projects to support strategic decision making, and continually review and improve a suite of core performance reports and data analysis tools that are aligned with the University’s strategy.

You will lead the development and implementation of a quality training program for professional and academic staff and be highly skilled in the presentation of multifaceted data sets to a range of audiences.

About UniSA

The University of South Australia is Australia’s University of Enterprise. Our culture of innovation is anchored around global and national links to academic, research and industry partners. Our graduates are the new urban professionals, global citizens at ease with the world and ready to create and respond to change. Our research is inventive and adventurous and we create new knowledge that is central to global economic and social prosperity.

Core Responsibilities

  • Analyse and interpret qualitative and quantitative data through the application of various business intelligence tools
  • Provide specialist advice on institutional and market information for strategic planning, institutional benchmarking, and university-wide performance measurement
  • Evaluate, prioritise, and respond to data requests from key internal and external stakeholders
  • Utilise a variety of methods and tools to interpret and present complex data and information to audiences at all levels
  • Develop and maintain effective business partnerships, using a consultancy approach


Essential Skills and Experience

  • Relevant tertiary qualification and experience in a relevant field, or an equivalent combination of relevant experience and/or education
  • Expertise in the use of Business Intelligence tools and statistical techniques
  • Ability to extract, manage and manipulate complex datasets
  • High level writing and presentation skills, and ability to present information in a clear and concise manner
  • Well-developed business partnership skills, with experience in negotiating and problem-solving with clients


Benefits

Getting a great job working with the best is just the start. UniSA rewards its staff with a wide variety of benefits such as:

  • Access to great personal development opportunities
  • Generous superannuation contributions of 17%
  • Flexible working conditions
  • Employee assistance and development programs
  • A range of salary packaging options, including vehicle leasing, laptops and car parking fees


Culture

As a University of Enterprise, we offer a dynamic and agile workplace culture, one that embraces challenges and thrives on breaking new ground. Our staff are creative and innovative thinkers, communicating with clarity, conviction and enthusiasm. We embrace diversity and inclusion in a vibrant, engaging environment. Our people are authentic, resilient, and influential, and we deliver results.

How to Apply

For a copy of the position description and to apply, please visit Working at UniSA. The online application form will list the specific selection criteria that you need to address.

Please address your cover letter to Jade Windsor, Senior Consultant: Recruitment Central . For further information about the position or the recruitment process, please contact UniSA Recruitment Central on +61 8 8302 1700 or via email at recruitment@unisa.edu.au using job reference number 4029 .

Applications close: 11.30pm Wednesday 1 June 2022

Applications welcomed from Australian or NZ citizens, Australian permanent residents and those who have the legal right to work in Australia for the term of appointment.

#LI-DNI

title: Demand Planning Analyst
description:
What’s the role?

In your role as a Demand Planning Analyst, you will play a vital role in ensuring our printed products are available at more than 15,000 retail outlets nationally.

  • Utilise historical sales data and insights to calculate the demand for News Corp Australia newspapers.
  • Support the demand planning function for BAU, holidays, promotions, and magazine allocations.
  • Liaise with the press sites to provide direction on weekly print volumes.
  • Manage relationships and effectively communicate with Field Sales, Logistics and Marketing.
  • Actively contribute to providing improvement to the demand planning process.
  • Role can be based in Adelaide, Brisbane, Melbourne or Sydney!

Who you are

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Comfortable working with large data sets.
  • Excellent proficiency using Microsoft Excel (knowledge of VBA is desired but not essential).
  • Positive, can-do attitude.
  • Results orientated with a proven track record of delivering above expectations.
  • Ability to work effectively with a variety of internal and external stakeholders.
  • Quantitative background, with a degree in Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline (desired).
  • Graduates may apply.

What’s in it for you?

  • A truly collaborative environment
  • Variety of work where no two days are the same
  • Work with some of Australia's most recognised and prestigious brands
  • Flexible / hybrid working arrangements
  • Employee discounts with multiple brands including JB Hi-Fi, Qantas, Apple, Samsung, Medibank Health Insurance and Commonwealth Bank, plus many more.
  • Corporate wellbeing program
  • Access to on-site gym facilities

Who are we?

We are Australia’s number one and most influential media organisation with more than 150 prestige brands across news, sport and lifestyle. Each month more than 17 million Australians choose to consume news and information from our digital and print products – more than any other media group in Australia.

What’s next?

Apply now or for more information on careers at News Corp Australia visit www.newscorpaustralia.com/careers

Diversity strengthens our national teams and newsroom as we seek to tell stories that represent the communities of Australia. Our people make us unique, and so we are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, religion, sexual orientation, age, disability or gender identity. Applicants of diverse backgrounds are encouraged to apply!

title: Fuel Pricing Analyst
description:
The Opportunity

The role of the fuel pricing analyst is to maximize fuel volume across the OTR retail network.  The purpose of the role is to conduct robust and insightful reporting and analysis to allow us to react quickly to changes in the market.  We use industry specific software and the successful applicant will be fully trained.

Who are we?

Peregrine Operate a substantial fuels business trading under the Reliable Petroleum and Mogas Regional brands.  Geographically we span across all of South Australia, Western Victoria the Northern Territory and Western Australia.  We have a diverse and well balanced business that supplies both B2B and B2C segments across Retail, Agri-Business, Fishing, Transport and Mining.

We manage our in-house company-owned delivery fleet which is complemented by a contractor fleet working across the country.  To complement our fuels business we also supply a full range of packaged lubricants and refuelling products including tanks and dispensing equipment.

For more information about Peregrine please visit our website www.peregrine.com.au

Key responsibilities include:

  • Driving and developing strategies for improved performance
  • Reviewing market conditions and ensuring data is gathered regularly and accurately
  • Becoming the go to person in the use and configuration of our software
  • Analysing fuel reconciliation data from sites and actioning accordingly
  • Logging issues and instigating corrective measures, closing the loop on any issues raised
  • Submitting reports to the GM of Fuels and ensuring procedures are accurate, current and comprehensive
  • Providing environmental governance of wet stock across the retail network

The successful candidate will possess:

  • A tertiary qualification in Finance, Mathematics, Economics or related discipline
  • Advanced MS office skills particularly Excel
  • Exceptional analytical skills with a keen eye for detail
  • Proven ability to meet deadlines and prioritise multiple tasks
  • Recent University graduates are encouraged to apply

What’s in it for you?

Where do we start? What’s important to you? What about this for starters…

  • A culture of care, reputation, equality and determination
  • Work with some of the brightest and best minds in Australia
  • Work with a modern ERP (Microsoft Navision)
  • Work in our (soon to be finished) renovated offices on the Parade, close to boutique shops and excellent cafés and restaurants
  • Be part of the growth story of an exceptional business
  • Build a career and drive your own future
  • A competitive salary package

If you want to talk to us about becoming part of the team, click “apply now” and upload your current CV and Cover letter…. What are you waiting for?

Please note only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

title: Workforce Planning Analyst
description:
ASC is Australia’s only established sovereign submarine company.  Our team of leading, submarine platform engineers, trades and professionals are committed to the delivery of an agile and potent submarine capability for the Royal Australian Navy.

About the Opportunity:

Workforce Planning Analyst will be supported by the Workforce Planning Team to plan, schedule and support various projects within ASC. They will be involved in making workforce recommendations, influencing key business decisions, and monitoring and assessing capability and capacity of the workforce to execute these programs. The position ensures that ASC has the right workforce information to make data driven resource decisions, and ensure ASC is able to meet its objectives by having the correctly skilled resources available at the right time

This position will be open to candidates from SA & WA.

Responsibilities:

Operating in a complex and diverse environment, this role requires a high degree of flexibility and responsiveness to support ad-hoc requests. Primary focus will be on program strategic planning, however based on requirements you may be asked to build operational plans to execute short to medium term objectives. The role will also involve working closely with key stakeholders to ensure a successful operational delivery of these plans.

The role would also utilise your ability to gain data on and assess current employment market conditions to give ASC insight into available resources for future recruitment campaigns.

This role requires the ability to work to deadlines that are often very tight while ensuring quality outcomes are provided with effective consultation in rapidly changing environments and priorities.

About you:

You are a commercially strong individual who is comfortable working with ambiguity and customer focused. Desire to succeed, willingness to roll up your sleeves, being a curious learner and having an agile mindset are paramount.

With your warm and engaging collaborative style, you are able to partner with the business and influence cross-functional stakeholders.

Desirable competencies and experiences:

  • Workforce or Data Analysis related Business, Engineering, Finance Degree or Diploma
  • Desirably at least 5 years or greater experience in Workforce planning or scheduling, however a graduate with the right skills and attitude could be a fit
  • Ability to effectively explore issues and develop successful solutions
  • Ability to influence senior internal and external stakeholders
  • Very good interpersonal communication skills
  • Previous experience working with and developing reporting and data analytics with a workforce planning focus
  • Knowledge and experience working in Workforce planning
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel and database management
  • Skill in Reporting & Data presentation in Power BI is desirable
  • Desirable knowledge in R or Python.

Eligibility and Requirements

The successful candidate must provide ASC with a current National Police Clearance prior as well as be eligible for an Australian Defence Security Clearance.  Access protected US Defence Technology will be taken into account in assessing an applicant's suitability for this role.

ASC also requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to ensure the safety and wellbeing of our people. If you are applying for a role at ASC please consider this new requirement when submitting your application. ASC will also adhere to any relevant health directives that may be made that affects our workforce.

About our offer

We offer more than just a challenging and rewarding career.  We have put together a range of programs, initiatives and benefits that help empower our employees to reach their personal and professional goals to ensure their career with us is both challenging and rewarding.

  • Staff training and leadership development programs
  • Additional 2 weeks of leave
  • Paid parental leave
  • Salary sacrificing options
  • Paid defence reservist leave
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Onsite cafeteria & parking

About ASC

With more than 1,300 employees based at two world-class facilities in South Australia and Western Australia, ASC has the expertise and resources unparalleled within Australia’s defence industry.

At ASC we not only offer challenging and rewarding work on Australia’s Collins Class submarines, we provide programs, initiatives and benefits that ensure our people reach their true potential.

After 35 years building Australia’s submarine industrial base, ASC is now diversifying our business activities, forging new partnerships and initiatives and helping to deliver successful submarine programs in Australia, Europe and North America.

The opportunities are endless, and it has never been a more exciting time to come on board.

ASC is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunities employer that provides an environment that encourages diversity and inclusion in all of its forms.

title: Developer
description:
Bravura is looking for an ambitious developer with a strong passion for developing and cementing your career within the Fintech software development services industry.

Form an integral member of the Transactional Services team alongside Developers, Business Analysts, and Technical Consultants, you will develop modern cloud-native solutions to meet business requirements using a range of technologies using agile methodologies.

Reporting to the Practice Lead will assist with breaking down large business and technical problems, solving them systematically, crafting and testing high quality, maintainable and efficient code to meet our industry-leading, international customer requirements.

With a can-do attitude, you will gain exposure to all elements of the software development lifecycle (SDLC). A typical day will also involve some of the following activities:

  • Beginner level software development and coding for Babel messaging and the ePASS employer portal
  • Contribute to developing and executing effective unit and function tests of all software changes
  • Provide assistance as required to other Developers, Business and Test Analysts
  • Undertake troubleshooting and problem solving of software defects and application issues
  • Debug code to identify and rectify defects or data issues
  • Provide technical assistance and support to Bravura clients as and when required
  • Assist with software builds and the preparation and delivery of releases
  • Effective participation in team and project meetings and proactive identification and communication of issues and improvements.

Skills that will help you succeed in this role:

  • You will have completed a Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Computer Science
  • Achieved strong academics with the desire to accelerate your career in a software development
  • You’re a natural at solving problems and have several personal projects on the side
  • You're a good team player and demonstrate a willingness and aptitude for continuous self-learning and are proactive in developing new skills
  • Good working knowledge of a modern, general-purpose, object-oriented programming language

Other desirable skills include:

  • SQL, Entity-Relationship (ER) design, and Relational Databases concepts
  • Object-Oriented design and development methods and practices
  • Application containerization and cloud knowledge including Docker and Kubernetes
  • Familiarity with Web Services – SOAP and/or RESTful APIs
  • Good working knowledge of JavaScript, HTML, CSS & modern web UI frameworks (e.g. Angular)
  • Code refactoring and use of design and code patterns
  • Source Control using and Subversion and GIT
  • Knowledge of relevant Operating System tools, utilities and commands

What we offer you:

  • Our people are the heart of our business. We work hard to provide a rich employee experience and a strong framework for ongoing career development.
  • Flexible hybrid ways of working
  • Value-driven leave offerings; parental, volunteer, and study leave amongst others
  • Access to well-being support, for you and your family
  • Competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits scheme
  • Newly renovated offices that inspire Agile and collaborative ways of working
  • Ongoing opportunities to develop your commercial and technical skills working with international clients

About Bravura Solutions

At Bravura Solutions, collaboration, diversity, and excellence matter. We value your ideas, giving you room to be curious and innovate in an exciting, fast-paced, and flexible environment.

As a market leader and ASX-listed company, we are a trusted partner to over 350 leading financial services clients. We invest significantly in our technology hubs and innovation labs, which inspire and drive our creative, future-focused mindset. We take pride in developing cutting-edge technology solutions that support our clients to achieve financial security and prosperity for their customers.

How to apply?

If you are interested in joining an ASX-listed fintech powering the world’s leading financial institutions, we would love to hear from you so apply online today. Please submit a copy of your transcript if a recent graduate along with your resume and if you have a GitHub account, we would love you to include this in your resume.

title: Senior Learning & Capability Specialist
description:
• Key role as Subject Matter Expert
  • Dynamic ASX Listed Energy company
  • Competitive package and benefits

Beach Energy is looking for an experienced Learning & Capability Specialist to work with our technical, office and site-based teams to assess and elevate organisational capability.

Can you translate the organisational business objectives and diagnostics into contemporary learning frameworks for our people to reach their potential and remain compliant in role? Can you connect to our site-based teams and senior leadership to implement competency frameworks, facilitate training programs, or find innovative ways to ensure our teams have access to the right development opportunities? If so, then this is the opportunity for you.

About the Role

As key member of the Organisational Development function, your role is in a team who leads Diversity, Inclusion, Wellbeing, Resourcing, Graduate and Apprentice Pathways, Talent and Succession programs and the training learning and development specialist area. Our team whilst small, will work with you to deliver together as One Beach Team.

The Beach learning team has in place a matured Learning Management System (SuccessFactors) and contemporary online offerings linked to technical or professional development plans and goals.

The opportunity for this role is to focus on using SuccessFactors or other diagnostic tools to build a two-year training needs analysis plan and lead multiple specialist learning projects that support site-based competency matrices, as aligned to the organisational strategy and employee career goals.

This role relies on your lateral thinking and the use of factual data to support tapping into your creative side for solutions on design and facilitation.

Key responsibilities will include:

  • Lead multiple learning projects to support site and office-based employees.
  • Design and facilitate high-quality, contemporary learning experiences for Beach employees, applying best practise adult learning design principles.
  • Lead the development of training needs analysis, training calendar and its successful deployment to the organisation.
  • Creating and identifying learning course content that enhances retention and builds the capability of leadership and technical progression for Beach employee careers.
  • Facilitating regular training review meetings with technical discipline leads, General Managers or Executives to forecast training requirements.
  • Maximising the potential of SuccessFactors, (or other Learning Management System), modules to support our learner experience and drive continuously improved user experience.
  • Building key stakeholder relationships as part of diagnosing capability requirements and providing OD service offerings to the business.
  • Undertaking employee and organisational data analysis as part of determining longer term strategic learning needs.
  • Maintain existing competency frameworks per discipline and govern the automation of those moving to SuccessFactors.
  • Partner with your Human Resources team to consult with employees on learning opportunities.
  • Build strong relationships and industry partnerships with external bodies.

About You

We operate in a fast-paced dynamic environment, so you will have the ability to prioritise, build strong stakeholder relationships at all levels and anticipate the needs of the business. You will be a natural problem solver, and keen analyst, and an engaging facilitator.

  • Significant experience as a Learning designer, creation of training needs analysis and competency matrices.
  • Ability to think critically, analyse, and interpret complex data and data structures.
  • Strong analytical skills and the ability to problem solve complex scenarios including the identification of root causes and recommendation for corrective / preventative action.
  • Demonstrated experience with relevant software packages including Learning Management Systems (LMS) such as SuccessFactors.
  • Relevant tertiary qualification in Business (Human Resources) or Adult Learning or equivalent with a minimum of 10 years of experience in a learning and development function in a multi-disciplinary organisation.
  • Strong written and verbal communications skills.
  • Proven ability to build highly effective consultative and collaborative relationships.
  • Experience designing or curating content for a variety of audiences including front line employees and leaders as well as diverse learners.
  • Previous experience with SuccessFactors (or other LMS), Articulate, Excel and PowerBI.
  • Demonstrated ability to identify organisational learning needs and develop strategies and associated plans.
  • Demonstrated experience in the development, implementation, and evaluation of effective and contemporary learning programs.
  • Proven ability to collaborate and consult to obtain relevant information from subject matter experts.

About Us

Beach Energy is a proud South Australian, Energy exploration and production company headquartered in Adelaide. For more than 60 years, Beach has operated onshore and offshore, oil and natural gas production across South Australia, Western Australia, Victoria, and New Zealand.

We seek to deliver long-term value to our shareholders, and focus on the safety of our people, their work environment, and the sustainability of our practices and environment we work in.

Working with Beach, you will make a difference in the delivery of key oil and gas projects within a growth organisation.

At Beach our values govern our decisions and interactions. Our values are Safety, Creativity, Respect, Integrity, Performance and Teamwork .

How to Apply

Beach is committed to improving gender diversity and Indigenous participation; we encourage all applications.

Please submit your cover letter and updated CV by 24 May 2022.

For this opportunity you must be an Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident.

To keep our community safe, candidates are required to comply with COVID related state specific public health orders.

title: IT Support Assistant
description:
Our Company

Weber is the Global market leading barbecue brand. It brings with it a rich history, a reputation for high quality products and service, and some of the most engaged and passionate fans and advocates. By bringing food, flavour, friends and family together around the barbecue for over 40 years in Australia, Weber has become an iconic, trusted and loved brand in Australia and New Zealand.

Our Aim is to build Weber’s brand equity through the creation of “positive word of mouth”.

We achieve this by providing exceptional experiences to everyone who comes into contact with the Weber brand, whether they are suppliers, partners, retail customers or Weber owners.

The Role

Working in the IT team, you will work alongside Project Managers, Business Analysts and System Administrators to create and maintain the systems that keep Weber products moving through our network of dealers nationwide and into people’s backyards.

As the business transitions from on premise to cloud solutions, we are looking to add a technical problem solver to assist with the support of multiple business systems across Finance, Logistics, Human Resources, Customer Service, Operations and Retail.

You will be involved in configuring, testing, maintaining and supporting a range of business systems. Collaborating with the IT team and business stakeholders to create efficient, accurate and user-friendly processes, powering the Weber brand.

You

To be the successful applicant you will need to highlight your problem-solving skills, working across a range of hardware and software platforms.

The role will suit a current contractor or self-employed IT professional looking to focus and hone their skills, or a recent graduate looking to commence their career.

Key attributes we are seeking include:

Being able to highlight previous experience with configuring, updating, and supporting business software applications and hardware.

Strong communication and troubleshooting skills.

Customer centric mindset.

Strong time management and prioritisation skills

Tertiary Qualifications in either Technology, Computer Science and Computer Systems or similar is highly desirable.

If this sound likes the job for you please apply with your cover letter and resume.

title: Product and Customer Success Coordinator
description:
• Join an innovative, flexible & family-friendly team in this permanent full-time role
  • Generous salary + incentives with excellent benefits
  • Ongoing professional development & training opportunities

An exciting opportunity to join a hi-tech, fast-growing agritech company and enjoy a regional lifestyle in the beautiful Barossa Valley!

About the Opportunity

For this rare industry opportunity, using industry data & customer-specific insights, you will oversee the development of unique, world-leading precision viticulture tools on the online platform that utilises the latest developments in machine learning and satellite technology. Building on your industry experience, you will perform market research, analyse market data, and identify consumer behaviour and trends to inform long-term product strategy.

As Deep Planet’s Product & Customer Success Coordinator you will monitor product performance and create policies and procedures that optimize the customer experience, ultimately building customer relationships that promote retention and loyalty. As a pivotal part of the team, you will provide product demonstrations and deep technical support, enabling customers to optimise their vineyard management process through effective utilisation of Deep Planet’s precision viticulture tools, generating increased profits for the Australian wine industry and reducing its environmental footprint.

Using your strong relationship building skills, you will gather feedback and insights that inform Deep Planet’s product roadmap, helping to build a world-leading precision viticulture platform!

In addition to the above, as the Product and Customer Success Coordinator, your responsibilities include:

  • Writing user stories and other feature descriptions for the engineering team and maintaining a prioritised product backlog based on business and customer impact
  • Documenting value proposition information and supporting marketing and sales efforts with written content
  • Taking on a pro-active role in potential client evaluation based on their needs and Deep Planet’s unique tech capabilities
  • Working directly with the client and their technical team to determine objectives, milestones, and deliverables with regards to initial integration and rollout plans
  • Delivering client insights and drawing on internal resources to deliver best possible results to clients (sales, marketing, product, engineering and research)
  • Deep-dive technical assistance for customers; including conducting screen share sessions with customers to guide them through installations, tech evaluations as well as resolving technical issues with high customer satisfaction
  • Analysing quantitative information from products to gather information on product usage

The full Job Description has been made available for you to view/download once you select 'Apply Now'.

About You

With environmental benefit front of mind, you have a desire to make a positive impact on the industry and the planet. You could be a recent viticulture or plant science graduate, someone with a strong agricultural background, a data or business analyst, or someone who is eager to be a part of the agtech community and help contribute to the building of the agriculture technology of tomorrow!

We are looking for passionate candidates that may bring:

  • Organized, personable, and tech-savvy with background knowledge of the agritech industry, satellite technology and artificial intelligence
  • Data-centric mindset and strong analytical skills
  • Creative thinker with the ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills to convey highly technical concepts to a variety of audiences

About Our Client

Deep Planet is a global Agri Tech startup that was born out of the vision of world-class scientists and engineers from Oxford University.

Deep Planet are focused and creative thinkers with a goal to use Machine Learning for the benefit of the Planet. In 2018, Deep Planet was founded from an idea to address environmental risk. The founding team has more than 15 years of experience starting and scaling deep technology companies worldwide.

Their product, VineSignal, assists winemakers and growers to manage and predict vine health, yield, maturity and irrigation. It allows for improved management practices in the vineyard that reduce cost of production, improve quality and enhances efficiency to maximise commercial returns.

We've shared the client's name to help you assess your suitability for the role.  Please DO NOT contact them directly.

Apply Now!

If you have any queries please email humans(at)humanologyrecruit.com.au in the first instance, or call 1300 2 HUMAN.

To apply, please ensure you click the Apply button , upload a CV and cover letter contained in one document.  Please do not email your CV .  All applications MUST be made online. The position description is also available to download when you click 'apply'.

Please Note:  Our recruitment process will keep you regularly informed of the progress of your application.  Please ensure that you check your email for updates (including your junk mail folder).  Applications will remain open until a suitable candidate is appointed.

title: Risk Advisory - Data & Analytics - 2022/23 Graduate Program (Adelaide)
description:
Job Requisition ID: 27675

  • Start your career with Australia’s most impactful risk advisory team and be empowered and trusted to build your skills on real client work and purpose led transformation projects at some of Australia’s most significant organisations
  • Be part of Australia’s largest cohort of graduates – meaning you’ll have a community of other grads to lean on and learn from!
  • Join an organisation recognised for its commitment to diversity and wellbeing in the workplace, and where making an impact that matters is our goal

You love working with numbers and large data sets (the more unstructured – the better!). In Data and Analytics (Adelaide), we help clients navigate risks and capture opportunities with insights from their data.

What will you get to do?
With a focus in the Adelaide market and working with leaders across the Deloitte network as part of the new centre for innovation and technology. Your passion for all things data and numbers will help deliver solutions to our clients whilst developing meaningful insights with our clients and network of talented specialists.
On a typical project, you’ll start off by sourcing and preparing data for analysis. Then, you’ll dive deep into the data using software like Excel, SQL and statistical modelling and visualisation software such as SAS, SPSS, R, Tableau and Power BI. Don’t fret, you'll have 100% support from the team as you pick up these new skills! Once you’ve discovered hidden data insights, you’ll get to develop tailored recommendations and solutions for the client. Pretty cool, right?
Working with our team you will apply Deloitte best practice data tools and techniques for use cases such as Risk Analytics, Financial Services, Cyber Security, Business Analytics, Operational intelligence and IoT.

Your future starts with us.
At Deloitte, diversity in our teams make us unique and supports our aspiration of making an impact that matters to our clients and teams, in this team you will gain exposure to a number of areas: -

  • Data analytics and insights
  • Data engineering
  • Big data, artificial intelligence and machine learning
  • Data quality and integration
  • Data management and governance
  • Enterprise data warehouse design and implementation
  • Cloud-based modern data platforms
  • Complex, large-scale data programs

Enough about us, let’s talk about you.
You are an inquisitive student with a knack for solving complex problems. You may also have:

  • Bachelor degree or higher qualification in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Commerce, IT, Computer Science or equivalent fields
  • Great attention to detail
  • Strong interpersonal skills and thrive in collaborative environments
  • A passion for data analysis and presenting data for visual impact
  • Not essential but desirable knowledge in SQL, SAS, Python, Power BI, Tableau, or other programming languages

Why Deloitte?
At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.
We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive.
We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress – check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space.

Next Steps
Sound like the sort of role for you? Apply now.

By applying to this job, you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte employee experience globally.

At Deloitte, we know we’re at our best when we look out for one another; prioritise respect, fairness, development and wellbeing; foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of their background, experience, identity, ability or thinking style, and if you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process for accessibility reasons this is available upon request.

The preferred candidate will be subject to background screening by Deloitte or by their external third-party provider.

title: Demand Planning Analyst
description:
• Be part of a high performing and collaborative team.
  • An opportunity to innovate, challenge the norm and pioneer the way forward.
  • Work with some of Australia's most recognised and prestigious brands.

What’s the role?

In your role as a Demand Planning Analyst, you will play a vital role in ensuring our printed products are available at more than 15,000 retail outlets nationally.

  • Utilise historical sales data and insights to calculate the demand for News Corp Australia newspapers.
  • Support the demand planning function for BAU, holidays, promotions, and magazine allocations.
  • Liaise with the press sites to provide direction on weekly print volumes.
  • Manage relationships and effectively communicate with Field Sales, Logistics and Marketing.
  • Actively contribute to providing improvement to the demand planning process.
  • Role can be based in Adelaide, Brisbane, Melbourne or Sydney!

Who you are

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Comfortable working with large data sets.
  • Excellent proficiency using Microsoft Excel (knowledge of VBA is desired but not essential).
  • Positive, can-do attitude.
  • Results orientated with a proven track record of delivering above expectations.
  • Ability to work effectively with a variety of internal and external stakeholders.
  • Quantitative background, with a degree in Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline (desired).
  • Graduates may apply.

What’s in it for you?

  • A truly collaborative environment
  • Variety of work where no two days are the same
  • Work with some of Australia's most recognised and prestigious brands
  • Flexible / hybrid working arrangements
  • Employee discounts with multiple brands including JB Hi-Fi, Qantas, Apple, Samsung, Medibank Health Insurance and Commonwealth Bank, plus many more.
  • Corporate wellbeing program
  • Access to on-site gym facilities

Who are we?

We are Australia’s number one and most influential media organisation with more than 150 prestige brands across news, sport and lifestyle. Each month more than 17 million Australians choose to consume news and information from our digital and print products – more than any other media group in Australia.

What’s next?

Apply now or for more information on careers at News Corp Australia visit www.newscorpaustralia.com/careers

Diversity strengthens our national teams and newsroom as we seek to tell stories that represent the communities of Australia. Our people make us unique, and so we are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, religion, sexual orientation, age, disability or gender identity. Applicants of diverse backgrounds are encouraged to apply!

title: Advance Technology Foresight Analyst EL 1 (S&T Level 5)
description:
The Role

The Defence Science and Technology Group (DSTG) is offering two permanent positions as an Advanced Technology Foresight Analyst.

You will develop a sound understanding of a broad range of technologies, including current technologies and those that may be developed in the future. You will work with planners and operations analysts to foresee how these technologies might strengthen or weaken Australia’s national interests.

One position, located in Canberra, will focus on national security and the way it may operate in the future, including foreseeing disruptions or entirely new concepts of operations. The other position, located in Melbourne will focus on Defence capabilities, including foreseeing disruptions or entirely new capabilities. Although the positions are based in Canberra and Melbourne, we are open to the idea of having our candidate work from our in Edinburgh, SA.

The role involves desk-based technical research and analysis as part of a large team responsible for providing emerging technology and foresight advice to Defence and other government departments. You will be responsible for a technical area that corresponds to your current S&T skills, and will broaden your expertise into a range of fields relevant to Defence (for example AI, cyber, biotechnology, quantum and many others).

You will be trained in role-specific analytic skills, including data analytics and foresight techniques. You will develop a deep understanding of the structure and decision-making processes of the Defence Department, to ensure your advice is tailored to have an impact. You will develop into a communications expert, able to concisely explain technical issues to busy, non-technical stakeholders. Outputs will include written reports, verbal briefings, multi-media and infographics. The role requires building networks across our own team of experts, as well as broader DSTG, Defence and intelligence.

About our Team

The technology analyst team is a part of the Defence Impacts of Emerging Technology (DIET) Group, within Strategy and Joint Force (SJF) Major Science and Technology Capability (MSTC), which is itself within the Joint and Operations Analysis Division of the Defence Science and Technology Group (DSTG).

This team is organised under DSTG’s Strategic Futures Project, and works closely with the Critical Technology Foresight (CTF) Group. You will be joining a project team of approximately 25 staff, including technology analysts (like this position), experts in tools and methods (such as AI experts who write programs to assist the analysts) and social scientists (who evaluate the impact of technology on society).

The Strategic Futures Project is a centre of gravity within government for emerging technology and foresight advice. Our advice feeds into decision-making, such as for senior Defence committees, the Department’s S&T portfolio planning and capability planning for the ADF. We play a key role in whole-of-government decision-making via our strong linkages to the Critical Technology Policy Coordination Office in PM&C. We partner with DSTG’s 2000 experts, across Defence, policy and intelligence agencies, and with international experts.

Our team is passionate, professional, welcoming and inclusive.

Our Ideal Candidate

We are seeking an Australian citizen who is naturally curious and motivated to develop broad expertise across diverse emerging technologies. Candidates from all S&T disciplines will be considered, but we especially seek experts in the physical sciences, engineering or systems analysis. We seek science-communicators who are passionate about making an impact for the nation. Ideally you will have experience in the APS, or have been responsible for leading and delivering projects in academia or industry. A pre-existing interest in Defence is not required, but you must be open to developing this.

S&T 5 level jobs are typically suitable for mid-career professionals rather than entry level jobs for graduates. You will have no formal responsibilities for supervising staff, but you will be expected to show leadership and take responsibility for driving outcomes and enhancing the capabilities of our team.

A PhD or equivalent qualifications/experience is required.

Application Closing date: Sunday the 29th of May 2022

For further information please review the job information pack, Reference DSTG/01524/22 on Link: https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=C698CB16-AE93-03B7-5F70-C88BA749F8D0
